title: The Cheap Trick Alphabet Is Using To Boost Its Share Price
summary: Alphabet's 20-for-1 stock split, following similar moves by Apple and Tesla, is unlikely to fundamentally change the company's valuation but aims to make shares more accessible to smaller investors and potentially gain entry into the Dow Jones Industrial Average. While some tech giants saw significant share price boosts post-split, Alphabet's future success might be tempered by changing market conditions. The article suggests Amazon could be the next tech giant to undertake a similar split to boost its stock.

title: Biggest Gains in Social Responsibility in the Management Top 250
summary: Tesla Inc. showed the biggest increase in social responsibility scores in the Management Top 250, followed by Tractor Supply Co. and Akamai Technologies Inc. Despite this gain, Tesla still holds the lowest social responsibility score among the top 10 gainers in this category. The Management Top 250 ranking, developed by the Drucker Institute, assesses corporate effectiveness across various criteria including social responsibility.

title: Elon Musk’s lawyers argue recordings of him touting Tesla Autopilot safety could be deepfakes, so a judge is bringing him in to clarify in testimony
summary: A California judge ordered Elon Musk to testify under oath regarding videos where he promotes Tesla's Autopilot safety, after his lawyers suggested some recordings could be deepfakes. The judge found it "deeply troubling" that Tesla wouldn't rule out the possibility of altered clips being used as evidence in a wrongful death lawsuit. Musk's testimony will be limited to authenticating his appearance in these videos, not the substance of his statements, and he can do so virtually from Texas.

title: Geely's Zeekr raises US $750m funding for global development of EV solutions
summary: Geely's premium electric mobility brand, Zeekr, has successfully raised $750 million in Series A funding, bringing its valuation to $13 billion. The investment, including from Contemporary Amperex Technology Ltd (CATL), will be used to accelerate the global development of Zeekr's EV technologies and expand its market footprint into Europe. This funding round is seen as a vote of confidence in Zeekr's growth prospects, as the company aims to compete with brands like Tesla and Nio.

title: Sony Honda Mobility Inc’s Afeela EV Will Challenge Tesla
summary: Sony Honda Mobility Inc.'s new Afeela EV aims to compete with Tesla by combining Sony's expertise in entertainment, networking, and sensors with Honda's car manufacturing capabilities. The Afeela EV will feature 45 sensors, 5G connectivity, and regular updates, much like Tesla vehicles. The joint venture has also partnered with Qualcomm and Epic Games to enhance the user experience and plans to launch its first models in North America and Japan in 2026.

title: Tesla won over fans of electric vehicles. Now Elon Musk and company have a bigger challenge: convincing everyday car buyers
summary: Tesla, coming off a record delivery year in 2023 driven by early adopters and fans, now faces the challenge of appealing to everyday car buyers. The company needs to overcome hurdles like inflation, high interest rates, charging infrastructure concerns, and increasing competition, while also dealing with potential loss of federal EV tax credits for some models. Despite an aging product lineup, Tesla is leveraging strategies like price reductions, model refreshes, and increased marketing efforts to broaden its market appeal.

title: Tempering expectations for automated driving
summary: This article argues that expectations for fully autonomous driving need to be tempered, advocating for a focus on achievable Level 4 highway automation before tackling the complexities of general urban self-driving. It suggests that companies should prioritize current technological capabilities to build consumer confidence and drive sales, rather than over-promising future full autonomy. The author believes a phased, practical engineering approach will lead to full automation over a longer timeline, emphasizing the need for infrastructure upgrades and government-business partnerships for city driving.

title: Apple's stock underperformed top tech peers in 2023 due to longest revenue slide in 22 years
summary: Apple's stock underperformed its mega-cap tech peers in 2023, experiencing its longest revenue slide in 22 years with four consecutive quarters of declining sales. This decline was attributed to a combination of a weak economic environment for smartphones and PCs, and company-specific issues such as the lack of new iPad models and an Apple Watch sales ban. Despite a 49% stock rally for the year, Apple lagged behind competitors like Nvidia, Meta, Tesla, Amazon, Alphabet, and Microsoft.

title: TSLP Financial Statements & Charts - Kurv Etf Trust - Kurv Yield Premium Strategy Tesla (tsla) Etf MacroTrends
summary: This article provides financial statements and charts for the Kurv ETF Trust - Kurv Yield Premium Strategy Tesla (TSLA) ETF, traded under the ticker TSLP, available on MacroTrends via the CMLViz platform. It includes current market data for TSLP, along with broader market indices like SPX, Dow 30, QQQ, and VIX. The content appears to be a stub or a landing page from a financial data service.

title: Lithium and EV Market Update: Slower-Than-Expected Sales Growth Just a Bump in the Road
summary: The EV market experienced slower-than-expected sales growth in 2023, primarily due to market dynamics in China and elevated consumer costs, leading to a softening of lithium prices. Despite these challenges, EV adoption remains strong, with key pillars supporting its growth still intact. The article maintains a positive outlook for the specialty chemical and the EV revolution, expecting continued growth in the coming years.

title: Blackboxstocks to acquire UK-based Evtec Aluminium by Q1 2024
summary: Dallas-based Blackboxstocks Inc. has agreed to acquire UK-based Evtec Aluminium Limited, with the acquisition expected to close in Q1 2024. Evtec, a supplier of essential components for the EV and luxury automotive markets, has a growing order book and plans for significant expansion, including future acquisitions and a U.S. launch. The merger will see Blackbox stockholders retain a significant interest and a contingent value right for their fintech operations, while Evtec will maintain operational control and strategic growth plans.

title: The second generation of Tesla's humanoid robot Optimus is here! Lose 20 pounds, do squats, and be able to “bungee jump”, more like a real person!
summary: Tesla has unveiled its second-generation humanoid robot, Optimus Gen 2, showcasing significant improvements in appearance, anthropomorphic activities, and physical capabilities. The new model is lighter, faster, and features enhanced dexterity, including the ability to handle delicate objects with improved tactile perception. Tesla CEO Elon Musk believes Optimus robots will eventually account for the majority of Tesla's long-term value, with an expected price under $20,000 and millions of units in production within 3-5 years.

title: Tesla's second-generation robot is here! Flexibility has greatly increased, and you can also pinch eggs with two fingers...
summary: Tesla has unveiled its second-generation Optimus robot, showcasing significant advancements in flexibility, speed, and control. The new model features an 11-degree of freedom dexterous hand with tactile sensors on each finger, allowing for delicate tasks like pinching an egg. This iteration marks a shift towards enhanced movement and perception, with a focus on refined hardware and software upgrades, prompting industry interest in core hardware components and materials.

title: Tesla’s Dojo Supercomputer Head Exits in Blow to Efforts
summary: Ganesh Venkataramanan, the head of Tesla's Dojo supercomputer project, has left the company after five years, posing a significant setback to the automaker's self-driving technology endeavors. Peter Bannon, a long-time Tesla director and former Apple executive, has taken over leadership of the project. This departure comes as Tesla plans to invest over $1 billion in Dojo by the end of 2024, a project analysts believe could add $500 billion to Tesla's valuation.

title: Did Tesla Retaliate Against Employees for Opposing Harassment?
summary: A federal lawsuit, EEOC v Tesla, Inc., alleges that Tesla tolerated widespread racial harassment against its black employees at its Fremont, California facilities between 2015 and 2023. The lawsuit further claims that Tesla retaliated against employees who opposed this harassment, with evidence suggesting various forms of workplace retaliation. The EEOC is seeking compensatory and punitive damages, back pay, and injunctive relief to reform Tesla's employment practices.

title: Deere must face US farmers' 'right-to-repair' lawsuits, judge rules
summary: A U.S. judge has ruled that Deere & Co must face consolidated lawsuits from farmers accusing the agricultural machinery maker of unlawfully conspiring to restrict maintenance and repair services. The judge rejected Deere's arguments for dismissal, stating that the plaintiffs met the legal thresholds to pursue their antitrust claims. This case is part of a broader "right-to-repair" movement challenging restrictive repair practices across various industries.

title: Webull Corporation Reports Strong Q3 Earnings and Growth
summary: Webull Corporation reported strong Q3 earnings, showcasing a 55% year-over-year revenue increase to $156.9 million and customer assets reaching $21.2 billion. The company highlighted successful expansion into the EU, reintroduction of crypto offerings, significant growth in trading volume, and the launch of an AI tool named Vega. Despite increased operating expenses, Webull maintains an optimistic outlook for continued growth and market positioning.

title: GM buys gigacasting company with Tesla ties
summary: General Motors has acquired Tooling & Equipment International (TEI), a company known for designing and manufacturing gigacasting machinery. Prior to the acquisition, TEI collaborated with Tesla to enhance vehicle manufacturing techniques, including developing massive presses for complex structural components. This move allows GM to potentially reduce manufacturing costs and produce more affordable EVs by utilizing gigacasting technology, which streamlines vehicle body production.

title: Here Are Five Times GM Developed Some Pioneering And Important Innovation Only To Fumble It And Have To Catch Up Later Like A Chump
summary: This article criticizes General Motors for repeatedly pioneering significant automotive innovations only to mismanage them and lose their early lead. It details five key areas where GM was first to market but ultimately fumbled, including turbocharging, modern electric cars, electric pickup trucks, touchscreens, and airbags, often leaving other manufacturers to capitalize on these advancements years later. The author highlights GM's exceptional engineering prowess coupled with its unique ability for corporate self-sabotage, leading to missed opportunities and a chaser role in the industry.

title: Tesla Reverses China Price Cut, Adding $2,000 to Model Y Variant
summary: Tesla Inc. has increased the price of its Model Y Performance SUV in China by approximately $2,000, reversing a price cut made in August. The electric SUV's advanced variant now costs 363,900 yuan ($49,740), up from 349,900 yuan. This move follows a period where Tesla had reduced the price by the same amount two months prior.

title: It's Not Just Lithium: Tesla, Rivian, And The Green Revolution Rely On These Precious Metals
summary: This article highlights the critical role of precious metals beyond lithium in powering the green revolution, particularly in electric vehicle batteries. It details how cobalt, nickel, silver, and graphite are essential components for companies like Tesla and Rivian, impacting battery performance, energy density, and efficiency. The piece also touches on future trends, such as solid-state batteries, and discusses investment opportunities in the materials driving the EV industry.

title: Investors look beyond largest emerging markets ETFs
summary: Investors are looking beyond the largest emerging markets ETFs for exposure, with a focus on adopting ETFs rather than concerns about emerging markets or the Life + Liberty Indexes methodology. The article highlights other financial news including delays in SEC work on private credit due to a government shutdown, a university foundation CIO looking to overhaul its portfolio, Carlyle's AUM hitting $474 billion, and CalPERS voting against Elon Musk's pay package.

title: The P&I/Thinking Ahead Institute World 500: Largest asset managers
summary: This article presents the P&I/Thinking Ahead Institute World 500 list, identifying the largest asset managers globally. It also features several related financial news stories, including insights into private credit, endowment portfolio overhauls, private equity AUM growth, and a significant CalPERS voting decision.

title: Check out T-Rex 2X Inverse Tesla Daily Target ETF's stock price (TSLZ) in real time
summary: This article provides real-time stock price information and key financial data for the T-Rex 2X Inverse Tesla Daily Target ETF (TSLZ). It details current trading figures including open, high, low, previous close, volume, and notes the 52-week range. The article also lists key stats such as dividend yield and 10-day average volume, along with upcoming event dates.

title: Cathie Wood explains how the artificial intelligence boom could propel Ark's Innovation ETF
summary: Cathie Wood believes the artificial intelligence boom could significantly boost Ark Invest's flagship Ark Innovation ETF (ARKK). While the fund has gained 17% this year, Wood emphasized that AI represents a reality, not just a dream, and that its disruptive nature will create new industry leaders. She cautioned investors to be discerning with their AI bets, highlighting Tesla as a key holding while expressing reservations about some other "Magnificent Seven" stocks.

title: T-REX 2X Long Tesla Daily Target ETF (TSLT) Stock Price, Quote, News & History
summary: This article provides detailed information on the T-REX 2X Long Tesla Daily Target ETF (TSLT), including its stock price, key statistics, recent news, and investment policy. TSLT aims to provide 200% daily leveraged exposure to Tesla (TSLA) stock, investing primarily in swap agreements. The ETF's current price, AUM, management fees, and news regarding Tesla's FSD timeline and Elon Musk's parliamentary summons are also covered.

title: German government proposes legislation to make fast chargers mandatory at gas stations – ADS-TEC Energy battery buffered ultra-fast charging systems are the ideal solution
summary: The German government plans to mandate fast chargers at gas stations by law to combat range anxiety and boost e-mobility acceptance, aiming for 1 million public charging points by 2030. ADS-TEC Energy offers battery-buffered ultra-fast charging systems, like ChargeBox and ChargePost, as an ideal solution for gas stations, especially where grid upgrades are difficult, enabling fast charging with minimal footprint and noise. These systems can charge multiple EVs simultaneously and offer additional revenue streams for operators through advertising space.

title: BPAS - REX Shares Partners with Tuttle Capital Management to Launch T-REX Single-Stock ETFs
summary: REX Shares and Tuttle Capital Management have partnered to launch T-REX Single-Stock ETFs, offering targeted 200% and -200% daily exposure to Tesla (TSLA) and NVIDIA (NVDA) stocks. This new suite of ETFs, including TSLT, TSLZ, NVDX, and NVDQ, caters to sophisticated traders seeking enhanced returns through pinpoint positioning. The launch follows REX Shares' recent introduction of the REX FANG & Innovation Equity Premium Income ETF (FEPI), which provides income from top U.S. technology stocks.

title: REX Shares Partners with Tuttle Capital Management to Launch T-REX Single-Stock ETFs
summary: REX Shares and Tuttle Capital Management have launched T-REX Single-Stock ETFs, offering sophisticated traders targeted 200% and -200% exposure to Tesla and NVIDIA. This new suite of ETFs aims to enhance potential returns through pinpoint positioning, building on REX Shares' commitment to innovation in alternative-strategy products. The launch expands REX Shares' product offerings, including previously introduced ETFs like the REX FANG & Innovation Equity Premium Income ETF.

title: Tesla Taps European Stainless Steel Producer for Long-Awaited Cybertruck
summary: Tesla Inc. is reportedly sourcing some stainless steel panels for its new Cybertruck from Finnish supplier Outokumpu Oyj. Outokumpu, Europe’s largest producer of stainless steel, is adapting its production to meet the Cybertruck's unconventional design challenges. The materials will be shipped to Tesla’s assembly factory in Austin, marking a significant product shift for the Helsinki-based company.

title: Chinese EV startup WM Motor files for bankruptcy
summary: Chinese EV startup WM Motor has filed for bankruptcy, marking the end of a once-promising company amidst intensified price competition in China's automotive market. Founded in 2015, the Shanghai-based startup struggled to achieve profitability, with annual losses doubling to 8.2 billion yuan (S$1.57 billion) by 2021. This setback follows failed attempts at public listings and a non-binding acquisition offer from Kaixin Auto Holdings.

title: Top Performing ETFs: Gold, Income ETFs Top the Charts
summary: This article highlights that gold, commodities, and income options strategies were the top-performing ETFs of the week, with particular success for options-based income ETFs from YieldMax focusing on tech stocks. It notes that commodities like natural gas also performed strongly, likely due to market fears, while gold strategies and interest-rate-hedging strategies continue to exhibit strong performance. The article concludes that a diverse suite of strategies, including income ETFs and gold, are available for investors.

title: Bitwise CIO expects U.S. spot bitcoin ETFs to see $55 billion of inflows in first 5 years
summary: Bitwise Asset Management's CIO, Matt Hougan, predicts that U.S. spot Bitcoin ETFs could attract $55 billion in inflows over their first five years. This forecast highlights significant expected interest and investment in these new financial products as they come to market. The article also mentions other featured stories related to private credit, endowments, private equity, and pension funds.

title: New Lithium Stock Trades Today. It's Another Way to Play the EV Trend.
summary: Lithium Americas, a lithium mining startup, has completed its transformation into two separate companies. It has spun off Lithium Americas Argentina to its shareholders. This move presents a new opportunity for investors to engage with the electric vehicle trend.

title: Chinese demand outlook pressures lithium prices to 2-year lows
summary: Lithium carbonate prices in China have fallen to two-year lows, experiencing a nearly 50% drop from their June peak. This decline is attributed to concerns over Chinese demand for lithium, a key EV battery component, as battery makers still hold significant inventory despite the typical fourth-quarter demand increase. The slump has also negatively impacted lithium producers, with related ETFs reaching multi-year lows.

title: Q4 Stock Predictions: 3 Flying Car Stocks Ready to Roar Into 2024
summary: This article highlights three investment opportunities in the burgeoning flying car sector, which is projected to reach a $1.5 trillion market by 2040. It focuses on Joby Aviation and Archer Aviation as leading companies poised for commercial operations by 2025, and the First Trust Nasdaq Transportation ETF as a diversified, lower-risk alternative. The author emphasizes strategic partnerships, FAA certifications, and significant financial backing as key indicators of potential growth for these "flying car stocks."

title: Honda and Acura Electric Vehicles Will Have Access to Largest EV Charging Networks in North America Aided by New Agreements with EVgo and Electrify America
summary: Honda and Acura have announced new agreements with EVgo and Electrify America, expanding their EV customers' access to North America's largest charging networks. These agreements, combined with access to Tesla Superchargers and a new joint venture high-powered charging network, aim to provide Honda and Acura EV drivers with around 100,000 public DC fast charge points by 2030. Customers purchasing or leasing a new Honda or Acura EV will also receive charging packages including public charging credits and installation credits for home charging solutions.

title: Going beyond Tesla: ETF bets solely on electric vehicle makers
summary: A new ETF, Defiance ETFs' Solactive Pure U.S. Electric Vehicle ETF (Pure EV Index fund), offers a concentrated bet solely on electric vehicle manufacturers, as opposed to other EV-related ETFs that include tech companies or component producers. The fund invests in only the five largest market-cap EV makers—Tesla, Nio, Rivian, Li Auto, and Xpeng—provided they derive at least 50% of their revenue from EV development or manufacturing and have high trading volume. Since its launch in June, the ETF has gained over 18%, boasting $5.1 million in net assets.

title: Great Expectations: The Saturn Cars Story
summary: This article chronicles the ambitious but ultimately failed history of Saturn, General Motors' attempt to reinvent itself and compete with Japanese imports. It details the initial "wondercar" expectations, its unique manufacturing and sales approach, and how internal GM politics and leadership changes ultimately led to its demise despite early customer enthusiasm.

title: Should Investors Worry About EVs Overloading the Grid?
summary: A common concern among investors is that the existing electrical grid may not be able to support the widespread adoption of electric vehicles (EVs). However, industry expert Anthony Sassine of KraneShares explains that utility companies are proactively planning for this transition, looking ahead as much as 15 years. Solutions include expanding the grid and installing chargers in various locations to disperse charging demand and avoid peak time overloads.

title: Tesla, Saudi Arabia in early talks for EV factory - WSJ
authors: Samrhitha Arunasalam and Arpan Varghese in Bengaluru and Rachna Uppal in Dubai
summary: Saudi Arabia is reportedly in early talks with Tesla to establish a manufacturing facility in the kingdom, according to the Wall Street Journal. The kingdom is attempting to diversify its economy away from oil and has offered Tesla access to metals and minerals for its EV production. This comes as Tesla aims to significantly increase its annual vehicle sales by 2030 and is scouting locations for new factories.

title: Lotus launches electric GT model as mass expansion plan rolls on
summary: Lotus unveiled its new fully-electric grand tourer (GT) sports car, the Emeya, in New York, marking a significant step in its transition from a niche brand to a mass manufacturer with a target of 150,000 sales annually by 2028. The Emeya, which will begin production in 2024 in China, aims to attract buyers from German brands and Tesla with its long range and luxury features. This expansion is supported by Geely and Etika Automotive, with Lotus Technology also planning to go public via a merger with L Catterton Asia Acquisition Corp.

title: Honda to Adopt North American Charging Standard (NACS) for its EV Models in North America
summary: Honda Motor Co., Ltd. announced an agreement with Tesla, Inc. to adopt Tesla's North American Charging Standard (NACS) for its EV models in North America, starting from 2025. This move will allow Honda EV owners to use Tesla Supercharger stations, significantly enhancing charging convenience. Honda is also part of a joint venture with other automakers to build a high-powered EV charging network, aiming to achieve widespread EV adoption and carbon neutrality.

title: Tesla Ordered by NHTSA to Address New Issue Over Autopilot
summary: Tesla is facing increased scrutiny from the NHTSA over its Autopilot driver-assistance system. The agency issued a "special order" concerning a configuration that allows drivers to operate vehicles for extended periods without needing to apply torque to the steering wheel, potentially subverting driver monitoring. Tesla has submitted a confidential reply to address the regulator's concerns.

title: Tesla Powerwall owners will boost Texas power grid, make money
summary: Texas is launching a "virtual power plant" pilot program that will reward Tesla Powerwall owners for using their in-home battery packs to support the grid. The program, managed by ERCOT, allows Powerwall owners in designated regions to sell surplus power to the grid. This initiative aims to integrate stored solar energy seamlessly and follows similar pilot programs in other states like California.

title: Tesla says two ex-employees behind May data breach
summary: Tesla has revealed that two former employees were responsible for a May data breach that compromised the personal information of over 75,000 individuals, including staff. The exposed data was leaked to German media outlet Handelsblatt, prompting Tesla to file lawsuits and seize the devices of the identified employees. This incident follows a previous report in April about Tesla employees sharing customer information internally.

title: Tesla drops Model S, Model X base price with Standard Range versions
summary: Tesla has introduced new, lower-priced Standard Range versions for its Model S and Model X, making them $10,000 cheaper than previous base models. These new versions feature software-limited battery packs, resulting in reduced range and slightly slower acceleration. This pricing adjustment is suspected to be a response to rising interest rates and increased competition from rivals like Lucid.

title: Tesla Rolls Out New Base Model S and X for $10,000 Less
summary: Tesla has introduced new, lower-priced Standard Range versions of its Model S and Model X vehicles, costing $10,000 less than previous base models. This move brings the starting prices of these models down significantly since the beginning of the year and follows recent price cuts in China, signaling a potential strategy to boost sales despite impacting profit margins. CEO Elon Musk has indicated a willingness to sacrifice profitability for sales growth amidst rising interest rates.

title: 8 Best Battery Stocks & ETFs to Watch
summary: This article identifies top battery stocks and ETFs for investors, highlighting the increasing demand for batteries across various sectors from electronics to EVs. It introduces key players like Tesla, CATL, Panasonic, and emerging companies like QuantumScape and FREYR Battery, discussing their technological advancements and market positions. The article also suggests battery-focused ETFs for diversified exposure to the sector.

title: ReElement Technologies Produces Ultra-High Purity, 99.99%, Battery-Grade Lithium from LFP Manufacturing Waste
summary: ReElement Technologies, a subsidiary of American Resources Corporation, announced it has achieved ultra-high purity 99.99% battery-grade lithium from LFP battery manufacturing waste using its patented multi-modal chromatography technology. This technology offers a cost-effective and environmentally friendly method for refining lithium, crucial for the domestic auto and electrification industries. The company is scaling its production capacity, with plans for a larger annual capacity of approximately 13,750,000 kilograms per year.

title: Blink Will Benefit From Industry Shift to Tesla Charging Standard, CEO Says
summary: Blink Charging (BLNK) CEO Brendan Jones stated that the auto industry's shift to Tesla Inc.'s charging standard will benefit his company, despite Blink operating a competing network. Automakers like Ford and General Motors are adopting Tesla's North American Charging Standard to give their EV buyers access to Tesla's extensive public charging stations. Jones affirmed that Blink is well-positioned to offer stations equipped with Tesla-style plugs, leveraging the company's 186% surge in quarterly revenue.

title: How to Buy LG Energy Solution Stock [2025]
summary: LG Energy Solution is a South Korean battery company listed only on the Korea Exchange. International investors can gain exposure by buying shares of ETFs with exposure to the company or indirectly through LG Display stock, which trades on the NYSE. The article provides a step-by-step guide on how to invest in ETFs with LG Energy Solution exposure through a regulated broker, outlining factors to consider when choosing a broker and assessing lithium battery stock investments.

title: DTE offers $2,000 in subsidies, special charging rates for EVs
summary: DTE Energy is offering significant subsidies for electric vehicle adoption in Michigan, including rebates of up to $1,500 for EV purchases or leases and $500 for home charger installations. These incentives are part of a broader push to expand EV use, though the company faces criticism regarding its infrastructure's reliability during extreme weather events. The article highlights the conflict between EV adoption goals and the current state of energy infrastructure, as expressed by Michigan residents.

title: 2014 Tesla Model S vs 2023 Tesla Model 3 Review: Is Newer Actually Better?
summary: This article compares a 2014 Tesla Model S with a 2023 Tesla Model 3 to determine which offers a better ownership experience in 2023. The review highlights differences in powertrain technology, driving experience, charging speeds, interior comfort, and overall cost considerations. While the Model S offers luxury and a lower used price, the Model 3 provides modern efficiency, faster charging, and a warranty, ultimately making it the more practical choice for a long-term commitment.

title: Cathie Wood's ARK Takes Profit as Coinbase Trades at Highest Level This Year
summary: Cathie Wood's Ark Invest has sold $12 million worth of Coinbase (COIN) shares, taking profits as the cryptocurrency exchange's stock reached a yearly high. This move comes after Ark Invest had been an aggressive buyer of Coinbase shares during a period of sector turmoil, and as Coinbase's stock has surged almost 150% year-to-date despite regulatory uncertainty. The sale follows news of a potential surveillance-sharing deal for Bitcoin ETFs, which could ease the path to the first spot ETF.

title: Tesla settles class-action Solar Roof lawsuit for $6 million
summary: Tesla has agreed to a $6 million settlement in a class-action lawsuit concerning sudden price hikes for its Solar Roof system in 2021. These increases led to over 6,300 customers canceling their contracts, despite many having already signed agreements for installation. The settlement addresses the financial impact on customers who faced significant unexpected costs.

title: Top Performing Leveraged/Inverse ETFs: 07/09/2023
summary: This article lists the top 10 performing leveraged and inverse ETFs for the week ending July 9, 2023. It highlights ETFs like MSOX, EVAV, KOLD, and others, explaining the factors contributing to their strong performance, such as cannabis legalization, Tesla's Q2 results, falling natural gas prices, and changes in bond yields and market volatility. The article also briefly describes each ETF's investment focus and the market conditions that influenced its returns.

title: TThe High Price of Low Volatility | U.S. Equity market commentary 2Q23
summary: This article by Bill Nygren, Portfolio Manager at Oakmark, discusses how different entities define investment risk and argues against the common perception of index funds as low-risk, highlighting increasing concentration risk in indices like the NASDAQ 100 and S&P 500. He contrasts this with Oakmark's approach, which focuses on long-term value investing and accepts higher short-term volatility for potentially better long-term returns. Nygren contends that index fund investors and those seeking low volatility stocks are overlooking significant valuation risks.

title: Is Tesla's Stock Losing Its Charge?
summary: Despite a significant year-to-date gain of over 140%, Tesla's stock is experiencing recent profit-taking, leading some analysts to suggest moving to the sidelines. This pullback presents opportunities for traders using single-stock ETFs like TSLS for bearish plays or TSLL for bullish positions. While short-term momentum may be dissipating, Tesla's long-term prospects as a leading EV manufacturer remain strong due to the global shift towards reduced carbon emissions.

title: Alan McKim founded Clean Harbors. As technology chief, he’ll guide it into the future
summary: Alan McKim, founder of Clean Harbors, has transitioned from CEO to Chief Technology Officer to guide his multi-billion-dollar environmental cleanup company into the future, focusing on technology and AI integration. This move follows a significant ransomware attack in 2020 which highlighted the critical role of technology in the specialized hazardous waste industry. McKim, who built Clean Harbors from one truck into a global enterprise, will now drive technological advancements to meet evolving customer needs and waste challenges like lithium-ion batteries and solar panels.

title: Applied Materials to invest $400 million in India for new engineering center
summary: U.S. semiconductor toolmaker Applied Materials (AMAT.O) announced a $400 million investment over four years to establish a new engineering center in India. This move follows Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi's meeting with Applied Materials CEO Gary Dickerson and is part of a broader wave of investments in India's chip industry. The new facility, planned for Bengaluru, aims to support over $2 billion in planned investments and create 500 new engineering jobs.

title: Elon Musk slams woke S&P rating after Tesla scores lower than Philip Morris
summary: Elon Musk criticized S&P Global's ESG rating system after Tesla received a significantly lower score (37 out of 100) than Marlboro maker Philip Morris International (84 out of 100). Musk labeled Environmental Social Governance as "the devil," questioning why a company producing cigarettes, which cause millions of deaths annually, would be deemed a more ethical investment than an electric car manufacturer. S&P Global defended its scoring methodology, stating that company scores are comparable within their respective sectors rather than across industries.

title: Tesla Eyes $3 Billion Boost From Chargers at Rivals’ Expense
summary: Tesla is projected to earn as much as $3 billion by 2030 from deals with Ford and General Motors for their EVs to use its charging network. This move is expected to establish Tesla's 'North American Charging Standard' as the preferred approach in the U.S., pressuring other competitors to adopt it. The increased revenue from charging will boost Tesla's income while rivals like GM and Ford continue to struggle with EV program profitability.

title: Microvast EV battery plant in Hopkinsville in doubt after federal agency halts $200M grant
summary: The U.S. Department of Energy halted a $200 million grant to Microvast Holdings Inc., putting the company's planned $504 million EV battery plant in Hopkinsville, Kentucky, in doubt. The decision followed allegations from Republican lawmakers of Microvast's improper ties to China. Kentucky officials have paused $21 million in state incentives, while Microvast's related plant in Clarksville, Tennessee, is proceeding.

title: Billionaire Tom Siebel faces tumult at C3.ai as investor lawsuit, short sellers question metrics
summary: C3.ai CEO Tom Siebel is facing controversy due to an investor lawsuit alleging misrepresentation of a partnership with Baker Hughes ahead of the company's 2020 IPO, and criticism from short sellers regarding aggressive accounting and customer metrics. While C3.ai's stock has surged with AI excitement, it remains significantly below its peak, and concerns persist about unbilled receivables, executive turnover, and the company's method for counting customers. Siebel denies the allegations, defending the company's accounting practices and growth prospects.

title: For the First Time Ever, Single-Stock ETFs Will Close Soon
summary: Seven single-stock ETFs, primarily offering leveraged or inverse exposure to individual stocks, are set to close in June, marking the first time such products will cease trading. Despite initial high expectations when they launched in July 2022, most single-stock ETFs have struggled, with minimal assets under management for those slated for closure. AXS will close five of its single-stock ETFs tied to companies like Nike, Pfizer, and PayPal, while GraniteShares is closing a Tesla-related fund, and AXS will also close two other leveraged/inverse ETFs targeting China internet and de-SPAC companies.

title: ICZOOM Group (IZM) Short Interest & Short Float | Updated Dec 2025
summary: This article details the short interest data for ICZOOM Group (IZM) as of December 15, 2025, showing 40,656 shares sold short, a 37.12% decrease from the prior report. The short interest represents 0.50% of the public float with a short interest ratio of 0.8 days to cover. The report includes historical short interest data, frequently asked questions, and comparisons to competitors in the retail industry.

title: 4 Base Metal ETFs to Buy Right Now
summary: The global base metals market is experiencing a significant recovery, driven by increased demand from the automotive and construction industries, especially the electric vehicle sector. This article identifies four key base metal ETFs—VanEck Vectors Steel ETF (SLX), United States Copper Index Fund (CPER), Global X Lithium & Battery Tech ETF (LIT), and iPath Series B Bloomberg Nickel Subindex Total Return (JJN)—as prime investment opportunities to capitalize on this boom. It details how each metal plays a crucial role in current industrial trends and why their respective ETFs are poised for growth.

title: Blue Bird is an EV Company that Actually Makes Money
summary: Blue Bird (NASDAQ: BLBD) is the largest manufacturer of school buses in the U.S., holding a 40% market share and leading in EV school bus production. Unlike many EV companies, Blue Bird is profitable and is experiencing significant growth, with a 44% YoY revenue increase in Q2 2023 and substantial backlogs for both EV and conventional buses. Federal incentives, such as the EPA's Clean School Bus Rebate Program, are further driving its growth, helping the company raise its full-year 2023 revenue guidance.

title: Views From the Ground: Mexico
summary: This article highlights Mexico's impressive economic performance in 2023, driven by nearshoring, a resilient peso, pension reforms, and an independent central bank. It argues that nearshoring presents a transformative growth engine, potentially surpassing the impact of NAFTA due to companies diversifying supply chains away from China. Despite political and security concerns, the author anticipates continued strong performance for Mexican equities supported by structural tailwinds.

title: The EV Revolution and Going Public in the US: IPO Edge Q&A with CEO Jake Dingle
summary: Carbon Revolution CEO Jake Dingle discusses how their carbon fiber wheels are revolutionizing the EV market by reducing weight and extending range, attracting significant OEM interest. The company plans to list in North America through a merger with Twin Ridge Acquisition Corp. (NYSE: TRCA) to scale production and meet growing demand for their patented technology. This strategic move aims to leverage US capital markets for further growth and mainstream adoption of their innovative wheel solutions.

title: Implications and Updates From China’s National People’s Conference
summary: China's annual "Two Sessions" parliamentary meeting revealed strategic policies for economic growth, trade, and technology, targeting a 5% GDP growth in 2023 driven by domestic consumption. The conference highlighted key implications for sectors like EVs, clean energy, cloud computing, biotechnology, and semiconductors, emphasizing self-reliance and technological innovation. Government restructuring and increased focus on digital infrastructure and R&D are expected to significantly impact various industries and investment themes in China.

title: [증권상품 풍향계] 달러 파킹형 ETF 연이어 출시 주목
summary: This article highlights the recent trend of financial product releases in the investment market, focusing on the consecutive launch of US SOFR-linked ETFs designed for dollar parking. It also covers new funds investing in domestic blue-chip bonds until maturity and several ETFs related to electric vehicles, including a leverage ETF for Chinese EVs and an ETF investing in the Tesla value chain. These products cater to investors seeking stable returns from dollar investments, higher yields than bank deposits, and opportunities in the growing EV market.

title: George Soros bet on railroads, fitness, gig economy and lightened load on Disney, Amazon, dumped Tesla
summary: Soros Fund Management made new investments in railroad operators CSX Corp. and Norfolk Southern Corp., and the gig economy during the first quarter. The fund also adjusted its holdings in the media sector and divested from electric-vehicle maker Tesla Inc. These railroad investments occurred amidst ongoing labor tensions and increased scrutiny over safety in the industry.

title: YieldMax™ Launches NVDY, the YieldMax™ NVDA Option Income Strategy ETF
summary: YieldMax™ has launched NVDY, the YieldMax™ NVDA Option Income Strategy ETF, which seeks to generate monthly income through a synthetic covered call strategy on NVIDIA Corporation (NVDA). This actively managed ETF由ZEGA Financial aims to provide substantial monthly income to investors, joining other YieldMax™ ETFs like TSLY, OARK, and APLY, and adheres to a gross expense ratio of 0.99%.

title: Here’s How Some Unusual ETFs Performed Against the S&P 500
summary: Exotic exchange-traded funds (ETFs) have gained popularity, allowing investors to make unusual bets, such as against CNBC's Jim Cramer's stock picks or tracking congressional stock trades. However, this year, many of these unusual ETFs have underperformed the S&P 500. Popular funds betting against Tesla and Cathie Wood's ARK Innovation fund have particularly struggled.

title: Ryder Introduces Electric Vehicle Service
summary: Ryder System Inc. has launched RyderElectric+, a new electric vehicle program offering comprehensive solutions for fleets, including electrification consulting, vehicle leasing, charging, telematics, and maintenance services. The service, initially focusing on light-duty electric vans, aims to simplify the integration and operation of EVs for customers through a single provider and cost. Ryder plans to expand its EV fleet with thousands of new electric vans and continues to partner with various manufacturers.

title: REE Automotive Unveils P7-C Chassis Cab, a New Addition to
summary: REE Automotive has unveiled its new P7-C Chassis Cab, a Class 4 electric vehicle designed for the fast-growing and incentivized market, on track for Q4 2023 deliveries. This addition expands REE's P7 electric truck lineup, which also includes the P7-B box truck and P7-S stripped chassis, now available for order and built for urban environments. The company is also growing its U.S. authorized dealer network with the addition of Monarch Truck Center, The Truck Shop, and RY-DEN Truck Center, with certification progress underway for the P7 electric lineup.

title: Constellium to provide closed-loop recycling for the all-new Megane E-TECH Electric
summary: Constellium SE has partnered with Renault Group to implement a closed-loop recycling process for the all-new Megane E-TECH Electric, ensuring manufacturing scrap is recycled back into production without loss of material properties. This collaboration utilizes Constellium's advanced aluminium Auto Body Sheet products and supports both companies' sustainability targets and the decarbonization of the automotive industry. Constellium is also expanding its recycling capacity with a significant investment in a new recycling center in France.

title: Tesla drops starting price of Model Y below the cost of the average U.S. vehicle
summary: Tesla has lowered the starting price of its Model Y SUV, making it $759 less expensive than the average new car or truck in the U.S. This move follows previous price cuts on other Tesla models and comes amid slowing sales, despite a general rise in electric vehicle sales and increasing consumer interest in EVs. While Tesla's U.S. market share has declined from its peak, its sales still increased by 40% last year.

title: Rich matches boost employees' savings, support recruiting
summary: The article discusses how generous employer matching contributions to retirement plans, exemplified by Abbott Laboratories, help boost employees' savings for retirement and serve as a recruiting tool. It also includes brief summaries of other featured stories related to private credit, endowments, private equity, and pension funds.

title: Elon Musk Makes Case to Mine More Nickel
summary: Elon Musk has urged increased nickel mining due to rising demand for electric vehicles (EVs), as nickel is a crucial component in EV batteries. Tesla is reportedly interested in nickel mining opportunities in Indonesia, the world's largest nickel producer. Investors can gain exposure to nickel mining through the Sprott Nickel Miners ETF (NIKL), which provides diversified access to global nickel miners.

title: YieldMax Announces Monthly Distributions on TSLY and OARK ETFs
summary: YieldMax has announced its monthly distributions for April 2023 for its TSLY and OARK Option Income Strategy ETFs. TSLY will distribute $0.8286 per share with a current yield of 61.41%, while OARK will distribute $0.5103 per share with a current yield of 37.64%. The article also provides historical distribution data and important disclaimers regarding investment risks and yield variability.

title: Elon Musk Makes Plea to Mine More Nickel
summary: Tesla CEO Elon Musk has urged for increased nickel mining to meet the growing demand for electric vehicle (EV) batteries, with Indonesia identified as a crucial source. Investors can gain exposure to nickel mining through the Sprott Nickel Miners ETF (NIKL), which offers global diversification and targets companies involved in nickel production, development, and exploration. The ETF focuses on small-cap equities and is positioned to benefit from the anticipated surge in nickel demand due to its critical role in EV and clean energy storage.

title: Best-Performing Stocks of Q1 2023
summary: The first quarter of 2023 saw a significant rebound in technology and communication services stocks, with Nvidia, Meta Platforms, and Salesforce among the top performers. This resurgence was driven by factors such as better-than-expected earnings, cost-cutting measures, and growing enthusiasm for artificial intelligence, contrasting sharply with the downturn experienced in 2022. Other sectors like entertainment and media, cryptocurrency, and electric vehicles also saw notable gains.

title: ARKW: Right Approach for Futuristic Internet Investing
summary: The ARK Next Generation Internet ETF (ARKW) is highlighted as a suitable investment for capitalizing on emerging internet trends, despite its age. The article discusses ARKW's positioning in response to the acceleration of digital consumption, with holdings in crypto, fintech, and innovative tech companies like Coinbase, Block, and Tesla. It also points to the potential growth from emerging social media platforms and the expanding online sports betting and iGaming industries as future drivers for the fund.

title: Gen Z, Memes, Digital Revolution Kicked to Curb in Fad-ETF Purge
summary: Thematic ETFs focusing on popular trends like Gen Z, memes, and digital revolution are rapidly closing down as rising interest rates negatively impact their performance. Many of these niche funds, which often targeted technology names, had assets under $30 million and negative returns, making them vulnerable to shutdown. This trend indicates a shift away from speculative, high-growth strategies toward more stable investments in the current economic climate.

title: Sprott Launches Nickel Miners ETF
summary: Sprott Asset Management has launched the Sprott Nickel Miners ETF (Nasdaq: NIKL), focusing on nickel mining companies crucial for the clean energy transition. Nickel is a vital component in EV batteries, with demand projected to increase significantly by 2040. NIKL joins Sprott's existing suite of energy transition-focused ETFs, aiming to capitalize on the growing need for critical minerals.

title: Sprott Launches Nickel Miners ETF
summary: Sprott Asset Management has launched the Sprott Nickel Miners ETF (Nasdaq: NIKL), which focuses on nickel mining companies crucial for the clean energy transition. Nickel is a vital component in EV batteries, and its demand is expected to increase significantly by 2040. NIKL joins Sprott's existing suite of energy transition-focused ETFs, catering to advisors prioritizing clean energy investments.

title: The 3 Best Electric Vehicle ETFs to Buy for the Future of Transportation
summary: This article highlights three top electric vehicle ETFs for investors looking to capitalize on the growing EV market. It discusses the Global X Autonomous & Electric Vehicles ETF (DRIV), Amplify Lithium & Battery Technology ETF (BATT), and iShares Self-Driving EV & Tech ETF (IDRV), detailing their holdings, expense ratios, dividends, and performance. The author suggests these ETFs offer a safer and more affordable way to invest in the EV sector compared to individual stocks.

title: For Broad-Based Large-Cap ESG Exposure, See CVLC
summary: The article highlights the Calvert US Large-Cap Core Responsible Index ETF (CVLC) as a significant option for investors seeking broad-based large-cap ESG exposure, particularly focusing on climate change and net-zero goals. It emphasizes CVLC's ability to identify companies taking actual steps towards net-zero objectives, citing examples like Apple, Amazon, and Tesla. The ETF offers a tangible way for investors to align their portfolios with values related to environmental sustainability and responsible investing.

title: Tesla owners sue over parts-and-service monopoly
summary: Tesla is facing two class-action lawsuits alleging it has unlawfully monopolized replacement parts and repair services. Owners claim Tesla's policies force them to use company-approved service centers and parts, leading to lengthy delays and inflated prices for repairs. This legal action coincides with a growing push for right-to-repair laws across the United States.

title: News | Salesforce Executive Calls In-Office Work Critical to Tech Giant’s Profitability
summary: Salesforce's Chief Operating Officer Brian Millham states that in-person work is crucial for the company's future growth and profitability, reversing a previous stance on remote work. He noted a drop in productivity among remote employees during the pandemic. The company's shift back to a hybrid model, requiring sales and service employees in the office four days a week, appears to be positively impacting revenue growth.

title: Consider Mexico ETF FLMX as U.S. Industries Look South
summary: As the U.S. market faces potential interest rate hikes and stress, investors are looking to international equities, with Mexico emerging as an attractive option. The Franklin FTSE Mexico ETF (FLMX) is positioned to benefit from U.S. industries moving operations south, exemplified by Tesla's new gigafactory and Mattel's expanded manufacturing. Proximity to the U.S., resilient demand, and domestic consumption contribute to Mexico's bright outlook, making FLMX an appealing investment with strong year-to-date performance.

title: Arbe Robotics: Buy The Rumour (NASDAQ:ARBE)
summary: Arbe Robotics, a manufacturer of 4D radar-on-a-chip technology, is rumored to be on the verge of landing a substantial high-profile customer, potentially Tesla. Despite a recent stock drop, the company's unique market-leading product, strong funding, and manufacturing partnerships position it for high-volume demand. The latest earnings call featured guest speakers from major tier 1 OEMs, indicating strong industry interest.

title: Cisco works with Mercedes-Benz to create mobile office
summary: Cisco is partnering with Mercedes-Benz to integrate its Webex conferencing tools directly into the dashboards of the 2024 E-Class vehicles, transforming cars into mobile offices. While driving, users are limited to audio, but when parked, they can access all Webex features including video meetings, content sharing, and automatic transcription. This move allows Cisco to expand its collaboration tools into new markets, following a boost in video-conferencing platforms during the pandemic.

title: Tesla to Open HQ in Palo Alto Less than Two Years After Loudly Ditching California
summary: Tesla is establishing a new global engineering headquarters in Palo Alto, taking over the former HP headquarters, despite having moved its official HQ to Austin, Texas, in 2021. CEO Elon Musk announced this alongside California Gov. Gavin Newsom, highlighting California's continued strength in engineering talent and manufacturing. The move signals a renewed investment in the state, where Tesla maintains significant operations, including its Fremont manufacturing plant and a large workforce in the Bay Area.

title: State Street Consumer Discretionary Select Sector SPDR ETF (XLY) Stock Price, Holdings, Dividend Yield
summary: This article provides a detailed overview of the Consumer Discretionary Select Sector SPDR Fund (XLY), including its stock price, key statistics, top holdings, and dividend information. It highlights XLY's portfolio value, turnover rate, and its largest positions in companies like Amazon, Tesla, and Home Depot, based on its latest N-PORT filing. The report also includes historical performance data, fundamental charts, and recent trading actions within the ETF's portfolio.

title: Enphase (ENPH) introduces bi-directional EV charging for an all-in-one solar home energy system
summary: Enphase Energy (ENPH) has announced the successful demonstration of its bi-directional EV charger, which will allow electric vehicles to power homes during outages or support the grid during peak demand. This technology integrates with Enphase’s existing microinverter-based solar and battery systems, establishing an all-in-one solar home energy system. The charger supports vehicle-to-home (V2H), vehicle-to-grid (V2G), and Green charging capabilities and is expected to be available in 2024.

title: Ten Questions About the Disruptive Materials at the Center of the Clean Energy Transition
summary: This article addresses ten key questions about disruptive materials essential for the clean energy transition, such as copper, nickel, lithium, and rare earth elements. It examines the current supply and demand dynamics, geopolitical impacts, and potential shortages that could drive price movements and create opportunities for companies and investors. The piece highlights how increasing demand for clean technologies like EVs and renewable energy systems is creating a supercycle for these critical materials.

title: Austin company lays off 250 janitorial, maintenance workers after Tesla cancels contract
summary: A facilities services company, ABM Texas General Services, is laying off 255 janitorial and maintenance employees in Austin after their contract with Tesla was terminated. Tesla ended the contract on January 16, with a new vendor, SBM, set to take over services. The layoffs affect workers at Tesla's Austin property, including its corporate headquarters and manufacturing facility.

title: Top Performing Leveraged/Inverse ETFs: 01/29/2023
summary: This article highlights the top-performing leveraged and inverse ETFs for the week ending January 29, 2023. Key drivers for these strong performances include positive Tesla earnings, growth in electric and autonomous vehicles, and hopes for a slower pace of interest rate hikes from the Federal Reserve, boosting technology and consumer discretionary sectors. The list provides specific ETF tickers, their names, and weekly returns, along with brief explanations for their performance.

title: ‘The Nasdaq is our favorite short.’ This market strategist sees recession and a credit crunch slamming stocks in 2023.
summary: Market strategist Keith McCullough predicts a U.S. corporate profit recession and a credit crunch in 2023, leading to a significant downturn in stocks, particularly the Nasdaq. He argues that the Federal Reserve's interest rate hikes will exacerbate these issues. McCullough advises investors to short growth stocks and shift to defensive assets like gold, silver, and defensive ETFs.

title: ‘The Nasdaq is our favorite short.’ This market strategist sees recession and a credit crunch slamming stocks in 2023.
summary: Hedgeye CEO Keith McCullough predicts a U.S. corporate profit recession and credit crunch in 2023, causing a slide in the S&P 500, junk bonds, and previous market favorites like Tesla. McCullough, who has been critical of the Federal Reserve's handling of inflation and interest rates, recommends investors consider gold, silver, and defensive ETFs as a hedge. He views the Nasdaq as a prime short opportunity due to these anticipated market conditions.

title: Ryder layoffs: 800 jobs to be cut at Applied Materials site
summary: Ryder System Inc. will cut 800 jobs and close its operations at the Applied Materials site in Austin, as disclosed in a letter to the Texas Workforce Commission. The transportation and logistics company expects "one or more other operators" to take over its responsibilities. This move comes despite Ryder reporting significant revenue increases in Q3 2022.

title: CES 2023: AMD, Nvidia, auto applications get the hype, but analysts say this one chip maker ruled
summary: At CES 2023, while companies like Advanced Micro Devices Inc. and Nvidia Corp. received significant attention, analysts suggest that a lower-profile chip maker is better positioned post-convention. Morgan Stanley analyst Joseph Moore noted ongoing caution regarding overall chip demand, particularly due to softness in China, but highlighted autos as a strong theme at the event.

title: The ARK Innovation ETF: Tesla Is Cathie Wood’s Latest Problem
summary: The ARK Innovation ETF (ARKK) is experiencing a difficult start to 2023, largely due to the continued selloff of Tesla Inc. (TSLA) stock, its most heavily weighted investment. Despite averaging down on Tesla, its weighting in ARKK has decreased to 6.6%, though overconcentration remains a concern for the fund.

title: Tuesday's ETF with Unusual Volume: IWL
summary: The iShares Russell Top 200 ETF (IWL) experienced unusually high trading volume on Tuesday, with shares down about 0.8%. Tesla and Apple, major components of the ETF, saw significant trading volume and share price drops, while PayPal Holdings performed best, rising 4.3%.

title: The AP Interview: GM’s Barra talks electric vehicles, future
summary: General Motors CEO Mary Barra is confident the company will surpass Tesla in U.S. electric vehicle sales by mid-decade, despite economic challenges like inflation, rising interest rates, and chip shortages. GM plans to introduce more affordable EVs, including a Chevrolet Equinox SUV for around $30,000, and aims to offer 30 battery-powered vehicles globally by 2025. Barra also discussed GM's strategy for battery cost reduction, expanding charging infrastructure, and navigating geopolitical challenges and social issues.

title: Autodesk Officially Moves HQ to San Francisco but Shrinks Bay Area Footprint
summary: Autodesk has officially moved its headquarters to San Francisco, a largely symbolic move as the company had been operating from its Market Street offices for years. Despite the official relocation, Autodesk is shrinking its office footprint in the city, subleasing newly renovated space on Mission Street due to employees working remotely, reflecting a broader trend among tech companies in the Bay Area. The move also highlights the political significance for San Francisco as other tech companies opt to leave the Bay Area for locations with lower costs.

title: Cathie Wood's ARK Innovation ETF has lagged the Nasdaq since 2018, while collecting over $200 million in fees
summary: Cathie Wood's ARK Innovation ETF (ARKK) has significantly underperformed the Nasdaq 100 index fund (QQQ) over the past four years, despite collecting over $200 million in fees. While ARKK gained 104.8% from January 2018 to January 2022, QQQ gained 130% in the same period, beating ARKK by approximately 23%. This underperformance highlights the common argument that index funds often outperform actively managed portfolios due to lower fees and less trading.

title: GM tells remote workers to ‘pivot’ in return-to-office mandate
summary: General Motors has mandated that its corporate employees return to the office three days a week, requiring remote workers to "pivot to a more regular in-person work cycle." This decision aligns GM with other major corporations like Apple and Peloton, which have also implemented return-to-office policies since Labor Day. The move contrasts with more flexible policies from companies such as Ford and Mitsubishi, as well as Tesla's CEO Elon Musk's strict in-office requirement.

title: GM opens EV fulfillment centers. Here's how they affect dealers, buyers
summary: General Motors has launched EV fulfillment centers to streamline the delivery of electric vehicles, beginning with Chevrolet Bolts, aiming to get products to customers faster and save costs for both GM and dealerships. While some dealers initially feared this move might mimic Tesla's direct sales model, top dealers and experts see it as a strategic partnership to enhance the customer experience, reduce overhead for retailers, and improve market competitiveness. These centers promise faster order fulfillment, with GM President Mark Reuss stating deliveries can be made in as little as four days, and are expected to save the company $2,000 per unit, leveraging cloud data and machine learning for optimal inventory management.

title: GM's Barra goes quiet on Twitter following rival Musk's takeover
summary: General Motors and its CEO, Mary Barra, significantly reduced their Twitter activity, including halting advertising, after Elon Musk completed his acquisition of the platform. This move is attributed to concerns over data management and advertising strategies, particularly since Musk also owns rival electric vehicle maker Tesla. While GM's main brands and Barra have gone quiet, some parts of GM, such as the BrightDrop electric van business and Cruise, and other automakers like Ford, continue to use Twitter.

title: What the Stock Split by Google’s Parent, Alphabet, Means - WSJ
summary: Alphabet announced a 20-for-1 stock split, its first since 2014, making its shares more accessible to individual investors. This move follows similar actions taken by Apple and Tesla since the pandemic, signaling a renewed interest in stock splits among major tech companies. The split will apply to all three classes of Alphabet stock.

title: Tesla Poised for Delivery Record Despite Demand Concerns
summary: Tesla is expected to announce record quarterly deliveries despite investor concerns over inflation, rising interest rates, and softening demand. The company offered a $7,500 discount and free Supercharging to U.S. customers at year-end, coinciding with the upcoming restoration of federal tax credits under the Inflation Reduction Act. Analysts estimate fourth-quarter deliveries to be around 421,000 units.

title: Musk tells Tesla workers not to be 'bothered by stock market craziness'
summary: Elon Musk, CEO of Tesla Inc., urged employees not to be concerned by the company's significant stock decline, which saw shares fall nearly 70% this year amidst demand jitters and his involvement with Twitter. In an email, Musk expressed his belief that Tesla will ultimately be the most valuable company globally and pushed staff to prioritize deliveries to close out the quarter. This appeal came as analysts cut price targets for Tesla, forecasting a shift from supply exceeding demand to demand exceeding supply in 2023.

title: ERTH: Holding Up Well Despite Tesla Tanking (NYSEARCA:ERTH)
summary: The Invesco MSCI Sustainable Future ETF (ERTH) is a sustainability-focused fund with global holdings, which has demonstrated resilience despite a high concentration in electric vehicle stocks like Tesla. The article suggests that the ETF's diversification strategy has been effective in mitigating downside risks for investors interested in higher-risk asset classes. The author highlights the fund's broad range of holdings focused on sustainable operations and technologies, including unexpected top-10 holdings in net-zero focused data centers.

title: Tesla shares extend losses on demand worries in China
summary: Tesla shares fell sharply after a Reuters report indicated the company plans a reduced production schedule in January at its Shanghai plant due to demand concerns in China. Investors are also worried about CEO Elon Musk's time commitment to Twitter and his recent share sales, contributing to the stock's significant decline.

title: Tesla stopped reporting its Autopilot safety numbers online. Why?
summary: Tesla ceased reporting its Autopilot safety statistics online in 2021, around the same time the National Highway Traffic Safety Administration (NHTSA) began collecting and releasing its own data. Critics suggest Tesla stopped reporting because its safety record, based on NHTSA numbers, appears to have worsened significantly compared to its sales growth and rivals like Ford and GM. The article also highlights the controversial nature of Tesla's past safety reports and the distinction between Autopilot and the more advanced, aspirational Full Self-Driving (FSD) feature, emphasizing that even FSD requires full human attention.

title: Elon Musk's vow to not sell more Tesla stock fails to calm investors
summary: Elon Musk's pledge not to sell more Tesla stock for two years failed to reassure investors, as shares hit a new two-year low. This comes after Musk previously sold $40 billion worth of shares, partly to fund his acquisition of Twitter, despite similar past pledges. Investors are concerned about Musk's focus on Twitter and his history of issues with the SEC.

title: Elon Musk says he will not sell more Tesla stock for about two years
summary: Elon Musk has stated he will not sell any more Tesla (TSLA.O) stock for approximately two years, anticipating a "serious recession" in 2023. This announcement comes amid a significant sell-off of Tesla shares due to concerns about softening demand and Musk's focus on Twitter. Tesla shares rose in after-hours trading following his comments despite previous instances where Musk sold stock after similar pledges.

title: Electric cars are taking off, but when will battery recycling follow?
summary: The article explores the nascent but critical industry of electric vehicle battery recycling, highlighting the challenges and opportunities for companies like Redwood Materials and Li-Cycle. Despite significant investment and the environmental necessity, the industry faces a shortage of used batteries for recycling for at least a decade, as most EVs on the road are new and batteries have long lifespans. The focus for now is on recycling manufacturing scrap, with a future shift towards end-of-life vehicle batteries.

title: Tesla Dangles $7,500 Discount in Rare Move to Boost Deliveries
summary: Tesla is offering a rare $7,500 discount on its Model 3 and Model Y vehicles for deliveries taken before year-end, signaling potential struggles with demand. This discount is double what was offered earlier in the month and aligns with anticipated changes in US tax credit eligibility for consumers. The move represents a departure from Elon Musk's previous stance against discounts and advertising.

title: Tesla owners didn’t buy a car: We bought a set of beliefs Elon is trashing
summary: The author, a Tesla owner, argues that buying a Tesla was an investment in a set of beliefs and a brand dedicated to doing good in the world, not just a car. However, Elon Musk's recent behavior, particularly since his acquisition of Twitter, has undermined these beliefs, causing disillusionment and embarrassment among many loyal customers and investors. The article details how Musk's erratic actions and political pandering are jeopardizing the strong brand loyalty Tesla had cultivated and leading to financial and emotional divestment from the company and its mission.

title: Tesla falls on growing angst over Musk's focus on Twitter
summary: Tesla shares fell nearly 6% after several brokerages cut price targets due to concerns over Elon Musk's focus on Twitter. Analysts fear Musk may need to sell more Tesla shares to fund Twitter, and the social media acquisition could harm Tesla's brand. This comes amid weakening demand in China and ahead of Tesla's quarterly deliveries report.

title: Megatrends: Driving Toward Electric Vehicle Mass Adoption
summary: The electric vehicle (EV) market is projected for significant growth, with EVs expected to account for 90% of auto sales by 2050, driven by automaker investment, consumer demand, and supportive public policy. Long-term investors can find opportunities across three tiers: EV auto companies and battery manufacturers, key suppliers, and ancillary service providers, despite potential roadblocks like supply constraints and insufficient infrastructure. Morgan Stanley's Wealth Management division provides insights into investment strategies for this megatrend.

title: Tesla fired workers for criticizing Musk, company policies, say new complaints
summary: Tesla is facing new complaints alleging the company illegally fired two employees for their involvement in drafting letters critical of the company and CEO Elon Musk. The workers claim their firings were intended to discourage other employees from speaking up about working conditions and company policies. Similar claims have been filed against SpaceX, another company owned by Musk.

title: Red-Hot Solar Stock Earns 'Top Pick' Status
summary: Goldman Sachs has named SolarEdge Technologies Inc (NASDAQ:SEDG) as a top pick for 2023 in the solar energy industry, alongside First Solar (FSLR). This endorsement comes despite the stock being down 1.1% recently, as SEDG has shown a 37% gain this quarter and boasts strong support from its 20-day moving average. Options traders have also been overwhelmingly bullish on SEDG in the past two months, as indicated by a high call/put volume ratio.

title: Elon Musk’s troubling week pushes Tesla investors closer to the edge
summary: Elon Musk's controversial actions and management of Twitter have led to a significant 16 percent drop in Tesla's stock price over the last five sessions, marking its worst week since March 2020. Prominent Wall Street analysts have reduced their expectations for Tesla, and concerns about the economy and potential recession are expected to further impact demand for electric vehicles. This decline has pushed Tesla's market value below $500 billion, and analysts warn of further risks due to valuation and Musk's preoccupation with Twitter.

title: G.M. Unit’s Self-Driving Taxis Are Subject of U.S. Safety Investigation (Published 2022)
summary: The National Highway Traffic Safety Administration has launched a preliminary investigation into General Motors' Cruise division over reports of its self-driving taxis stopping unexpectedly or too quickly. This probe covers 242 vehicles and addresses concerns that such incidents could strand passengers in unsafe locations or create obstacles for other vehicles, increasing accident risks. While no fatalities or serious injuries have been reported with Cruise cars, this investigation marks a significant step in regulatory scrutiny of autonomous vehicle technology.

title: What is Tesla?
summary: This article provides an overview of Tesla, detailing its history, product lines, and key figures. It covers the company's founding, its role as a pioneer in electric vehicles and energy storage, and the current ownership structure with Elon Musk as the largest shareholder. The article also addresses reasons for the recent decline in TSLA stock price, attributing it to investor concerns about Elon Musk's involvement with Twitter and his sale of Tesla shares.

title: Elon Musk sold $3.6 billion more in Tesla stock, stoking fear that the carmaker is his ‘ATM’
summary: Elon Musk has sold an additional $3.6 billion in Tesla stock, raising fears among investors that he is using the carmaker as a personal "ATM" to fund his other ventures, particularly Twitter. This latest sale of nearly 22 million shares occurred between December 12 and December 14, causing Tesla shares to drop by 12.4% over three trading sessions. The ongoing stock sales and Musk's involvement with Twitter continue to be concerns for Tesla investors regarding operational and financial distractions.

title: DI wealth advisor hits Wall Street, launches fund on NYSE
summary: Daniel Island resident Adam Curran, founder of Curran Financial Partners, has launched a new ETF on the NYSE called the "God Bless America ETF" under the ticker "YALL." The fund, valued at over $25 million, invests in American-based companies that prioritize profits over political activism. This achievement marks a lifelong dream for Curran, who plans to ring the NYSE bell in January to celebrate.

title: GraniteShares goes live with three leveraged single stock ETFs on NASDAQ
summary: GraniteShares has launched three new leveraged single-stock ETFs on the NASDAQ Stock Exchange, offering sophisticated investors 1.5x to 1.75x long exposure to Meta, Alibaba, and Nvidia. This expansion builds on GraniteShares' existing leveraged ETF offerings for Tesla, Coinbase, and Apple and aims to make leveraged single-company exposure, previously confined to specialists, accessible to a broader range of investors. Having pioneered the single-stock ETF market in Europe, GraniteShares is now bringing its expertise and popular product range to the U.S. market.

title: Tesla Investors Voice Concern Over Elon Musk’s Focus on Twitter
summary: Tesla investors are increasingly concerned that Elon Musk's focus on Twitter is negatively impacting the electric-vehicle maker. The company's stock is headed for its worst full-year performance amidst Musk's controversial takeover of Twitter. A major investor even tweeted that "There is no TSLA CEO today," reflecting the growing anxieties.

title: Albemarle Corporation Selects Mecklenburg County for Advanced Lithium Technology Park
summary: Albemarle Corporation is investing $200 million to establish an advanced lithium technology and R&D center in Mecklenburg County, creating 205 jobs. This move reinforces the region's position as a leader in electric vehicle innovation and clean energy, with the new facility focusing on next-generation lithium products and enhancing lithium recovery and production. The project is a collaborative effort involving several local and state entities, contributing significantly to capital investment and job creation in the area.

title: As GM Installs Thousands of Electric Charges, Watch This ETF
summary: General Motors plans to install 40,000 electric vehicle chargers, primarily in rural areas, to support its goal of selling only zero-emission passenger vehicles by 2035. This significant infrastructure expansion nearly doubles the current number of charging stations in America, highlighting the rapid growth in the EV sector. Investors can capitalize on this trend through ETFs like the Direxion Daily Electric and Autonomous Vehicles Bull 2X Shares (EVAV), which provides leveraged exposure to companies involved in electric and autonomous vehicles and their supporting infrastructure.

title: U.S. finalizes $2.5 billion loan to GM, LG battery joint venture
summary: The U.S. Energy Department announced the finalization of a $2.5 billion low-cost loan to Ultium Cells LLC, a joint venture between General Motors Co and LG Energy Solution. This loan will fund three new lithium-ion battery cell manufacturing facilities in Ohio, Tennessee, and Michigan, creating 6,000 construction jobs and 5,100 operations jobs. The initiative supports President Biden's goal for 50% of U.S. auto production to be electric or plug-in hybrid vehicles by 2030 and GM's plan to produce 1 million EVs in North America by 2025.

title: Rivian Scraps Plan to Make Electric Vans in Europe With Mercedes
summary: Rivian Automotive Inc. has scrapped its plans to jointly build electric vans in Europe with Mercedes-Benz AG, just three months after signing a memorandum of understanding. CEO RJ Scaringe stated that focusing on its consumer and existing commercial businesses represents the most attractive near-term opportunities for Rivian. This decision marks another setback for Rivian's global ambitions and follows a previous abandoned partnership with Ford Motor Co.

title: Questions arise on whether more is better in PRT market
summary: The article questions the current state of the pension risk transfer (PRT) market, highlighting concerns raised by Sen. Chris Murphy regarding outdated Department of Labor guidance. The sentiment revolves around whether an increased volume in PRT translates to improved outcomes for workers or introduces new risks due to regulatory stagnation.

title: Kwang Yang looking to unseat Gogoro by 2024
summary: Kwang Yang Motor Co aims to overtake Gogoro Inc as Taiwan's leading electric scooter vendor by 2024, driven by increasing brand awareness and sales of its new Ionex Air model. The company plans to expand internationally, focusing on India and Europe, while overcoming challenges like chip shortages and establishing brand recognition as a market newcomer.

title: Tesla launches EVs in Thailand amid competition from cheaper brands
summary: Tesla Inc. has launched two electric vehicle models in Thailand, marking its first entry into the market previously dominated by Japanese automakers. The move comes as Thailand promotes EV adoption through tax cuts and subsidies, but Tesla faces strong competition from Chinese brands offering more affordable options. Tesla did not disclose sales targets, as Thailand aims for 30% of its vehicle production to be electric by 2030.

title: Polestar 2 Electric Vehicle achieves 5-Star Safety Rating from US National Highway Traffic Safety Administration
summary: The Polestar 2 electric vehicle has received a 5-star overall safety rating from the U.S. National Highway Traffic Safety Administration (NHTSA), the highest possible score. This achievement follows its 5-star EuroNCAP rating and highlights Polestar's commitment to safety, building on Volvo Cars' legacy with advanced protective and preventive technologies. The article also provides an overview of Polestar Automotive Holding UK PLC, its vehicle lineup, and future plans.
