title: How suite of dividend growth ETFs brings quality to the fore
summary: In an environment of market volatility and economic uncertainty, CI WisdomTree ETFs offer a quality-focused core portfolio solution that has outperformed benchmarks. These dividend growth ETFs, managed by CI Global Asset Management, employ a unique methodology to identify companies with strong fundamentals, sustainable earnings, and resilient business models, screening for quality and growth metrics. This strategy aims to provide diversified large-cap exposure and long-term stability by avoiding overvalued companies and focusing on profitable dividend payers, proving particularly effective during periods of economic contraction.

title: Tesla expands with the first electric Semi-truck to PepsiCo
summary: Five years after its prototype reveal, Tesla delivered its first electric Semi-truck to PepsiCo\'s Frito-Lay in Modesto, California. PepsiCo has reserved 100 trucks and plans to deploy 15 by year-end, aiming to reduce fuel costs and emissions. Tesla CEO Elon Musk projects significant cargo transportation cost decreases and safety boosts, with a tentative plan to produce 50,000 Semis for North America in 2024.

title: Honda Unveils Next-generation Technologies of Honda SENSING 360 and Honda SENSING Elite
summary: Honda announced the next-generation technologies for its Honda SENSING 360 and Honda SENSING Elite safety and driver-assistive systems. These advancements aim to further reduce driver burden and prevent collisions by incorporating new functions and utilizing AI technologies for extended applicability, including non-expressways. Honda also outlined targets to equip all new automobile models globally with Honda SENSING (including 360 and Elite with motorcycle detection) by 2030, aiming to halve global traffic collision fatalities involving Honda vehicles and motorcycles by the same year.

title: Tesla Delivers Semi Trucks to PepsiCo, Expanding Beyond Passenger Vehicles
summary: Tesla Inc. delivered its first all-electric semitrailer trucks to PepsiCo Inc. on Thursday, marking a significant expansion beyond its traditional passenger vehicle market. This delivery comes five years after Elon Musk initially revealed the Semi model, which was originally due out in 2019. The Semi represents the first new model Tesla has put into customer hands since early 2020.

title: Special Report: Electric Vehicles – Electric Energy
summary: This report details the growing electric vehicle market in the Los Angeles area, highlighting manufacturers like Xos Inc., Faraday Future, Karrior Electric Vehicles TransLectric, and BYD Motors. It discusses the challenges and opportunities in the EV sector, including operational cost savings for fleets, the need for more charging infrastructure, and anticipated industry consolidation. The article also touches on the unique products and strategies of these companies, from electric step vans to luxury EVs and industrial vehicles.

title: Power to the People: How a single tweet could reignite a movement
summary: A fake tweet from an impersonating account claiming Eli Lilly was making insulin free went viral, significantly impacting the company's stock value and highlighting the potential for social media activism. This incident, enabled by changes to Twitter's verification system, sparked renewed debate on corporate greed, particularly regarding pharmaceutical pricing, and demonstrated how "internet trolls" could force corporations to address public concerns. The article suggests this event could reignite movements for social and corporate accountability.

title: Tesla Confirmed the Cybertruck Is Made of Starship Material Supplied by Steel Dynamics
summary: Tesla has officially confirmed that its Cybertruck is made of steel supplied by Steel Dynamics Inc. (SDI), the same company that provides material for SpaceX's Starship. This information was revealed during the "Inside Tesla: Supercharging the Electric Revolution" exhibition at the Petersen Automotive Museum, corroborating long-standing rumors. Franz von Holzhausen, Senior Design Executive at Tesla, also confirmed the accuracy of the information presented at the exhibit.

title: EVgo Opens New Fast Charging Station in East Bay to Support Local EV Adoption
summary: EVgo Inc. has opened a new public fast charging station at Marina Square Shopping Center in San Leandro, California, featuring 100kW and 350kW chargers for up to four vehicles. This station, supported by the California Energy Commission and Uber, aims to enhance EV adoption, particularly for rideshare drivers, near Oakland International Airport and I-880. The initiative is part of the Northern California Charging Access for Reliable On-Demand Transportation Services (CARTs) grant program, providing critical charging infrastructure in a high-demand area.

title: Weekly Recalls: Ford, Kia, Tesla (2)
summary: This article details recent recalls announced by Kia, Ford, and Tesla. Kia is recalling certain 2017-2018 Niro hybrid electric vehicles due to a potential issue with the Power Relay Assembly overheating rear seats. Ford is recalling 2021-2022 F-150 vehicles for a front windshield wiper motor failure. Tesla has two recalls: one for 2021-2023 Model X vehicles due to an incorrect front passenger airbag deployment calibration and another for 2023 Model 3 and 2020-2023 Model Y vehicles concerning intermittent taillight illumination.

title: Musk says he made some Tesla decisions without board nod, defends $56 bln pay
summary: Elon Musk testified in court, defending his $56 billion Tesla pay package against claims he dictated terms to the board. He acknowledged making some decisions without board approval, including ending Bitcoin acceptance and discussing stock buybacks, but denied that his pay package goals were easy to achieve. The trial centers on whether Musk exerted undue influence to secure his compensation.

title: Ford fighting electric vehicle bottlenecks with industrial automation giant
summary: Ford has partnered with industrial automation giant Rockwell to address electric vehicle (EV) manufacturing bottlenecks and accelerate its EV rollout to meet overwhelming demand. This collaboration aims to enhance Ford's production capabilities and supply chain efficiency for its next three EV assembly lines, including the Blue Oval City campus. Ford wants to become the number one EV brand, trailing only Tesla in US sales, and believes this partnership will help strengthen its manufacturing prowess.

title: Musk's all-nighters at Twitter raise concern for Tesla investors
summary: Elon Musk's intense focus on Twitter, including working all-nighters at its San Francisco headquarters, is causing concern among Tesla investors about his capacity to lead the electric carmaker. Tesla's stock has dropped 50% since Musk disclosed his stake in Twitter in April, and his recent tweets have shown a significant shift in attention towards Twitter. While some supporters remain confident, others in the financial community fear Twitter has become a major distraction for Musk, negatively impacting Tesla's brand and stock performance.

title: Court told Musk's $56 billion pay wasn't for punching a clock
summary: A Delaware court heard arguments regarding Elon Musk's $56 billion Tesla pay package, with a director and former executive defending it against a shareholder's claim that Musk dictated terms. The shareholder alleges Musk used his dominance to craft the 2018 package and duped investors, while defendants argue the package incentivized Musk during a critical growth period for Tesla. The trial examines the board's latitude in setting executive compensation, especially for a controlling shareholder, and will impact the future of Musk's compensation from Tesla.

title: Trial over Tesla boss Musk’s $56bn pay package starts
summary: A trial has begun over allegations that Elon Musk's $56bn pay package from Tesla was based on easily achievable performance targets and that investors were misled into approving it. A shareholder is attempting to prove that Musk used his influence over Tesla’s board to dictate the terms of the 2018 package, which did not require him to work full-time at the company. Musk and Tesla's directors deny the allegations, arguing that the pay package incentivized him to guide Tesla through a critical growth period.

title: How Sysco Corp. plans to deploy 800 battery electric Class 8 trucks (and that’s just the beginning)
summary: Sysco Corp. plans to deploy 800 battery electric Freightliner eCascadia Class 8 tractors by 2026, aiming to electrify 35% of its U.S. broadline fleet, totaling around 2,500 electric trucks, by 2030. The company proactively partnered with Daimler Truck North America on eCascadia development and is now focused on solving charging infrastructure challenges, including using mobile charging solutions. Sysco prioritizes states friendly to electric charger installation and is looking to secure clean, sustainable energy for these operations.

title: Fake account posing as pharmaceutical giant says 'insulin is free', causes stocks to plummet
summary: Pharmaceutical company Eli Lilly & Co apologized after a fake "verified" Twitter account announced that insulin was free, causing the company's stock to drop. This incident highlights issues with Twitter's new verification policy under Elon Musk, which has led to a wave of impersonations of major brands and significant reputational risk for advertisers. The controversy led Twitter to temporarily roll back its premium service and revive "official" labels for some accounts.

title: 3 Stocks That May Be Kicked Out of the Dow Jones Industrial Average (and the 3 Stocks That Could Replace Them)
summary: This article discusses three companies, Walgreens Boots Alliance, Dow Inc., and Verizon Communications, that are at risk of being removed from the Dow Jones Industrial Average due to their declining influence or market cap. It also proposes potential replacements: CVS Health for Walgreens, Tesla for Dow Inc., and Alphabet for Verizon, highlighting how these changes could update the index to better reflect the current economic landscape. The Dow's share price-weighted methodology means that lower-priced stocks have less influence, making these companies vulnerable.

title: California's new solar energy proposal removes hefty grid connection fee
summary: California regulators have revised their proposal for rooftop solar systems, removing a controversial monthly grid connection fee while offering new support for low-income customers. The new plan, which still needs approval, aims to expand renewable energy and has significantly boosted shares of rooftop solar providers, despite concerns from some critics about reduced export rates and equitable distribution of incentives. The California Public Utilities Commission (CPUC) will vote on the proposal on Dec. 15, with implementation slated for April 15 next year.

title: Cathie Wood's ARK Innovation ETF surges 14% for its best day ever
summary: Cathie Wood's flagship ARK Innovation ETF (ARKK) experienced its best day ever, surging over 14% on Thursday following an easing inflation reading. Major holdings like Zoom Video, Tesla, Roku, and Teladoc saw significant jumps. This rally indicates a potential rebound for growth stocks if reduced price pressures lead the Federal Reserve to scale back its aggressive tightening.

title: Tesla stock hits two-year low after boss Musk sells more shares
summary: Tesla Inc shares have dropped to a two-year low after CEO Elon Musk sold $3.95 billion worth of shares. This sale, coupled with concerns about Musk's distraction due to his Twitter acquisition, has intensified investor jitters. Analysts are questioning Musk's credibility and urging him to refocus on Tesla amid increasing competition and production issues.

title: A Tailgate with Tesla comes to campus | College of Engineering and Applied Sciences
summary: Recruiters from Tesla Inc. will host "A Tailgate with Tesla" event at Western Michigan University's College of Engineering and Applied Sciences on November 16, 2022, to connect with students for co-op, internship, and entry-level positions. Kyle Liechty, a WMU alumnus and talent partner at Tesla, emphasizes the importance of genuine self-expression and technical alignment for prospective candidates. The event aims to recruit students from various engineering disciplines to help accelerate the world's transition to sustainable energy.

title: New Twitter owner Elon Musk sells almost $4 billion in Tesla stock
summary: Elon Musk, the new owner of Twitter, sold nearly $4 billion worth of Tesla shares between November 4 and November 8, according to regulatory filings. This latest sale brings his total Tesla stock sales since April to over $19 billion, largely to finance his acquisition of Twitter. The continuous sales have drawn criticism from industry analysts, especially since Musk had previously indicated he was done selling Tesla stock.

title: Assurant Enhances Electric Vehicle Coverage, Availability
summary: Assurant has announced significant enhancements to its EV One Protection product, designed for U.S. owners of Battery Electric Vehicles (BEVs) and Plug-in Hybrid Electric Vehicles (PHEVs). These updates focus on increased battery health transparency, expanded coverage for specific EV components including high-tech items, and enhanced value by covering wear and tear items not typically included in factory warranties. The company aims to address shortcomings in current EV insurance as electric vehicle ownership continues to grow.

title: 7 Electric Vehicle Stocks That Will Make You a Millionaire by 2030
summary: The electric vehicle market is booming, with sales accelerating globally. This article highlights seven EV-related stocks—Tesla, Lion Electric, Albemarle, Global X Autonomous & Electric Vehicles ETF, iShares Self-Driving EV and Tech ETF, Nio Inc., and General Motors—that are positioned to capitalize on this growth and potentially make investors millionaires by 2030. The author details the unique opportunities and recent performance of each stock, emphasizing their potential for significant returns.

title: Lithium Market Update: Elevated Prices Are Creating Favorable Dynamics for Miners
summary: The lithium market is experiencing elevated prices due to surging demand for electric vehicles (EVs) and the inelastic nature of lithium supply. Supply upgrades have not kept pace with this demand, leading to an expected supply deficit for several years, which creates favorable conditions for mining companies. This environment has resulted in strong financial performance for major lithium miners like Albemarle, SQM, and Ganfeng, who are now announcing significant capacity expansion plans.

title: Solid-state Hesai FT120 LiDAR covers blind spots on self-driving vehicles as Tesla keeps shunning radars
summary: Hesai has launched the FT120, a solid-state LiDAR designed to cover blind spots on self-driving vehicles, contrasting with Tesla's camera-only Vision system. While Tesla believes in its camera-based approach, other EV manufacturers and experts emphasize the need for LiDAR and radars for higher levels of autonomous driving, especially in adverse weather or as a redundancy. Hesai's FT120 has already secured orders for about one million units and is slated for delivery to autonomous vehicle makers in 2023.

title: Report: Tesla Cybertruck production won’t ramp up until late 2023
summary: A new report suggests that Tesla Cybertruck production might not ramp up until late 2023, meaning mass deliveries would not begin until 2024. This follows Elon Musk's previous announcement of "early production" by mid-2023. The article details the Cybertruck's long development timeline, initial specifications and pricing, and subsequent delays.

title: Blink Charging creates an effortless EV charging experience with new Plug&Charge tech
summary: Blink Charging is launching new Plug&Charge technology in partnership with Hubject to streamline the EV charging process, removing the need for apps or RFID cards. This move aims to make EV charging effortless and encourage further adoption of zero-emission vehicles. The company, which has expanded significantly and received substantial grants, introduces this feature to address range anxiety and simplify the user experience, following similar innovations in the EV charging sector.

title: GM pauses advertising on Twitter after Elon Musk takeover
summary: General Motors announced it is temporarily pausing its advertising on Twitter following Elon Musk's takeover of the social media platform. The automaker stated it is evaluating Twitter's "new direction" under its new ownership but will continue to use the platform for customer interactions. This decision raises concerns among analysts about a potential wave of advertisers pulling out, which could be disastrous given advertising accounts for 92% of Twitter's revenue.

title: GM temporarily suspends advertising on Twitter following Elon Musk takeover
summary: General Motors announced a temporary suspension of its advertising on Twitter following Elon Musk's acquisition of the social media platform. The automaker stated it is evaluating Twitter's new direction under Musk's ownership and will continue to use the platform for customer interactions but not paid advertising. Other auto companies, including Ford, Stellantis, and Rivian, are also assessing their ad strategies or have commented on their plans regarding the platform.

title: TrueCar Releases Analysis of October Industry Sales
summary: TrueCar expects total new vehicle industry sales to reach 1,165,658 units in October 2022, marking a 15% increase from the previous year. The seasonally adjusted annualized rate (SAAR) for light vehicle sales is estimated at 14.6 million, up 13% from October 2021. The analysis highlights a shift in market constraint from inventory to affordability due to increased interest rates and sustained elevated pricing.

title: How EVs Are Made Matters, General Motors Sustainability Chief Says
summary: General Motors' Chief Sustainability Officer, Kristen Siemen, discusses GM's commitment to zero-emission vehicles by 2035, highlighting investments in manufacturing, workforce training, and supply chain. The article emphasizes that the transition to EVs is not just about the final product but also about sustainable sourcing and manufacturing processes, supported by legislation like the Inflation Reduction Act. GM aims to educate consumers and provide a diverse portfolio of EVs to accelerate adoption.

title: Tesla faces U.S. criminal probe over self-driving car claims, sources say
summary: Tesla is under a previously undisclosed U.S. criminal investigation regarding claims that its electric vehicles can drive themselves. The probe by the U.S. Department of Justice began last year following over a dozen crashes, some fatal, involving Tesla's Autopilot driver assistance system. Prosecutors are examining whether Tesla misled consumers, investors, and regulators about the capabilities of its technology.

title: Mobileye pops more than 37% in market debut after spinning out of Intel
summary: Mobileye, Intel's self-driving car technology company, saw its shares surge over 37% in its stock market debut after spinning out of Intel. The IPO, which valued Mobileye at around $17 billion, raised $861 million, with Intel planning to use some proceeds to build chip factories. This market debut provides a notable tech IPO in a slow year, despite Mobileye's valuation being below Intel's initial expectations.

title: Creepy deepfake of Elon Musk tied up and held hostage goes viral
summary: A deepfake video of Elon Musk tied up and held hostage, created by reAlpha Tech Corp as an advertisement, has gone viral. The real-estate startup aims to get Musk's attention to join their board, highlighting the growing concern over convincing deepfakes and their ethical implications, further underscored by Scarlett Johansson's past experiences. The video also features a photoshopped Jeff Bezos.

title: General Motors CEO stresses EV sales progress in shareholder message
summary: General Motors CEO Mary Barra's message to shareholders highlighted significant progress in EV sales and outlined the company's strategy for an electric future. Despite global supply chain issues, GM posted an impressive earnings report with a double-digit profit margin and aims to rapidly grow EV volumes with upcoming models like the Chevrolet Equinox EV and GMC Sierra EV, focusing on high-volume, lower-priced options and vertical integration.

title: Wix Becomes An Official React Native Partner
summary: Wix.com Ltd. has announced its new status as an official partner of React Native (RN), an open-source UI software framework. This partnership signifies Wix's increased commitment to promoting open-source programming and advancing the RN framework by contributing its expertise and extensive RN codebase. Wix joins other major tech companies like Meta and Microsoft in shaping the future of React Native, which is used to build cross-platform mobile applications.

title: Lawsuit alleges Tesla HR, managers ignored ‘obscene and misogynistic’ music at work
summary: A former Tesla employee has filed a lawsuit alleging that the company's HR department and managers ignored "obscene and misogynistic" music at a Nevada worksite, leading to a sexually hostile work environment. The plaintiff claims Tesla violated Title VII of the Civil Rights Act of 1964 by failing to address her repeated complaints about the music, sexual remarks, stalking, and unwanted touching, ultimately forcing her to resign. The case highlights crucial requirements for HR professionals to address harassment promptly and appropriately to avoid employer liability.

title: Panasonic to source graphite from North America
summary: Panasonic has signed an MoU with Nouveau Monde Graphite (NMG) to establish a North American supply chain for graphite, a critical material for lithium-ion batteries. This move is driven by increasing electric vehicle demand and the need to localize sourcing, possibly influenced by the US Inflation Reduction Act. The partnership with NMG and Mitsui aims to secure responsibly sourced graphite from Quebec, aligning with Panasonic's carbon reduction goals.

title: ICL Group to build LFP cathode-material manufacturing plant in St. Louis
summary: ICL Group plans to build a $400-million lithium iron phosphate (LFP) cathode active material (CAM) manufacturing plant in St. Louis, which will be the first large-scale LFP material manufacturing plant in the United States. The company received $197 million in funding through the Bipartisan Infrastructure Law and expects the plant to be operational by 2024, producing 30,000 metric tons annually by 2025. This initiative aims to strengthen domestic supply chains for the growing EV and battery industries.

title: Industronics’ Executive Director Datuk Chu acquires around 10% of HK-based renowned stocking firm
summary: Industronics Berhad's Executive Director, Datuk Chu Boon Tiong, has personally acquired a 10% stake in Hong Kong-based Bluemount Financial Group Limited, coinciding with Industronics' own postponed acquisition interest in the firm. Another company, Tesla Technology Holdings Limited, also acquired a 26.08% stake in Bluemount, with the condition that Bluemount apply for listing on the London Stock Exchange's Main Market by the end of the year. Datuk Chu will join Bluemount's Board of Directors to lead its expansion in Southeast Asia, focusing on asset management, fund management, and IPO services.

title: Tesla stock down on growth worries
summary: Shares of Tesla Inc sank after Wall Street analysts expressed concerns that the electric carmaker's growth momentum may be hindered by rapid inflation and logistical challenges, causing several brokerages to cut price targets. Investors are also watching for signs of cooling consumer demand in the face of surging inflation and rising interest rates, which could impact Tesla's delivery growth targets. Despite these concerns, some analysts remain optimistic about Tesla's long-term prospects due to the global shift towards electric vehicles.

title: Tesla Sales Rise, but Revenue Still Lower Than Expected
summary: Tesla Inc. reported third-quarter revenue of $21.5 billion, falling short of analysts' estimates despite a 56% rise in sales. The company's shares declined as CEO Elon Musk acknowledged economic headwinds impacting demand and delivery challenges, though he remained confident about Q4 performance and future growth targets. Tesla is also pursuing a share buyback and building a lithium refinery to secure its supply chain.

title: Which companies are making solar panels in the United States?
summary: This article provides an updated overview of companies manufacturing solar panels in the United States as of late 2022. It details how the Inflation Reduction Act's manufacturing tax credits are expected to revitalize domestic solar production, which had been largely reduced to module assembly. The piece lists numerous companies with their current operations, expansion plans, and capacity figures, highlighting their responses to the new federal incentives.

title: 7 Things to Know About the God Bless America (YALL) ETF
summary: The God Bless America ETF (YALL) is a new exchange-traded fund designed to invest in "anti-woke" companies that avoid "left-leaning statements" unrelated to their businesses. The ETF prioritizes valuation metrics like P/E ratios and job growth, with Tesla (TSLA) and Nvidia (NVDA) as its top holdings. It will have an expense ratio of 0.65% and hold 30-40 U.S.-listed companies with market capitalizations over $1 billion.

title: Northeast embraces first-of-a-kind virtual power plant
summary: Sunrun announced that its virtual power plant, comprising 5,000 home solar and battery systems across four New England states, successfully exported power to the grid this summer, reducing energy demand and reliance on natural gas plants. This program marks New England as the first regional energy market to utilize such a virtual power plant, demonstrating its viability in multistate power markets. Virtual power plants like Sunrun's offer benefits by providing grid resilience, reducing costs for customers, and potentially replacing inefficient "peaking" natural gas plants.

title: Valkyrie to Liquidate Bitcoin Balance Sheet ETF After Limited Uptake
summary: Valkyrie Funds announced the liquidation of its Bitcoin Balance Sheet Opportunities ETF (VBB) due to limited investor uptake. The fund, which included companies like Tesla and MicroStrategy, will be liquidated by the end of October and delisted from Nasdaq, with investors receiving cash redemption. VBB had only about $570,000 in net assets under management and underperformed the S&P 500 significantly.

title: Why CATL Is the Global EV Battery Leader and How to Gain Exposure
summary: Contemporary Amperex Technology Co., Ltd (CATL) is the global leader in electric vehicle batteries, supplying major brands like Tesla, NIO, and Ford. The Chinese company, founded by Yuqun Zeng, has leveraged innovation and China's dominance in battery-grade metal refining to become a powerhouse in the rapidly growing EV market. Investors can gain exposure to CATL through various KraneShares ETFs, including KBA, KARS, and KGRN.

title: General Motors is launching its own energy storage service, GM Energy
summary: General Motors (GM) is launching a new energy storage service called GM Energy, which will offer residential and commercial customers services like stationary storage batteries, solar panels, and hydrogen fuel cells, similar to Tesla's offerings. The service will bundle public charging with "Ultium Home" and "Ultium Commercial" units, and GM expects to begin sales of Ultium Home boxes in late 2023. GM also plans to team up with SunPower Corp for solar panels and allow businesses to sell energy back to utilities during peak consumption.

title: General Motors takes on Tesla with new energy division
summary: General Motors is launching a new unit called GM Energy to offer energy storage and management services to residential and commercial customers, directly competing with Tesla's established energy business. GM Energy will provide EV chargers, stationary batteries, solar panels, and hydrogen fuel cells, with Ultium Home services starting in late 2023. The company aims to leverage its core competencies in vehicles and batteries to tap into a multi-billion dollar energy management market.

title: General Motors launches electric grid division
summary: General Motors has launched a new division called GM Energy, signaling the auto industry's strategic goal of fusing electric cars with the electric grid. This new unit will offer a comprehensive suite of energy services, including bi-directional charging, vehicle-to-home capabilities, stationary storage, and microgrid solutions, positioning GM to compete with companies like Tesla in the broader battery and energy market. The initiative aims to address challenges with grid infrastructure, energy storage, and management, with plans for dealerships to promote these new energy products and vehicles to serve as aggregated resources for utilities.

title: Pepsi first in line for Tesla semi truck deliveries starting in December
summary: Five years after its unveiling, the Tesla semi truck is finally set for delivery, with Pepsico Inc. being the first recipient in December. Pepsico has reserved 100 semi trucks and plans to have 15 on the road by year-end. This development follows Tesla's prioritization of other models due to supply shortages and is boosted by the Inflation Reduction Act's tax incentives for heavy-duty electric trucks.

title: PayPal says policy to fine customers for 'misinformation' was an 'error'
summary: PayPal clarified that a recent policy update suggesting fines for misinformation was an error and never intended to be implemented. The company faced significant backlash on social media, leading its shares to drop, and prominent figures like former president David Marcus and co-founder Elon Musk criticized the policy. PayPal apologized for the confusion caused by the incorrect information.

title: Tesla's China-made sales hit record following Shanghai factory upgrade
summary: Tesla Inc. delivered a record 83,135 China-made electric vehicles in September, following an upgrade to its Shanghai factory. This increase comes despite a challenging economic environment and growing competition from domestic EV makers in China. Globally, Tesla's third-quarter deliveries fell short of analyst expectations, yet still marked a record for the company.

title: Musk says Pepsi to receive Tesla's first Semi trucks in December
summary: Elon Musk announced that Tesla is starting production of its Semi electric trucks and PepsiCo Inc will receive the first deliveries on December 1st. The truck, which has a 500-mile range and is expected to cost $180,000, has seen its production timeline pushed back multiple times since its 2017 unveiling. PepsiCo had reserved 100 of these trucks to reduce fuel costs and fleet emissions.

title: Icahn had Twitter stake worth over $500 mln before Musk's about-face - WSJ
summary: Activist investor Carl Icahn amassed a Twitter stake worth over $500 million in the months leading up to Elon Musk's decision to proceed with the takeover. Icahn, who paid around the mid-$30s per share, made an estimated profit exceeding $250 million after Twitter shares jumped over 22% following Musk's announcement. Other investors like D.E. Shaw Group and Daniel Loeb's Third Point LLC are also expected to see significant gains from their recent bets on Twitter shares.

title: Is Tesla seeing a slowdown in demand?
summary: Early signs suggest a potential slowdown in demand for Tesla vehicles, indicated by falling waiting times for deliveries in the US and China and the company building more EVs than it delivered in Q3 2022. Analysts note increasing premium pricing and exposure to a decelerating global economy as key factors, while Tesla maintains it still has more demand than supply. The issue of demand and supply balance will be crucial for investors when the company reports quarterly results on October 19.

title: Micron chooses New York for $100B factory instead of Central Texas
summary: Micron Technology announced its decision to build a new $100 billion semiconductor factory in Central New York, opting against Lockhart, Texas, which had been a finalist for the facility. The move comes with the aid of $5.5 billion in incentives from New York. This investment is part of Micron's larger plan to invest $40 billion in the U.S.

title: Tesla's a 'key stock in everyone’s ESG portfolio.' So why is that so controversial?
summary: This article examines the controversy surrounding Tesla's inclusion in ESG portfolios despite its environmental contributions. While Tesla is a leader in EV technology and carbon emission reduction, concerns about its corporate governance, transparency on emissions, and controversies like racial discrimination and Autopilot safety issues have led to scrutiny and even removal from certain ESG indices. This highlights a fundamental debate within the ESG investing world regarding what constitutes true social responsibility and impact.

title: TTAC: Overweight Tech & Energy, Underweight Industrials & Communication
summary: The FCF US Quality ETF (TTAC) focuses on free cash flow to select approximately 150 stocks, aiming to outperform the Russell 3000. As of late August, TTAC was overweight in technology and energy sectors and underweight in industrials and communication services. FCF Advisors prioritizes free cash flow metrics, which they believe are more difficult to manipulate than GAAP earnings, especially in the current challenging investment environment.

title: CATL – The Battery Giant Leading Innovation In China A-Shares
summary: Contemporary Amperax Technology Co., Limited (CATL) is a leading innovator and one of the largest EV battery suppliers globally, providing batteries for major companies like Tesla, Ford, and NIO. Due to its listing on the Shenzhen Stock Exchange, CATL is often inaccessible to international investors through standard brokerage accounts and ETFs, making the KraneShares Bosera MSCI China A-Share ETF (KBA) a key avenue for investment access. The article highlights CATL's significant role in the EV market and its founder's origin story.

title: CATL – The Battery Giant Leading Innovation in China A-Shares
summary: This article highlights Contemporary Amperex Technology Co., Limited (CATL), the world's largest EV battery supplier, founded by Yuqun Zeng. Despite its global importance, CATL, trading on the Shenzhen Stock Exchange, is often inaccessible to international investors, but the KraneShares Bosera MSCI China A-Share ETF (KBA) includes it as a top holding. The company's success is attributed to its technological innovation, supply chain advantages within China, and efficient manufacturing processes, positioning it as a leader in the rapidly expanding EV battery market.

title: How China Is Transforming the Global Lithium Industry
summary: China has become a dominant force in the global lithium industry, controlling around 80% of battery cell manufacturing and holding key positions in both upstream and downstream supply chains. This ascendancy is driven by robust policy support, entrepreneurial breakthroughs from companies like CATL and BYD, and significant investments in lithium mines and energy storage solutions. China's strategic initiatives, including a shift towards LFP batteries and ambitious energy storage targets, position it to continue leading the lithium sector for the foreseeable future, impacting global renewable energy goals and EV adoption.

title: GM Is Doubling Down on Self-Driving Cars With LiDAR
summary: General Motors is heavily investing in LiDAR technology for self-driving cars, catching the attention of institutional investors like Cathie Wood's ARK Invest. GM plans to pour $35 billion into EV and AV product development by 2025, with LiDAR being a crucial component for autonomous vehicles to navigate. The global LiDAR market is projected for significant growth, offering investment opportunities through ETFs and specialized tech stock services.

title: Hertz is buying up to 175,000 electric vehicles from GM
summary: Hertz has announced a major purchase of up to 175,000 electric vehicles from General Motors over the next five years, expanding its EV rental fleet. This follows earlier agreements with Tesla and Polestar. The acquisitions will include a variety of GM's North American passenger vehicle brands and types, with GM aiming to significantly ramp up EV production and Hertz targeting a quarter of its fleet to be electric by 2024.

title: China's Xpeng says CATL is no longer its largest battery supplier
summary: Xpeng, a Chinese electric car maker, has diversified its battery suppliers and no longer considers CATL its largest. This move reflects a broader trend among Chinese EV automakers to seek alternative suppliers to better control costs, especially after CATL raised prices. Xpeng is now working with multiple battery makers, including Sunwoda for fast-charging technology and EVE and CALB for its vehicles.

title: NVIDIA Unveils DRIVE Thor — Centralized Car Computer Unifying Cluster, Infotainment, Automated Driving, and Parking in a Single, Cost-Saving System
summary: NVIDIA announced DRIVE Thor, its next-generation centralized computer for autonomous vehicles, delivering up to 2,000 teraflops of performance. This superchip unifies intelligent functions like automated driving, parking, and infotainment into a single architecture, significantly reducing system cost and complexity. ZEEKR, a Geely-owned automaker, is the first customer, planning to integrate DRIVE Thor into its intelligent electric vehicles starting in early 2025.

title: 7 Things to Know About the NANC ETF Aiming to Track Nancy Pelosi Stocks
summary: Unusual Whales has proposed two new ETFs, NANC and KRUZ, designed to track the trading activities of Democratic and Republican lawmakers, respectively. The NANC ETF is inspired by Speaker Nancy Pelosi's successful trades, while KRUZ would follow Republican activity, including Senator Ted Cruz. These ETFs aim to allow investors to mirror the investment decisions of politicians, leveraging their perceived stock-picking skills.

title: TSLQ Stock Fund Price and Chart — NASDAQ:TSLQ
summary: This article provides detailed information on the Tradr 2X Short TSLA Daily ETF (TSLQ), including its current price, chart data, key statistics like AUM and expense ratio, and its investment strategy. It highlights that TSLQ is a short-term tactical tool designed to deliver -2x the daily price return of Tesla stock and discusses its recent name changes and risks. The article also includes various trading ideas and technical analyses from different contributors regarding TSLQ.

title: Asset Allocation, International Stocks, Bonds, and Small and Mid Cap Value Factors
summary: This article discusses various aspects of asset allocation, including whether it should change in retirement, the rationale for international stock investing despite recent US outperformance, and concerns about bonds in a bear market. It also covers the pros and cons of small-cap vs. mid-cap value funds, considerations for taxable accounts, and the balance between saving and spending money after achieving financial independence.

title: Tesla struggles with Elon Musk’s strict return-to-office policy
summary: Three months after Elon Musk's strict return-to-office mandate, Tesla faces challenges with insufficient office space and resources to accommodate all employees. The policy has led to a decline in morale, increased absenteeism tracking, and the dismissal of some remote workers who could not relocate, impacting the company's ability to retain talent.

title: Palo Alto Networks 3-for-1 stock split: What to Know
summary: Palo Alto Networks completed a 3-for-1 stock split, with shares gaining slightly on the first day of trading post-split before moving into negative territory. Shareholders of record as of September 6 received two additional shares for each one held, distributed after the close of trading on September 13. The company stated the split aims to make shares more accessible to employees and a broader base of investors, following significant stock price increases since its IPO.

title: The best ways to buy strategic metals
summary: This article discusses investment opportunities in strategic metals, particularly in the alternative-energy sector, despite recent price weaknesses. The author highlights companies and ETFs related to battery technology and nuclear energy, explaining that short-term price fluctuations may obscure long-term structural drivers like increased demand for EVs and the need for new mining and refining capacity. Investors are advised to consider these niches as a potential opportunity if they believe in a structural transformation away from hydrocarbons.

title: Under the Hood of RCD
summary: The Invesco S&P 500 Equal Weight Consumer Discretionary ETF (RCD) saw significant inflows in August, making it the most popular Invesco equal-weight sector ETF for the month. RCD offers investors exposure to the consumer discretionary sector with an equal-weighted approach, diversifying away from large-cap bias and providing a tilt towards smaller, potentially undervalued companies. This strategy aims to reduce concentration risk by ensuring each of its 60 holdings, including companies like Etsy, Tesla, and Amazon, receives approximately equal allocation during quarterly rebalances.

title: TESLA Inc. looking to bring lithium refinery to Coastal Bend
summary: Tesla Inc. is considering building a "battery-grade lithium hydroxide refining facility" in the Coastal Bend area of Texas, near Robstown, or potentially in Louisiana. The company has applied for tax breaks from the state of Texas, which could lead to significant job creation and economic growth for the chosen location. However, the proposal faces concerns regarding water usage and environmental impact from some local residents.

title: General Motors CEO reveals new electric vehicle
summary: General Motors CEO Mary Barra announced a new all-electric Chevrolet Equinox, priced around $30,000, aiming to make EVs more affordable and increase GM's electric product line to 40% by 2025. Barra also addressed supply chain challenges and the company's commitment to environmental goals.

title: Formerly Sacred Now Rotting Silicon Valley Dictum of “Growth at All Costs” Crushes Okta: Shares Collapse 80% from Peak
summary: Okta, a company that provides secure access to cloud-based systems, has seen its shares collapse by 80% from their February 2021 peak after reporting a $210 million net loss and lowering its guidance. Despite consistent and growing annual net losses exceeding $2 billion, executives and analysts have ironically reframed these as "profitability," highlighting a prevailing Silicon Valley mantra of "growth at all costs." The company's struggles are attributed to "sales challenges" and "integration challenges" related to its 2021 acquisition of Auth0, signaling the potential end of an era for this business model.

title: The electric vehicle boom could bring lithium mines back to North Carolina
summary: Driven by the electric vehicle boom and the Inflation Reduction Act, lithium mining companies are looking to reopen mines in North Carolina, a region with significant lithium deposits and a history of mining. However, these plans face strong opposition from local residents concerned about environmental impacts like water contamination, dust, and increased traffic. While some communities in North Carolina are supportive of the mining developments due to potential economic benefits, others highlight the contentious trade-offs between clean energy goals and localized environmental and social costs of mineral extraction.

title: Honda Motor, LG Energy to build $4.4 bln U.S. EV battery plant
summary: Honda Motor and LG Energy Solution announced a joint venture to build a $4.4 billion lithium-ion battery plant for electric vehicles in the U.S., with a target annual production capacity of 40 GWh. The batteries will exclusively supply Honda facilities in North America for Honda and Acura EV models, with construction planned for early 2023 and mass production by the end of 2025. This move aligns with U.S. government policies pushing for domestic battery and EV manufacturing and comes as the country implements stricter regulations and tax credit eligibility for EVs.

title: Mirae Asset Global Electric & Autonomous Vehicles ETFs Fund of Fund: Should You Invest?
summary: This article evaluates the Mirae Asset Global Electric & Autonomous Vehicles ETFs Fund of Fund, highlighting the significant growth in the EV/AV sector and government policies supporting it. The fund aims to provide long-term capital appreciation by investing in overseas equity ETFs focused on companies involved in the EV/AV value chain. It discusses the investment strategy, asset allocation, and potential risks, concluding that it is suitable for investors with a decent understanding of the new-age automobile segment and a long-term investment horizon.

title: Marsh McLennan's Mercer restructures investments and retirement group leadership
summary: Mercer, a Marsh McLennan company, is restructuring the leadership of its investments and retirement group. This move indicates strategic changes within the company regarding how it manages these core areas. The article, published by Pensions & Investments, details this significant organizational change.

title: Starbox Group (STBX) Stock Price, News & Analysis
summary: This article provides an overview of Starbox Group (STBX), including its stock price, company information, and recent news. Starbox Group engages in cash rebate and digital advertising services in Malaysia through its GETBATS, SEEBATS, and PAYBATS platforms. Recent headlines highlight a share consolidation effective April 15, 2025, a staff determination notice from Nasdaq, and a significant stock price decline.

title: PG&E, Tesla virtual power plant delivers 16.5 MW to California grid amid calls for energy conservation
summary: Nearly 2,500 PG&E customers with Tesla battery systems contributed up to 16.5 MW of solar power to California's grid, marking the first activation of the virtual power plant. This initiative comes as California faces high temperatures and calls for energy conservation, with participating customers receiving $2/kWh for exported electricity. The program aims to bolster grid reliability during peak demand and emergencies.

title: These Wide-Moat Stocks Are Gaining Ground
summary: Quality stocks with wide economic moats, including Microsoft and Amazon, have outperformed since the bear market low in June, despite still being undervalued. While narrow-moat stocks have seen stronger recent gains due to market-cap weighting of companies like Apple and Tesla, wide-moat companies are better positioned to handle inflation due to their pricing power. Overall, Morningstar analysts consider wide-moat stocks to be deeply undervalued compared to overpriced narrow-moat stocks.

title: Ford is laying off about 3,000 workers
summary: Ford Motor Co. is laying off approximately 3,000 white-collar and contract workers in the U.S. and Canada as part of a restructuring effort to lower costs and accelerate its transition to electric vehicles. The cuts, which represent about 6% of its salaried workforce in the region, come after the company's executive chairman and CEO emphasized the need to reshape operations and improve competitiveness against rivals like General Motors, Stellantis, and Tesla. Ford aims to streamline its business by eliminating redundant work and reorganizing functions across its various units.

title: Why the ESG/Tech Combination Is Important
summary: Broad market environmental, social, and governance (ESG) exchange-traded funds (ETFs) frequently have significant allocations to technology stocks. For example, the Invesco ESG Nasdaq 100 ETF (QQMG) has a technology weight of almost 62%. While some critics view this as over-reliance on tech, experts argue that technology companies often embody sustainable development principles, making them suitable for ESG funds despite facing scrutiny on issues like data privacy and energy consumption.

title: GM restores quarterly dividend after more than two years
summary: General Motors Co (GM.N) announced the reinstatement of its quarterly dividend payouts, signaling confidence in its recovery from the pandemic's impact and recent economic turbulence. The first dividend of 9 cents per share will be paid on September 15, 2022. GM also increased its share repurchase program capacity to $5.0 billion, highlighting its strengthened financial position and commitment to returning capital to shareholders amidst its electric vehicle expansion.

title: General Motors reinstates dividend; CEO Mary Barra cites confidence driven by electric vehicle growth
summary: General Motors (GM) has reinstated its dividend, with CEO Mary Barra attributing this decision to confidence driven by the company's growth in electric vehicles. Barra previously stated GM's aim to double its annual revenue by 2030 through a focus on electric and autonomous vehicles, connected services, and new businesses. The reinstatement of dividends signals GM's financial stability and strategic shift towards its EV portfolio.

title: Time to Buy ARKQ While It’s Still Trading at a Discount
summary: The article suggests now is a good time to invest in the ARK Autonomous Technology & Robotics ETF (ARKQ) due to its growth potential and current discounted trading price. ARKQ provides exposure to companies involved in disruptive innovation, autonomous technology, and robotics, and is actively managed by ARK Invest. Despite its 75 basis points management fee, it is considered inexpensive for active management, targeting investors seeking long-term alpha by riding out short-term market fluctuations.

title: The Shyft Group debuts a portable EV charging solution
summary: The Shyft Group has introduced the Blue Arc Power Cube, a portable, remote-controlled EV charging station designed to address the lack of EV infrastructure. This unit provides 3MW of onboard power with Level 2 and Fast-DC charging capabilities, and it can be supplemented by wind and solar power, offering a flexible and grid-independent solution for commercial vehicle fleets. Its portability makes it an ideal solution for fleets that lease facilities or need to move charging stations.

title: 2 Long-Term EV Plays Trading Under $20
summary: The article highlights two long-term electric vehicle (EV) investment opportunities trading under $20: Ford Motor Company (NYSE: F) and ChargePoint Holdings, Inc. (NYSE: CHPT). Ford is praised for its aggressive push into EV production and carbon neutrality, with strong growth potential and a low P/E ratio compared to Tesla. ChargePoint is presented as a leading EV charging network operator, poised for growth through its expanding network and subscription-based model, despite not yet being profitable.

title: SCE’s Pre-Owned EV Rebate Has Nationwide Impact
summary: Southern California Edison's (SCE) Pre-Owned EV Rebate Program inspired the $4,000 used-EV federal tax credit included in the Inflation Reduction Act. This federal incentive, similar to SCE's program, aims to make clean energy more accessible nationwide. The article details the credit's specifics and how similar incentives for EV purchase are key to meeting clean energy goals.

title: Inflation Reduction Act Could Provide Major Boost for Renewable Energy and CleanTech Industries
summary: The Inflation Reduction Act (IRA), representing the U.S. government's largest investment in combating climate change, is expected to significantly boost the renewable energy and CleanTech industries. With nearly $370 billion directed towards climate change mitigation, energy security, and lowering energy costs, the bill aims to put the U.S. on an accelerated path toward achieving its 2030 net greenhouse gas emissions reduction goal. This legislation is anticipated to create substantial investment opportunities across various climate-related themes, including renewable energy, low-carbon hydrogen, and electric vehicles.

title: 3 Stock Winners and Losers of Biden’s Inflation Reduction Act
summary: The Inflation Reduction Act, passed by the House on Aug. 12, is expected to generate $739 billion in revenue with significant spending directed towards climate change initiatives and an extension of ACA tax credits. This article identifies the First Trust Nasdaq Clean Edge Green Energy Index Fund (QCLN) as a key winner due to enhanced clean energy tax credits, while the First Trust Dow 30 Equal Weight ETF (EDOW) and Invesco BuyBack Achievers ETF (PKW) are highlighted as potential losers due to new corporate minimum tax and a 1% excise tax on share repurchases, respectively.

title: Aurora delays autonomous truck launch following supplier constraints
summary: Aurora Innovation has delayed the commercial launch of its self-driving truck by a year, pushing its rollout to the first half of 2024, due to difficulties in securing tier 1 suppliers for truck hardware. The company, in partnership with Paccar, faced supply chain constraints that hindered scaling production of its purpose-built autonomous trucks. This delay mirrors similar challenges faced by competitors in the autonomous vehicle sector who are also contending with supply shortages for components.

title: VinFast SUVs: Reviews, Pricing, and Spec
summary: This article provides an overview of VinFast, a Vietnamese automaker that has expanded into the global market with electric SUVs. It details their plans for a U.S. factory in North Carolina and outlines specifications, estimated pricing, and reviews for their upcoming electric vehicle models, including the VF3, VF6, VF7, VF8, VF9, and VF Wild pickup truck. The article also includes a news section highlighting recent developments for the company.

title: Elon Musk sells $7 billion in Tesla shares ahead of Twitter court battle
summary: Elon Musk has sold nearly $7 billion worth of Tesla shares to prepare for the possibility of being forced to acquire Twitter or facing a significant settlement. This sale comes as Musk faces a court battle with Twitter over his attempted withdrawal from the $44 billion acquisition deal. Analysts suggest a Twitter deal is more likely, or at least a substantial settlement for Twitter from Musk.

title: With Tesla stock sale Musk cashes up for Twitter
summary: Elon Musk sold nearly $7 billion worth of Tesla shares to secure funds for his potential acquisition of Twitter, aiming to avoid an emergency stock sale if he is compelled to complete the deal. This move comes ahead of a legal battle with Twitter over the $44bn takeover, with Musk indicating he would buy back Tesla stock if the deal does not close. Legal experts suggest he might need to sell more shares if he loses the legal challenge and is forced to acquire Twitter or pay a hefty penalty.

title: Groupon lays off hundreds of employees
summary: Groupon, the Chicago-based e-commerce marketplace, has laid off more than 500 employees, approximately 15% of its workforce, across various departments. This decision comes as the company restructures to focus on "self-service merchant acquisition capabilities," reduce cloud infrastructure, and rationalize its real estate footprint, citing that its overall business performance is not meeting anticipated levels and its cost structure is not aligned with its performance. Groupon joins a growing list of companies including Fender, Robinhood, Apple, Google, Vox Media, 7-Eleven, Meta, JPMorgan Chase & Co., Coinbase, Netflix, and Tesla that have recently announced layoffs or slowing hiring efforts ahead of an anticipated economic downturn.

title: BlackRock launches S&P 500 equal weight and ESG ETFs
summary: BlackRock has introduced two new S&P 500 ETFs: the iShares S&P 500 ESG UCITS ETF (ESPX) and the iShares S&P 500 Equal Weight UCITS ETF (EWSP). These launches expand BlackRock's ETF range, offering exposures to ESG and equal-weight methodologies. The S&P 500 ESG index notably overweights information technology and includes a modest extra allocation to energy despite previously ejecting Tesla, while the S&P 500 Equal Weight index overweights cyclical sectors.

title: Tesla hires Hewlett Packard Enterprise lawyer for senior legal post
summary: Tesla has hired Derek Windham, formerly of Hewlett Packard Enterprise, as its new deputy general counsel for corporate and securities. This move comes as the electric carmaker continues to restructure its legal department amidst various high-profile legal disputes involving the company and its CEO Elon Musk. Windham's role will involve leading the company's global corporate, securities, and corporate governance work.

title: BRP’s famed two-wheeled motorcycles are back — with an electric twist
summary: BRP Inc. has announced its re-entry into the two-wheeled motorcycle market with the introduction of its first all-electric models, the Can-Am Origin and Can-Am Pulse, along with an electric surfboard, the Sea-Doo Rise. These new electric vehicles mark a significant step in the company's electrification strategy and will be available for purchase in mid-2024. BRP aims to become a leader in the electric powersport vehicle market, emphasizing the benefits of a silent, vibration-free, and environmentally friendly riding experience.

title: These Stocks are Buzzing Thanks to the US Senate Passing $430B Climate Bill
summary: The US Senate passed the $430 billion Inflation Reduction Act, allocating about $370 billion to climate and energy programs, causing clean energy stocks and related ETFs to rally. Electric vehicle companies like Tesla, Rivian, and Lucid Group saw gains, while pharmaceutical giants Pfizer, Sanofi, and Eli Lilly experienced slight declines due to Medicare drug price negotiation provisions. The bill's passage into law is expected to benefit the clean energy sector, despite earlier volatility influenced by Senator Manchin's stance.

title: Better Buy: iShares S&P Core 500 Small Cap ETF or Vanguard S&P 500 ETF?
summary: This article compares the iShares S&P Core 500 Small Cap ETF (IJR) and the Vanguard S&P 500 ETF (VOO), discussing their features, risks, and benefits for investors. While VOO offers stability with large-cap companies, IJR provides potential for higher upside with small-cap stocks, albeit with increased volatility. The choice between them depends on an investor's strategy, risk tolerance, and investment goals.

title: Tesla (TSLA) Shareholders Approve 3-For-1 Stock Split
summary: Tesla (TSLA) shareholders approved a 3-for-1 stock split at the company's annual meeting on August 4, 2022. This decision aims to increase the accessibility of its stock to retail investors and offer employees more flexibility in managing their equity. Additionally, a proposal to increase shareholders' ability to nominate board candidates also appears to have passed.

title: Rick Winick Honeywell’s VP of Automotive Refrigerants on EVs
summary: Rick Winick, Honeywell’s VP and General Manager of Automotive Refrigerants, discusses how Honeywell's HFO-1234yf refrigerant can help reduce "range anxiety" in electric vehicles (EVs) by improving thermal management and efficiency. He highlights the challenges facing the EV market, such as extending driving range and lowering MSRPs, and explains how energy-efficient refrigerants can address these issues. Winick notes that HFO-1234yf is a globally available, field-proven solution that can be used in both internal combustion engine and EV heat pump systems to optimize thermal control of the cabin and electronic components.

title: Do US Large Cap Equity Index Funds Put Your Clients at Risk?
authors: Dr. Sanjeev Bhojraj of Kailash Concepts Research
summary: This article argues that large-cap equity index funds currently pose a significant risk to investors due to an unusually high concentration of overvalued stocks, reminiscent of the dot-com bubble in 1999. The authors, from Kailash Concepts Research, highlight a shift in valuation structures within these funds, with a much larger portion of investments now in stocks with price-to-sales ratios above 10x. They suggest that this trend is driven by market cap-weighted indexing and continuous inflows, creating a self-perpetuating cycle that could lead to substantial losses if flows reverse.

title: Musk’s antics turn Tesla owners, new buyers against it
authors: Ira Boudway and Kyle Stock and Bloomberg
summary: Elon Musk’s controversial behavior and public statements are increasingly alienating both current Tesla owners and potential new buyers, despite the company’s previous growth through controversies. While customers generally love their Tesla vehicles, many are becoming put off by Musk's antics, leading some to consider alternative electric vehicle brands despite Tesla's initial market dominance. This shift indicates that as more capable EV options emerge, Tesla may lose its competitive edge among consumers who prioritize a CEO's conduct.

title: Shenzhen accelerates China's driverless car dreams
summary: Shenzhen has introduced China's clearest regulations for autonomous vehicles, allowing registered AVs to operate without a driver in the driving seat across a broad area, but a human driver must still be present in the vehicle. This regulatory framework is critical for the mass deployment of robotaxis and addresses liability in case of accidents. While the U.S. has led in AV trials, China, particularly Shenzhen, is rapidly accelerating its own autonomous driving efforts with significant industry investments and ambitious revenue targets.

title: Risk Parity Explained (2023): Complete Investor's Guide ✅
summary: This guide explains risk parity as an investment strategy that equalizes risk levels across all portfolio components, utilizing tools like leverage and short selling. It details how risk parity differs from modern portfolio theory by focusing on risk allocation rather than capital allocation, aiming for lower volatility and improved returns. The article also covers the practical aspects of building and managing a risk parity portfolio, including its pros and cons, and its performance in various market conditions.

title: Cybersecurity in spotlight with participant's suit against Colgate-Palmolive
summary: A lawsuit filed against Colgate-Palmolive has brought cybersecurity for defined contribution plans into the spotlight. The article highlights this development along with other financial news, including delays in SEC work on private credit for retirement plans and a CIO's strategy for portfolio overhaul.

title: Aspen Aerogels posts $24M loss in Q2
summary: Aspen Aerogels Inc. reported a significant loss of $24.1 million in the second quarter of 2022, a substantial increase from the $6.7 million loss in the same period last year. Despite the financial loss, the company saw a rise in revenue, reaching $45.6 million. CEO Donald R. Young highlighted increasing market adoption of their thermal and EV safety solutions and ongoing investments in manufacturing facilities and teams to support future growth and profitability goals.

title: Auto Advertising: What’s Ahead for Marketers
summary: The article explores the evolving landscape of auto advertising, highlighting the shift in car-buying habits towards digital-first experiences and the increasing importance of online research. It emphasizes the role of native advertising on the open web as a critical strategy for auto brands to reach consumers, focusing on data-driven insights and case studies showing successful campaigns by Volvo, Peugeot, and Honda.

title: Has the Crypto Winter Come and Gone?
summary: The crypto market is showing signs of recovery after a significant downturn, with positive price action in Bitcoin and Ethereum. Edward Moya suggests a "positive risk-on mood" is benefiting cryptos, aligning with easing expectations for Fed tightening. However, some analysts caution that despite recent gains, the market is still in a "full-blown bear market."

title: GM hit by supply chain issues, remains optimistic for vehicle demand, pricing
summary: General Motors' second-quarter net income dropped 40% due to supply chain issues, particularly semiconductor chip shortages, leaving over 90,000 vehicles unfinished. Despite this, the company maintained its full-year forecast and expressed optimism about strong vehicle demand and pricing. GM is also advancing its electric vehicle plans, aiming for significant EV production capacity by 2025 and securing key raw material agreements.

title: GM and Livent enter long-term lithium hydroxide supply agreement
summary: General Motors (GM) and Livent have announced a multi-year sourcing agreement for battery-grade lithium hydroxide, crucial for GM's Ultium battery cathodes. This partnership aims to secure a sustainable supply chain for GM's electric vehicles, with a goal to transition 100% of Livent's downstream lithium hydroxide processing for GM to North America over the six-year agreement. The agreement supports GM's objective of 1 million units of EV capacity in North America by the end of 2025.

title: GM trails far behind Tesla in EV sales — CEO Mary Barra bet the company that will change
summary: GM CEO Mary Barra is betting the company's future on electric vehicles, despite currently trailing far behind Tesla in sales. GM plans to invest $30 billion in EVs by 2025, launch 30 electric models globally, and believes its Ultium platform will enable it to surpass Tesla by mid-decade or 2029. Barra's legacy is tied to transforming GM into an electric leader, building on past efforts to make the company leaner and more agile.

title: Tesla Is Set for Settlement Talks Over Musk Tweets About Taking Company Private
summary: Tesla Inc. is scheduled for court-ordered settlement talks in a shareholder lawsuit concerning CEO Elon Musk's 2018 tweets about taking the company private. This adds to a busy October for Musk, who also faces a trial related to his Twitter acquisition and a trial over his Tesla compensation package. Tesla investors are seeking billions in damages from the disruption caused by the 2018 tweets.

title: Why This PayPal Investor Avoids PayPal Leveraged ETFs
summary: The author, a long-term PayPal shareholder, explains why he avoids newly launched leveraged single-stock ETFs focusing on PayPal. He argues that despite their potential for amplified gains, the daily resets inherent in leveraged ETFs mean they often underperform the underlying stock over time, especially during volatile periods or extended downturns. The article advises investors seeking returns in PayPal to buy the actual stock instead of these short-term, high-risk leveraged products.

title: TSLQ Stock Price | AXS TSLA Bear Daily ETF
summary: This article provides detailed information about the AXS TSLA Bear Daily ETF (TSLQ), including its current stock price, trading exchange, and key financial statistics. It also offers insights into its performance, holdings, and a company profile, advising potential investors to conduct thorough analysis before purchasing.

title: Elon Musk Promotes Lithium: Here are Four Lithium Stocks to Watch
summary: Elon Musk has encouraged entrepreneurs to enter the lithium refining business, highlighting the massive demand and high margins. This article identifies four lithium stocks—Ioneer Limited, Lithium Americas, Sociedad Quimica, and Piedmont Lithium—that are poised to benefit from the surging demand for this critical element. These companies are involved in various stages of lithium production and have significant projects underway to meet future battery needs.

title: What Does GameStop’s Stock Split Mean for Investors?
summary: GameStop (GME) is undergoing a 4-for-1 stock split, its first in 15 years, which will increase the number of shares and decrease the price per share without affecting market capitalization. Morningstar gives GME a 3-star quantitative rating, indicating it is fairly valued, but with extreme uncertainty due to high volatility. This split follows similar actions by other tech and consumer companies like Amazon, Shopify, and Alphabet.

title: If You Are Shorting Tesla via the AXS TSLA Bear Daily ETF (TSLQ), You Are in for Chronic Underperformance and Years of Toil
summary: AXS Investments has launched single-stock ETFs, including the AXS TSLA Bear Daily ETF (TSLQ), which allows investors to short Tesla. However, the article highlights that these ETFs are a "mind-numbingly dumb" and "very risky" investment due to exorbitant expense ratios (1.15%), daily resets leading to chronic underperformance, and a lack of diversification. The author warns that shorting Tesla via TSLQ is likely to result in chronic underperformance and significant losses over time despite its intended purpose.

title: Want to Short TSLA Stock? Check Out the New TSLQ ETF.
summary: The AXS TSLA Bear Daily ETF (TSLQ) has launched, offering investors 1x inverse exposure to Tesla (TSLA) stock. This new leveraged single-stock ETF, which carries a 1.15% expense ratio, is designed for experienced investors seeking to bet against TSLA, which has declined over 40% year-to-date. Both the SEC and Federal Reserve Chair Gary Gensler have warned of the significant risks associated with single-stock ETFs.

title: General Motors And Pilot Announce Coast-To-Coast EV Fast Charging Network
summary: General Motors is partnering with Pilot Company to establish a coast-to-coast EV rapid charging network across 500 Pilot Flying J locations. This initiative will include 2,000 charging stalls capable of supplying up to 350 kW, along with amenities, to ease range anxiety and support the adoption of electric vehicles. The project combines private investments with potential government grants to create accessible long-distance EV travel.

title: Electric Vehicle Charging Companies: 5 Questions to Ask
summary: This article identifies five key questions investors should consider when evaluating electric vehicle (EV) charging companies, given the early stage of the industry's development. It examines the evolving competitive landscape, the dichotomy between AC and DC charging, the impact of public policy, cost reduction strategies, and the competitive "fleet game." The piece also provides specific analyses of ChargePoint and EVgo, highlighting their market positions, growth prospects, and competitive challenges.

title: What Does Google’s Stock Split Mean for Investors?
summary: Google's parent company, Alphabet, is undergoing a 20-for-1 stock split, which will adjust Morningstar's fair value estimate per share to $180, though its competitive advantage and 4-star "undervalued" rating remain unchanged. Analyst Ali Mogharabi identifies YouTube monetization, Maps monetization, and the cloud business as key growth drivers, with strong confidence in Google's continued dominance in the online search market. The article also notes other companies like Amazon, Shopify, and Tesla undertaking similar stock splits.

title: SEC Warns Investors About Single-Stock ETFs
summary: The SEC has voiced warnings about single-stock ETFs, despite approving the launch of over a dozen leveraged and inverse funds tied to individual equities. SEC officials highlighted the risks associated with these complex products, noting that while they might appeal to aggressive traders, they are prone to significant long-term losses due to their structure and underlying assets. Commissioner Caroline Crenshaw expressed disappointment that the regulatory framework has not been updated to better address the risks of such products, urging the SEC to use its existing tools to evaluate their appropriateness for investors.

title: Asset managers affirm they'll pay for travel
summary: Following the Supreme Court's abortion ruling, BlackRock and other asset managers have stated they will cover travel expenses for employees seeking abortion services. This decision places firms in a delicate position, balancing employee demands with potential client backlash, as articulated by Marcia S. Wagner of The Wagner Law Group. The article also touches upon other market news, including SEC work on private credit, endowment performance, and pension fund decisions.

title: How Much Worse Can It Get for Growth Stocks?
summary: The second quarter of 2022 saw growth stocks suffer their largest losses since the 2008 financial crisis, with the Morningstar US Growth Index dropping 25.3%. Value stocks significantly outperformed growth, marking the widest margin since the dot-com bubble collapse, as rising interest rates and inflation dampened the appeal of growth companies' future earnings. While many growth stocks are now at their cheapest valuations in years, experts suggest value stocks may continue to outperform in the short term despite growth's long-term lead.

title: Trading At A Mere 4x Earnings, Is VALE Stock A Buy?
summary: This article analyzes whether VALE (NYSE: VALE), a major iron ore and nickel producer, is a buy given its current valuation of under 4x consensus 2022 earnings. Despite recent sequential declines in revenue and earnings due to intense rains and falling commodity prices, potential improvements in the Chinese economy and VALE's strategic focus on the EV market with deals like supplying Tesla, suggest an upside to its stock, which is valued at $25 per share. The company also appears to be in a stronger financial position having significantly reduced its net debt.

title: BP, Shell to cover employee travel for treatment after Roe v. Wade
summary: BP PLC has joined Shell PLC in committing to cover employee travel expenses for healthcare treatment following the Supreme Court's overturning of Roe v. Wade. Both European oil producers updated their healthcare plans to extend benefits for women needing to travel for services, though neither explicitly named abortion. This move comes as other major companies like Amazon, JPMorgan Chase, Tesla, and Walt Disney also updated their policies to cover travel costs for out-of-state abortion services, while U.S. oil majors have largely remained silent.

title: Wheels Up adds partnership with Hertz
summary: Wheels Up Experience has forged a new strategic partnership with Hertz, offering its members access to Hertz’s electric vehicle fleet, including Tesla and Polestar models, available at private jet airport locations. Members will also receive complimentary President’s Circle top-tier status in the Hertz Gold Plus Rewards program, along with discounts and dedicated ground transportation assistance. This collaboration aims to provide a seamless door-to-door travel experience and expand Wheels Up's product offerings.

title: Kroger increases EV charging offer across US stores
summary: Kroger is expanding EV charging options across its US stores, partnering with Blink, Electrify America, EVgo, Tesla, and Volta. The grocery retailer plans to add hundreds more charging stations in various markets, building on the over 350 chargers already installed in ten states. While the company did not specify AC or DC breakdown, charging times are expected to vary, with many sessions averaging around 30 minutes.

title: JPMorgan Chase Joins Companies Paying Employees Who Travel for Abortions
summary: JPMorgan Chase announced it would cover travel expenses for employees needing to travel out of state for abortions, expanding a benefit that covers services unavailable near an employee's home. This decision follows the Supreme Court's overturning of Roe v. Wade and aligns JPMorgan with other companies like Citigroup, Starbucks, Amazon, Tesla, and Yelp making similar pledges. The move addresses the implications of state-level abortion bans, with many states poised to restrict or ban abortions following the ruling.

title: Tesla’s Texas, Berlin factories ‘losing billions of dollars’
summary: Elon Musk has stated that Tesla's new factories in Texas and Berlin are "losing billions of dollars" due to struggles in ramping up production. This challenge is attributed to a shortage of batteries and port issues in China, along with supply chain interruptions exacerbated by COVID-19 shutdowns in Shanghai. Musk highlighted the company's overwhelming concern as keeping factories operational to avoid bankruptcy.

title: Billionaire Larry Ellison, among world’s richest people, bought Florida estate for $173 million
summary: Billionaire Larry Ellison, co-founder of Oracle, has purchased a sprawling 22-acre estate in Manalapan, Florida for $173 million, marking the largest residential sale ever in the state. The property includes a portion of Bird Island and was bought from fellow software billionaire Jim Clark. The article also details Ellison's net worth, his role at Oracle, his ties to Tesla, his charitable contributions, and a controversial call he reportedly participated in regarding the 2020 presidential election.

title: Elon Musk Says New Tesla Plants Are Losing Billions
summary: Elon Musk has revealed that Tesla's new Gigafactories in Germany and Texas are currently incurring "billions of dollars" in losses as the company struggles to ramp up production. Supply chain disruptions, including COVID-19 lockdowns in China, have significantly hampered manufacturing efforts, particularly for Model Y SUVs with new battery technology. Musk emphasized the significant effort required to bring these factories to high-volume production.

title: SIGMA LITHIUM SUBSTANTIALLY INCREASES TOTAL NI 43-101 MINERAL RESOURCE BY ~50% TO 86 MILLION TONNES, ADDING 27 MILLION TONNES OF HIGH-GRADE 1.49% LITHIUM OXIDE IN PHASE 3
summary: Sigma Lithium announced a 50% increase in its total NI 43-101 mineral resource to 85.7 million tonnes, primarily due to the addition of 26.8 million tonnes of high-grade 1.49% lithium oxide from its Phase 3 NDC deposit. This significantly strengthens the company's Grota do Cirilo Project as a major source of Battery Grade Sustainable Lithium, with Phase 1 construction remaining on schedule for commissioning by December 2022. The increased resource aims to further boost the potential production profile for global electric vehicle markets.

title: Tesla Model Y nabs title of most American-made 2022 model
summary: Tesla's Model Y and Model 3 secured the top two spots on Cars.com's 2022 American-Made Index, with all four Tesla models landing in the top 10. The company's regional manufacturing approach and 100% domestic production for U.S. sales were key factors. General Motors, Honda, Toyota, and Ford also had significant representation in the overall index, and increasing consumer interest in American-made vehicles is noted, especially concerning EVs.

title: BITI Chart | ProShares Short Bitcoin Strategy ETF
summary: This page provides a live, interactive chart for the ProShares Short Bitcoin Strategy ETF (BITI), allowing users to analyze its performance. The chart offers various customization options and technical indicators to help investors understand price movements. It also includes current market data for BITI, such as its price, daily range, and 52-week range.

title: Elon Musk and Tesla sued over Dogecoin ‘pyramid scheme’
