title: Tesla Erases $199 Billion in Worst Two-Day Rout in 14 Months
summary: Tesla Inc. experienced its worst two-day selloff in 14 months, shedding approximately $199 billion in market value. This decline followed Elon Musk's Twitter poll about selling 10% of his stake and news that his brother, Kimbal Musk, sold shares prior to the poll. Additionally, a report emerged about Michael Burry suggesting Musk might need to sell stocks to cover personal debts.

title: PepsiCo to take delivery of Tesla electric trucks in fourth quarter - CNBC
summary: PepsiCo is set to receive its first Tesla electric semi-trucks in the fourth quarter of 2021, as confirmed by CEO Ramon Laguarta. The company aims to reduce fuel costs and fleet emissions, with transportation accounting for 10% of its gas emissions. Several other major companies like Walmart, J.B. Hunt, and Sysco have also placed orders for Tesla's semi-trucks.

title: PepsiCo CEO says he expects delivery of first Tesla Semis this quarter
summary: PepsiCo CEO Ramon Laguarta announced that the company expects its first delivery of Tesla Semi trucks in the fourth quarter of 2021. This comes almost four years after PepsiCo initially placed a pre-order for 100 Tesla Semi trucks, a delivery that had been delayed due to production challenges and battery cell limitations. Laguarta stated that transportation accounts for about 10% of PepsiCo's overall gas emissions and that they are actively working on solutions, including the adoption of electric trucks.

title: Plans To Dig the Biggest Lithium Mine in the US Face Mounting Opposition
summary: Plans for Lithium Americas' Thacker Pass mine in Nevada, poised to be the largest lithium mine in the US, are encountering strong opposition from tribal groups, ranchers, and environmental activists. Opponents argue that the environmental damage and social impact, including potential water pollution and loss of sacred land, outweigh the benefits of lithium for the clean energy transition. The conflict highlights the growing tension between the demand for critical minerals for green technologies and local environmental and social concerns.

title: Musk asks Twitter followers whether he should sell 10% of Tesla stock
authors: Ann Maria Shibu and Hyunjoo Jin
summary: Elon Musk polled his Twitter followers on whether he should sell 10% of his Tesla stock, citing potential "massive" tax bills related to stock options and criticism of unrealized gains as tax avoidance. He stated he would abide by the poll's results, which showed 55% approval for selling the shares. Selling 10% of his shares would amount to approximately $21 billion based on Friday's closing price.

title: Tesla adding cloud sync feature to driver profiles
summary: Tesla is implementing a new "Cloud Profiles" feature that will allow driver profiles to be synchronized to the cloud, enabling users to maintain their preferred settings across different Tesla vehicles. This development comes amidst news about Hertz's large order of Tesla vehicles and a dip in Tesla's stock after Elon Musk stated no contract had been signed yet.

title: Dow and S&P 500 close at records to start November, small caps post best day since August
summary: The Dow Jones Industrial Average, S&P 500, and Nasdaq Composite all reached new closing records on the first trading day of November, with the small-cap Russell 2000 having its best day since August. This follows a strong October, where all three major averages closed at record highs, overcoming a historically tough September. Investors are now looking ahead to corporate earnings, a Federal Reserve meeting, and October's jobs report.

title: Tesla's 'Sentry Mode' now offers live view of car to owner
summary: Tesla has released a new software update for its Sentry Mode, allowing owners to remotely view their car's surroundings via a live camera feed on iOS devices. This feature, called Sentry Mode Live Camera Access, requires an active Premium Connectivity subscription for full functionality. The company emphasizes that the live camera feed is end-to-end encrypted and inaccessible by Tesla.

title: Industry Voice: Sustainable investing - the defining decades
summary: This article by Janus Henderson Investors reflects on the evolution of sustainable investing over the past three decades, beginning with the Brundtland Report's definition of sustainability. It highlights scientific advancements, particularly in life expectancy and the environmental impact of human activity, alongside technological innovations like cloud computing and advancements in clean energy and battery technology. The piece emphasizes the critical need to transition from a linear economic model to a circular one driven by renewable, electric, and digital forces to ensure the planet's sustainability for future generations.

title: Ford, GM juggle high prices, supply chain pressure in Tesla's shadow
summary: Ford and General Motors are navigating strong consumer demand for trucks and SUVs amidst persistent supply chain issues and rising commodity costs. Both companies reported higher prices offsetting increased raw material expenses, with Ford raising its full-year earnings forecast despite a net income drop. They also outlined strategies to compete with Tesla in the EV market while aiming for tighter inventory controls.

title: Uber partners with Hertz to offer 50,000 Tesla rentals to U.S. ride-hail drivers
summary: Uber has partnered with Hertz to offer 50,000 Tesla vehicles as rental options for its ride-hail drivers by 2023. This initiative, starting November 1 in select U.S. cities, aims to expand the use of electric vehicles on Uber's platform, supporting its goal of operating an all-electric fleet in some regions by 2030. The rentals for Uber drivers will begin at $334 a week, including insurance and maintenance, dropping to $299 or lower as the program expands.

title: Judge narrows Tesla shareholders' lawsuit against Musk over SolarCity deal
summary: A Delaware judge has narrowed a shareholder lawsuit against Tesla CEO Elon Musk regarding the company's $2.6 billion acquisition of SolarCity Corp. While class action status was decertified and direct claims against Musk dismissed, shareholders can still sue him as a Tesla director. This decision follows a Delaware Supreme Court ruling on derivative claims, but lawyers for the shareholders state it doesn't affect the core case or potential damages.

title: Semiconductor shortage has Philip Morris shifting sales strategy for its heated-tobacco devices
summary: Philip Morris International is re-prioritizing its sales strategy for heated tobacco products, focusing on existing users due to device component constraints caused by the global semiconductor shortage. This shift is limiting product availability and forcing missed sales in certain markets, as demand for its IQOS device continues to grow but supply cannot keep up. The company aims for smoke-free products to comprise the majority of its sales by 2025, but achieving this goal will require an increase in semiconductor chip supply for device manufacturing.

title: Tesla bull Cathie Wood left nearly $130 million on the table by selling early
summary: Cathie Wood's ARK Invest sold a significant chunk of Tesla shares just before the company's market capitalization topped $1 trillion, costing her funds an estimated $130 million in potential gains. Despite the missed profit, Wood has seen substantial gains from her Tesla holdings and typically sells shares to maintain a balanced portfolio. She explained that selling prevents any single stock from dominating the fund, even while maintaining a high price target for Tesla.

title: Electrified: Tesla is now a trillion dollar company
summary: Tesla's market valuation surpassed $1 trillion for the first time after Hertz announced a massive order for 100,000 electric vehicles. This landmark deal, valued at approximately $4.2 billion, signifies Hertz's ambitious plan to electrify its rental fleet and highlights Tesla's leadership in EV production. The move also makes Tesla one of only five publicly traded US companies to reach this valuation.

title: Hertz strikes major deal with Tesla that includes Tom Brady ads
summary: Hertz has secured a major deal with Tesla, which will be promoted through advertisements featuring Tom Brady. This collaboration brings together the rental car giant and the electric vehicle manufacturer, leveraging a prominent sports figure for marketing.

title: Tesla hikes price of Model X, Model S variants by $5,000
summary: Tesla Inc. has increased the prices of its Model X Long Range and Model S Long Range variants by $5,000, now selling for $104,990 and $94,990 respectively. Prices for the Model Y Long Range and Model 3 Standard Range Plus also rose by $2,000. This comes as Tesla reported record revenue of $13.76 billion from July through September, despite falling short of Wall Street expectations.

title: Tesla Model Y Car Leasing Deals
summary: Leasing.com offers Tesla Model Y car leasing deals, positioning it as a raised SUV alternative to the Model 3 with improved practicality and a minimalistic cabin dominated by a touchscreen. The article highlights its performance, all-wheel-drive capabilities, and provides a starting price for leasing the Model Y Hatchback. It also includes recent news and reviews related to the Tesla Model Y.

title: SpaceX could make Elon Musk world’s first trillionaire, says Morgan Stanley
summary: Morgan Stanley analysts predict that Elon Musk's space exploration company, SpaceX, could elevate him to the status of the world's first trillionaire. While much of his current wealth comes from Tesla, analysts believe SpaceX's advancements in rockets and space infrastructure, including its Starship reusable rockets, position it for significant growth and potentially make it the most highly valued company globally. SpaceX is currently valued at an estimated $200 billion and is expected to rise further as it expands into various industries.

title: Global X Has Turned Its Thematic And Alternative-Income Funds Into Some Of The Best ETFs
summary: Global X, an ETF provider founded in 2008, has become a powerhouse in thematic and alternative-income ETFs, managing $27 billion in assets across nearly 80 unique funds. The firm's research vision, spearheaded by Jay Jacobs since 2013, focuses on empowering investors with targeted solutions and thorough market insights. The article highlights successful funds like Global X Lithium and Battery Tech (LIT) and Global X Telemedicine and Digital Health (EDOC), and discusses Global X's outlook on secular shifts, new fund launches, and the potential for a blockchain ETF.

title: Check out Cipher Mining Equity Warrant Exp 26th Aug 2026's stock price (CIFRW) in real time
summary: This article provides real-time stock information for Cipher Mining Equity Warrant Exp 26th Aug 2026 (CIFRW), including its current price, historical performance metrics, key financial stats, and recent news. It highlights the company's profile as an industrial-scale data center construction and operations firm focused on bitcoin mining and high-performance computing, along with insights from analyst calls.

title: Chinese Robotaxi WeRide Safety Driver Apparently Falls Asleep At The Wheel; How Can That Still Happen?
summary: A safety driver for Chinese robotaxi company WeRide was reportedly filmed sleeping at the wheel for at least 45 seconds while testing a self-driving car in San Jose. This incident raises critical questions about driver monitoring procedures, especially following a fatal accident involving an Uber ATG safety driver who was distracted. The article discusses how companies are, or should be, implementing systems to prevent safety driver errors and ensure public safety during autonomous vehicle testing.

title: ACES Could Fly Thanks to These Holdings
summary: Despite a recent sag in renewable energy stocks, analysts present a compelling forecast for the sector, particularly for ETFs like the ALPS Clean Energy ETF (ACES). Morgan Stanley projects over $1.2 trillion in US energy transition spending by 2030, reinforcing the long-term investment viability of clean energy. ACES, with its diversified exposure across nine industry groups and significant holdings in companies like Tesla and Sunrun, is well-positioned to capitalize on this expansive investment opportunity.

title: Tesla Will Move Its Headquarters to Austin, Texas, in Blow to California (Published 2021)
summary: Tesla announced its decision to move its headquarters from California to Austin, Texas, where it is currently building a new factory. This move fulfills a previous threat made by CEO Elon Musk, who expressed frustration with California's coronavirus lockdown orders and cited limitations on scaling in the Bay Area due to high housing prices. Despite the relocation of its headquarters, Tesla plans to maintain and expand production at its Fremont, California factory.

title: Elon Musk announces Tesla is moving its headquarters to Austin
summary: Elon Musk announced that Tesla is moving its headquarters from Fremont, California to Austin, Texas. While expanding operations significantly in Texas, Musk stated that Tesla would also continue to grow its production in California, increasing output from its Fremont and Gigafactory Nevada by 50%. The move to Austin is attributed to the limitations of scaling in the Bay Area and the desire to create an "ecological paradise" near the Colorado River.

title: Robinhood Enters the Realm of Proxy Voting
summary: Robinhood's acquisition of Say Technologies aims to simplify proxy voting and increase shareholder engagement, particularly among individual investors. This move, alongside efforts by companies like JPMorgan and startups YourStake and OpenInvest, is part of a broader trend to make proxy voting and ESG investing more accessible and impactful. The article highlights how technology is breaking down barriers to participation, addressing the complexities of the voting process, meeting investors on familiar platforms, and helping them understand the impact of their choices.

title: GE Renewable Energy signs MoU with General Motors to develop supply chain of rare earth and other materials to support EV and renewable energy growth | GE News
summary: GE Renewable Energy and General Motors announced an MoU to evaluate opportunities for improving the supply chain of rare earth materials, magnets, copper, and electrical steel for electric vehicles and renewable energy equipment. The collaboration will initially focus on establishing a North American and European vertically integrated magnet manufacturing supply chain. Both companies aim to secure a low-carbon footprint, ESG-friendly, and cost-competitive supply of these critical materials.

title: GM aims to build Netflix-sized subscription business by 2030
summary: General Motors announced its ambitious goal to generate $25 billion in annual revenue from in-car subscription services by 2030, putting it in the same league as Netflix. The automaker expects nearly $2 billion in revenue from these services this year, driven by its current base of 4.2 million subscribed vehicles and the upcoming Ultifi software platform. GM plans to monetize features like OnStar, Maps+, and fleet management solutions, projecting a serviceable addressable market of $80 billion by 2030.

title: General Motors secures supply for silicon carbide chips for its next-gen EVs
summary: General Motors (GM) has announced a deal with Wolfspeed Inc. to secure silicon carbide (SiC) chip supply for its future electric vehicles, to be used in GM's new Ultium Drive units. SiC chips offer improved energy efficiency and heat dissipation compared to traditional silicon, and other EVs like Tesla's Model 3 and NIO also use them. This agreement helps GM manage chip supply amid semiconductor shortages, a crucial step given the higher chip requirements for EVs.

title: Investors argue Musk should repay $9.4 bln to Tesla for SolarCity deal
summary: Tesla investors are arguing that Elon Musk should repay $9.4 billion to Tesla for benefits received from the 2016 SolarCity deal, proposing he return Tesla shares acquired through the transaction. They allege Musk did not recuse himself from negotiations and failed to disclose SolarCity's dire financial state. Musk, conversely, asserts the deal created a vertically integrated clean energy company at a fair price and was approved by shareholders.

title: Jabil expects to hit over $8B in net revenue in Q1 of 2022
summary: Jabil Inc. (NYSE: JBL) reported strong financial results for the fourth quarter and fiscal year, with net revenue of $7.4 billion and $29.3 billion respectively, despite supply chain challenges. Looking ahead to Q1 2022, the company projects net revenue between $8 billion and $8.6 billion, driven by its diversified business model and opportunities in vehicle electrification, connected healthcare, and infrastructure development. Jabil continues to work with major clients such as Amazon, Tesla, Apple, and Johnson & Johnson.

title: Lucid to start deliveries of electric cars with range exceeding Tesla's in October
summary: Lucid Group Inc. announced it will begin delivering its luxury electric sedans in late October, featuring a driving range that surpasses Tesla's. The company has started production of its Lucid Air cars and aims to significantly ramp up capacity, challenging Tesla in the premium EV market. Lucid's CEO highlighted the battery technology advantage and the need to reduce costs for wider EV adoption.

title: Preparing for the next big thing
summary: LKQ Corp. has proactively acquired Green Bean Battery to prepare for the growing electric vehicle (EV) market by gaining expertise in EV battery refurbishment and repurposing. This strategic move aims to establish LKQ's foothold in the EV sector well in advance of a significant shift from internal combustion engine (ICE) vehicles. The article highlights how the automotive recycling industry is adapting to the unique challenges and opportunities presented by EVs, including differences in materials and the emergence of new markets for high-voltage batteries.

title: Ford making its biggest single manufacturing investment ever to build electric vehicle factories
summary: Ford Motor Co. and SK Innovations are investing $11.4 billion to build two new electric vehicle manufacturing campuses in Kentucky and Tennessee, creating over 10,000 jobs. This represents Ford's largest-ever single manufacturing investment, aiming for 40% of its global sales to be fully electric vehicles by 2030. The facilities will include three battery plants and a factory for electric pickup trucks, with a focus on carbon neutrality and waste reduction.

title: Agnico Eagle, Kirkland Lake create new gold giant in $10bn merger
summary: Canadian gold miners Agnico Eagle Mines and Kirkland Lake Gold announced a C$13.5 billion ($10.7bn) merger, creating a new gold giant with a market capitalization of about $24 billion and a mineral reserve base of 48 million ounces of gold. The deal is expected to generate $2 billion in synergies over the next 10 years and positions the combined entity to produce 3.4 million ounces of gold this year. This merger could trigger further consolidation in the gold industry, with analysts anticipating a new wave of M&A activity focused on jurisdictional synergies and growth generation.

title: Ford Will Build 4 Factories in a Big Electric Vehicle Push (Published 2021)
summary: Ford Motor announced a massive $11.4 billion investment to build three battery factories and an electric truck plant in the U.S., creating 11,000 jobs. This move signifies the company's significant commitment to electric vehicles, aiming to produce over one million EVs annually and contribute to global climate change efforts. The investment is Ford's largest in its 118-year history, reflecting a broader industry pivot towards electrification due to environmental concerns and competition from Tesla.

title: Cars.com’s 2021 Car Seat Fit Report Card
summary: Cars.com's 2021 Car Seat Fit Report Card compiles a year's worth of Car Seat Checks across 51 vehicles, evaluating how well different cars accommodate various child safety seats. The report identifies vehicles that received top "A" grades across all categories, making them ideal for families with car seats. It also provides a detailed breakdown of car seat installation performance by vehicle type, including two-row SUVs, three-row SUVs, minivans, pickup trucks, EVs/PHEVs/Hybrids, sedans, and hatchbacks.

title: Samsung to make Tesla’s HW 4.0 self-driving auto chip
summary: Samsung Electronics Co. has won the contract to manufacture Tesla Inc.'s next-generation hardware 4 (HW 4.0) chip for its autonomous driving technology, beating out TSMC. Samsung plans to mass-produce the HW 4.0 chip using 7-nanometer processing technology, ensuring higher production yields and stable functions for Tesla's upcoming vehicles like the Cybertruck. This partnership strengthens Samsung's position in the global foundry market as it competes with TSMC and expands its collaborations with other tech giants like Google and Amazon.

title: GM's new business model turns carmaker into software company: 'A potential game-changer'
summary: General Motors is transitioning into a software company that also makes cars, viewing its vehicles as platforms to deliver subscription services for recurring revenue. This new business model is attracting technology talent and is expected to expand beyond traditional automotive services into areas like insurance and even powering other modes of transport such as planes and trains. GM aims to leverage its scale while fostering an agile, startup-like approach to software development.

title: Alphabet, Tesla and Amazon are among the most favourite stocks held by US-focused mutual funds. Here are top 10 stocks
summary: This article identifies Alphabet, Tesla, and Amazon as top stock holdings among U.S.-focused mutual funds available to Indian investors. It details 10 such mutual funds, highlighting their investment strategies, underlying assets, and historical performance. The funds provide Indian investors exposure to leading US companies and geographical diversification.

title: GM temporarily shuts down North American factories because of chip shortage
summary: General Motors announced temporary production halts at six North American factories due to the ongoing global chip shortage, affecting its most profitable vehicles like pickup trucks and SUVs. This is the second time GM has faced such shutdowns, with the company estimating a $1.5 billion to $2 billion loss in earnings due to lost production this year. Other major automakers, including Volkswagen, Ford, and Toyota, are also struggling with the semiconductor supply issue.

title: 7 Robotics Stocks to Buy for Elon Musk’s Big ‘Tesla Bot’ Bet
summary: This article highlights seven robotics stocks that are poised for lucrative returns, driven by the increasing demand for robotics across various industries and tech giants like Tesla and Amazon. It discusses the market growth projections for industrial robotics and provides detailed analysis, financial data, and future outlook for each recommended stock, including ABB, AeroVironment, Global X Robotics & Artificial Intelligence ETF, Intuitive Surgical, iRobot, Oceaneering International, and Raytheon Technologies. The author emphasizes that these companies leverage automation and AI to enhance efficiency and address evolving market needs.

title: Big Tesla Exposure Could Give This ETF a Boost
summary: The First Trust NASDAQ Clean Edge Green Energy Index Fund (QCLN) holds a significant 8.45% allocation to Tesla, making it one of the largest ETF owners of Tesla stock. This exposure positions QCLN to potentially benefit from the rapid growth of electric vehicles and Tesla's broader clean energy initiatives. As the automotive industry transitions to battery electric vehicles, Tesla's market share and profitability, along with its ancillary businesses like energy generation and storage, could drive value for the ETF.

title: Self-Driving Cars Still Require Human Operators
authors: VOA - Voice of America English News
summary: Despite billions in investment, self-driving cars largely still require human oversight, either as in-vehicle safety operators, through remote supervision, or by close driver monitoring. Companies like Pony.ai and Cruise are gradually reducing direct human presence but acknowledge the ongoing need for human intervention to ensure safety and build public trust. Technical and legal difficulties, along with recent safety investigations, highlight the complexities of fully autonomous vehicle development.
source: VOA - Voice of America English News
source_domain: VOA - Voice of America English News

title: Review | Tesla’s wild ride, steered by Elon Musk
summary: This article is a review of the book "Power Play: Tesla, Elon Musk, and the Bet of the Century" by Tim Higgins. It highlights that Elon Musk is both crucial to Tesla's success and a potential liability. The review touches on Tesla's early days, including efforts to recruit employees and its initial stock price.

title: Musk says Tesla's self-driving software update 'not great'
summary: Elon Musk stated that Tesla's Full Self-Driving Beta version 9.2 is "actually not great" but that the Autopilot/AI team is working to improve it rapidly. The company is aiming for a single software stack for both highway and city streets, which requires extensive neural network retraining. This comes as Tesla faces scrutiny from U.S. safety regulators and calls for investigation into its marketing of self-driving features.

title: Endeavor Adds Post House Capital CEO Jacqueline Reses to Board of Directors
summary: Endeavor Group Holdings Inc. has appointed Jacqueline Reses, CEO of Post House Capital, to its board of directors, increasing the number of women on its seven-member board to three. This move ensures Endeavor complies with California's Senate Bill 826, which mandates a minimum number of women on the boards of publicly traded companies in the state. Reses brings extensive experience in corporate finance, technology, and various other board positions.

title: Cohen & Steers brings on head of ESG
summary: Cohen & Steers has appointed Khalid Husain as its head of ESG. This move is significant for the company, indicating a focus on environmental, social, and governance factors within its operations. The article notes this alongside other financial industry news regarding private credit, endowments, and pension funds.

title: Tesla says Elon Musk's 2020 compensation was nil
summary: Tesla Inc. reported that CEO Elon Musk's total compensation for 2020 was nil, a decrease from $23,760 in 2019, while CFO Zachary Kirkhorn's compensation rose significantly to $46.6 million. Musk's pay package is tied to Tesla's market capitalization and financial growth targets, and he has recently qualified for options worth over $30 billion from his 2018 package. The company also notably assigned Musk the title "Technoking of Tesla" and Kirkhorn "Master of Coin" in a recent regulatory filing.

title: Moderna Achieves a Tesla-Like Aura With Investors
summary: Moderna's rapid valuation increase due to its Covid-19 vaccine is drawing comparisons to Tesla's market performance. Both companies have seen their market capitalization soar, joining the S&P 500 index despite valuations that defy conventional analysis. The article explores the parallels between these two seemingly disparate companies and their investor appeal.

title: Xos unveils mobile charging station for EV fleets
summary: Xos, Inc., an electric commercial vehicle manufacturer, has introduced Xos Hub, a mobile charging station designed for EV fleets. This portable unit can charge up to five vehicles simultaneously and holds up to 3 MWh of energy storage, addressing the bottleneck of charging infrastructure for EV adoption. The company also offers an "infrastructure-as-a-service" platform for comprehensive EV fleet support.

title: Palladium Rally Threatened by Automakers’ Pivot to Platinum
summary: The palladium rally, which has seen prices more than triple since mid-2018, is facing significant threats due to increasing platinum substitution by automakers and the long-term rise of electric vehicles. Automakers are increasingly opting for the cheaper platinum in catalytic converters for gasoline engines, driven by technological advancements and palladium’s high prices. This shift, coupled with the eventual dominance of electric vehicles, poses an existential threat to palladium demand.

title: Tesla Stock: A Look At Their Plant, Property & Equipment (NASDAQ:TSLA)
summary: This article examines Tesla's plant, property, and equipment (PPE) as detailed in their Q2 2021 earnings report. It highlights a significant increase in PPE, driven by large-scale capital projects including new factories and product lines, following their first billion-dollar quarterly profit. The author, a CPA, analyzes these developments for investors.

title: Domino’s Pizza, Pinterest, GoDaddy e AMC: confira os 33 BDRs que estreiam na B3 nesta 2ª feira
summary: On August 16th, 33 new BDRs, including Domino's Pizza, Pinterest, GoDaddy, and AMC Entertainment, began trading on the B3. These BDRs allow Brazilian investors to access global company stocks, with significant growth in investor numbers and trading volumes since regulatory changes in 2020. The article highlights top-performing BDRs and the increasing interest of Brazilian investors in this market segment.

title: Global Synthetic Graphite Market To Reach Around Us$ 7 Bn By 2026; Increase In Demand For Graphite Electrodes To Drive Market
summary: The global synthetic graphite market is projected to reach approximately US$ 7 billion by 2026, growing at a CAGR of over 5% from its US$ 4 billion valuation in 2017. This growth is primarily driven by increasing demand for synthetic graphite in metallurgy, electronics, and especially in the production of graphite electrodes for electric arc furnaces and lithium-ion batteries. Asia Pacific is expected to lead this expansion due to its significant demand for lithium-ion batteries.

title: Joby Aviation Announces Closing of Business Combination with Reinvent Technology Partners to Become Publicly Traded Company
summary: Joby Aviation announced the closing of its business combination with Reinvent Technology Partners, making it a publicly traded company on the NYSE under the ticker "JOBY" as of August 11, 2021. This milestone positions Joby as the first U.S.-based eVTOL company on the public market, with approximately $1.6 billion in proceeds expected to fund through initial commercial operations. The company's leadership in the sector is highlighted by its technological advancements, progress toward FAA certification, and strategic partnerships.

title: Why the SPDR S&P Kensho Clean Power ETF could breakout
summary: The SPDR S&P Kensho Clean Power ETF (CNRG) experienced a significant downturn in 2021 despite initial strong performance, primarily due to supply chain issues in solar energy and policy uncertainties. However, with encouraging Q2 results from key holdings like Enphase Energy and progress on US infrastructure bills, the ETF is showing signs of recovery. Analysts remain bullish on solar stocks and clean energy due to falling renewable energy costs, technological innovation, and increasing global acceptance.

title: Tesla Rival Li Auto Launches $2 Billion Hong Kong Share Sale
summary: Electric-car maker Li Auto Inc. has launched a nearly $2 billion stock offering in Hong Kong, following other U.S.-listed Chinese companies seeking investments closer to home. This move proceeds despite a recent selloff in offshore-listed Chinese stocks due to official actions against various sectors. The company, a Nasdaq-listed EV manufacturer, is pushing ahead with the share sale amidst market volatility.

title: Documentary shines a light on lithium mining and conflicts in Argentina
summary: A new documentary titled "In the name of lithium" highlights the conflicts arising from lithium mining in Argentina, focusing on indigenous communities in Salinas Grandes, Jujuy province. The film, which took five years to make, explores the environmental and social impacts of lithium extraction, particularly concerning water usage. Communities fear that the extensive water required for mining will deplete their resources, impacting their livelihoods and the local ecosystem.

title: BHP enters into nickel supply agreement with Tesla Inc
summary: BHP has signed a nickel supply agreement with Tesla Inc., providing nickel from its Western Australian Nickel West asset, which is noted for its sustainability and low carbon emissions. This partnership aims to support the growing demand for electric vehicles and collaborate on making the battery supply chain more sustainable, including using blockchain for raw material traceability and exploring energy storage solutions to reduce carbon emissions. Both companies will also work together on promoting sustainability within the resources sector and aligning with partners who share their principles.

title: 💡 Optimist's Edge: Big batteries are the missing piece of the energy puzzle
summary: This article argues that large battery storage is an integral and increasingly vital part of our energy system, countering initial skepticism from figures like former Australian Prime Minister Scott Morrison. It highlights the successful implementation of Tesla's Hornsdale Power Reserve in South Australia, demonstrating how big batteries prevent blackouts, save consumers money, and balance the grid. The article also discusses the rapid decline in battery costs and the significant investment opportunities in this sector.

title: Big investors are divesting from fossil fuels – should you?
summary: The article explores the dilemma for Australian investors regarding fossil fuels: whether to invest in undervalued energy names or join the growing trend of divestment. It presents arguments from both "bulls" who see continued demand from Asian markets and "bears" who warn of stranded assets due to renewable energy advancements and tightening regulations. The piece discusses the potential for energy companies to transition to green futures and the financial risks involved for investors.

title: Joby Completes Flight of More Than 150 Miles with Electric Vertical Take-Off Air Taxi
summary: Joby Aero Inc. successfully completed a 150-mile flight on a single charge with its full-size electric vertical take-off and landing (eVTOL) prototype, including vertical take-off and landing. This milestone demonstrates the viability of current battery technology for convenient, emissions-free air travel, with commercial passenger service anticipated to start in 2024. The flight lasted over an hour, covering 154.6 statute miles and validating the efficiency of their aircraft design and battery system.

title: Amazon denies accepting Bitcoin, sends it tumbling
summary: Amazon.com Inc denied a media report suggesting it would accept Bitcoin payments by year-end, causing the cryptocurrency to tumble below $37,000. Earlier speculation, fueled by a job posting for a digital currency lead, had driven Bitcoin past $40,000. The company stated that while interested in the space, the specific plans for cryptocurrencies were not true.

title: It's Looking Like a Fine Time to Consider Covered Call ETFs
summary: The article discusses the increasing appeal of covered call ETFs, such as the Global X Nasdaq 100 Covered Call ETF (QYLD), for income-starved investors amidst market volatility. QYLD offers a substantial yield and provides monthly income, making it an attractive option for long-term investors looking for alternative income streams in various market conditions. Analysts suggest covered call strategies tend to outperform outright stock ownership in flat, down, and slightly up markets.

title: General Motors CEO Mary Barra is steering the way to an all-electric future
summary: General Motors CEO Mary Barra is spearheading the company's transition to an all-electric future by aiming to exclusively offer EVs and end production of fossil fuel vehicles by 2035. Under her leadership, GM plans to introduce 30 new EVs by 2025 with a US$35 billion investment, showcasing a strong commitment to combating climate change and transforming the automotive industry. Barra's vision also emphasizes diversity, accountability, and an agile culture within GM to achieve these ambitious environmental and business goals.

title: Tesla's Elon Musk admits Cybertruck could be a 'flop'
summary: Tesla CEO Elon Musk has acknowledged that the Cybertruck, despite his personal affection for its design, could potentially "flop" because of its unconventional nature. Musk made this admission in response to an opinion piece suggesting the vehicle might miss sales expectations. Tesla plans to begin volume production of the Cybertruck in 2022, with a base price of $39,900.

title: Why is Tesla incorporated in Delaware?
summary: This article explains why a disproportionate number of companies, including Tesla, Amazon, and Google, are incorporated in Delaware despite not being headquartered there. Key reasons include flexible corporate law, the efficient Court of Chancery, favorable tax treatment for out-of-state income, and a long-standing state focus on business formation. The article also touches on the challenges this presents for regional data and business coverage.

title: Wednesday's Top Analyst Upgrades and Downgrades: Carnival, Conagra, Duke Energy, Estee Lauder, Gap, Lululemon, Tesla and More
summary: This article details a list of top analyst upgrades and downgrades for various companies on Wednesday, July 14, 2021, providing insights into stock performance and price targets. It also briefly discusses the broader market context, including inflation data and investors' reactions to second-quarter earnings. Companies mentioned include Carnival, Conagra, Duke Energy, Estee Lauder, Gap, Lululemon, and Tesla.

title: Qraft's AI-powered ETFs wow Wall Street with winning stock picks
summary: Qraft Technologies, a South Korea-based fintech startup, has gained Wall Street's attention with its AI-powered exchange-traded funds (ETFs) listed on the NYSE. These AI-enhanced ETFs, QRTF and AMOM, have delivered favorable returns by using AI to forecast stock movements and adapt to market conditions. Notably, the AMOM ETF divested all its Tesla stocks before a market dip, highlighting the AI's predictive capabilities and attracting significant investment.

title: Musk tells SolarCity trial that Tesla would 'die' if he wasn't CEO
summary: During a trial concerning Tesla's 2016 acquisition of SolarCity, Elon Musk testified that Tesla would "die" if he wasn't CEO, despite asserting the board controls the company. The lawsuit alleges Musk strong-armed the board into the $2.6 billion deal for SolarCity, founded by his cousins, to bail out his investment. Musk denied financial gain from the merger, stating it aimed to combine Tesla's battery business with SolarCity's energy generation.

title: The race for renewable energy is just getting started
summary: The article discusses the accelerating shift towards renewable energy, highlighting global investments exceeding $500 billion in 2020. Authored by Gregg Guerin of First Trust, it explores five key drivers including declining costs, investment shifts, government support, smart grid infrastructure, and low-carbon policies. The piece also delves into investment opportunities in EVs, energy storage, and the potential of green hydrogen as a future energy source.

title: Ford drops use of 'chairman' title, adopts other gender-neutral language
summary: Ford Motor Company has officially replaced the title "chairman" with "chair" and adopted other gender-neutral language in its bylaws, effective July 8. General Motors also made a similar change in May, adjusting Mary Barra's title from chairman and CEO to chair and CEO. This move reflects a broader trend among major corporations and institutions to promote inclusivity and adapt to changing societal norms.

title: Chinese EV Maker XPeng Makes Debut in Hong Kong
summary: Chinese EV maker XPeng debuted on the Hong Kong stock exchange, raising $1.8 billion with a dual-primary listing. This move brings the company closer to Chinese investors and provides insurance against potential delisting from U.S. markets due to stricter audit regulations. The dual-primary listing allows XPeng to maintain trading independent of its U.S. status and makes it eligible for the Stock Connect program.

title: Qraft’s AI-Enhanced U.S. Large Cap Momentum ETF Surpasses $50M in AUM
summary: Qraft AI ETFs announced that its AI-Enhanced U.S. Large Cap Momentum ETF (AMOM) has exceeded $50 million in assets under management, demonstrating nearly 1,500% growth since August 2020. The fund leverages AI technology to identify high alpha factors and optimize its strategy, leading to consistent outperformance against its benchmark. This milestone highlights the increasing investor interest in AI-driven fund management amidst market volatility.

title: Pallinghurst makes billion-dollar bet on Quebec as global battery hub
summary: European private equity investor Pallinghurst Group is making a billion-dollar bet on Quebec becoming a key global battery hub, investing over US$500-million in projects like Nemaska Lithium Inc. and Nouveau Monde Graphite. This investment supports Quebec's ambitious vision to establish a lithium-ion battery industry, leveraging its carbon-free hydropower despite past challenges in the sector. Pallinghurst's co-managing partner, Arne Frandsen, emphasizes the province's political willingness, strong rule of law, and cheap clean energy as critical factors for their commitment.

title: Air intake filter - yes or no?
summary: Tesla Model 3 owners discuss the pros and cons of adding aftermarket air intake filters under the hood. While some users find them helpful for keeping debris out of the cabin filter, others report significant airflow restriction and potential issues with mold growth. Many contributors explore alternatives like screens or modified filters to minimize airflow reduction.

title: Tesla’s Lidar Flirtation Is More Proof That Microvision Has Potential
authors: Louis Navellier and the InvestorPlace Research Staff
summary: This article discusses Microvision's potential in the lidar technology market, especially in light of Tesla's apparent reconsideration of lidar for its autonomous vehicles. Despite Microvision being a former penny stock with limited revenue, author Louis Navellier believes its long-range lidar solution positions it for significant growth if adopted by the auto industry. The piece highlights Tesla's previous dismissal of lidar and its recent exploration of the technology, which could boost lidar-related stocks like MVIS.

title: Tesla top-of-range car caught fire while owner was driving, lawyer says
summary: A recently delivered Tesla Model S Plaid reportedly burst into flames while its owner was driving, with the electronic door system failing, according to the driver's lawyer. The incident, involving a $129,900 car delivered just three days prior, has prompted an investigation and a call to ground the Model S Plaid until the cause is determined. Tesla had no immediate comment, while the NHTSA is gathering information about the incident.

title: Advisor Ross Gerber Launches Active 'Roaring '20s' ETF
summary: Advisor Ross Gerber, president and CEO of Gerber Kawasaki Wealth and Investment Management, has launched an actively managed ETF called the AdvisorShares Gerber Kawasaki ETF (GK). This new ETF will focus on nine investment themes Gerber believes will thrive in the post-COVID economy, offering investors access to his stock-picking expertise in a tax-efficient structure. Gerber emphasizes that the ETF is designed as a core growth fund for long-term investors, not a "get-rich-quick" scheme, and aims to provide a smoother ride than more volatile single-theme funds.

title: Sunrise brief: Arevon opens 100 MW/400 MWh battery energy storage facility in California
summary: Arevon Asset Management has opened a 100 MW/400 MWh Saticoy battery energy storage system in Ventura County, California, acquired in partnership with Capital Dynamics and S&B USA Energy. The article also touches on other significant developments in the renewable energy sector, including Partners Group taking a stake in Dimension Renewable Energy, Koch unit investing in Lithion Battery, and Canadian Solar winning an 86 MW solar energy auction in Japan. Additionally, AltaSea plans a 2.2 MW solar array at the Port of Los Angeles, and Captona expands its fuel cell portfolio.

title: Builder Alset EHome Partners With Tesla to Construct Community of Ehomes
summary: Alset EHome, a property developer, has partnered with Tesla to install solar panels, Powerwalls, and EV chargers in 20 new homes in the Northpark community in Porter, Texas, with plans for more. This collaboration aims to create a sustainable housing ecosystem, including a Tesla vehicle with each Ehome, and expand to over 5,000 Ehomes in the next three to five years. The initiative supports a vision of communities built on sustainable carbon footprints and clean energy.

title: Breaking Down 'BLOK': Inside This ETF's Portfolio
summary: The Amplify Transformational Data Sharing ETF (BLOK) demonstrated its active management prowess by capitalizing on crypto market volatility in May, mitigating losses despite its high correlation to Bitcoin. BLOK strategically narrowed its holdings and increased exposure to digital platforms and exchanges, which typically thrive during periods of extreme market fluctuations. The ETF, with over $1 billion in AUM, focuses 80% of its portfolio on companies involved in blockchain technology but does not directly invest in cryptocurrencies.

title: Volvo plans to add lidar as standard equipment in electric XC90 SUV next year
summary: Volvo Cars announced plans to make lidar sensors standard equipment in its electric XC90 SUV starting next year, a strategic move to enhance safety and autonomous driving. This decision positions Volvo differently from rivals like Tesla, which rely solely on cameras. Luminar Technologies Inc. will supply the Iris lidar and Sentinel software for this integration.

title: WeRide raises $310M in Series C funding for autonomous vehicles
summary: WeRide, a Chinese developer of Level 4 autonomous vehicles, successfully raised $310 million in Series C funding, bringing its total funding in recent months to over $600 million and its valuation to $3.3 billion. The funding round saw participation from major entities including Alliance Ventures and China Structural Reform Fund, supporting WeRide's expansion of its robotaxi services in China and advancement of driverless technology. WeRide operates a robotaxi service in Guangzhou and aims to accelerate the commercialization of its driverless robotaxis and Mini Robobus.

title: Virtual power plant coming to Maui and other islands
summary: A new virtual power plant project is launching on Maui, Oahu, and Hawaii island, utilizing solar-powered home batteries from 6,000 homeowners. Implemented by Swell Energy Inc. in partnership with Hawaiian Electric, the program aims to provide 25 megawatts of solar power and 80 MW of batteries, reducing energy bills for participants and supporting Hawaii's goal of 100 percent clean energy by 2045. The initiative was a major topic at the Hawaii Energy Conference, highlighting innovative solutions for a decentralized energy grid.

title: 2021 Cars.com American-Made Index: Which Cars Are the Most American?
summary: The 2021 Cars.com American-Made Index ranks 90 vehicles based on five criteria, with Tesla's Model 3 taking the top spot for the first time. The index highlights the top American-made cars, emphasizing criteria like assembly location, parts content, and U.S. manufacturing workforce, while also discussing the impact of factors like the chip shortage and trade pacts. The article also provides detailed methodology for the index, including disqualifiers and how various vehicle types are evaluated.

title: 2021 Cars.com American-Made Index: What About the Least American Cars?
summary: This article explores vehicles that rank low on Cars.com's 2021 American-Made Index, highlighting models with foreign assembly or low U.S./Canadian parts content. It reveals that nearly half of cars sold in America are assembled abroad and lists major automakers by their share of U.S. light-duty sales from domestic assembly, with Tesla at 100%. The piece aims to inform consumers about the origin of cars beyond just the American brands.

title: 2021 Cars.com American-Made Index: Ranking by Class
summary: Cars.com's 2021 American-Made Index ranks 90 vehicles, providing a breakdown of the most American-made cars by class, including three-row SUVs, two-row SUVs, pickup trucks, sports cars, cars under $25,000, and electric/hybrid models. The article aims to assist shoppers interested in purchasing U.S.-made products by categorizing and listing vehicles based on their AMI ranking within specific segments. It highlights notable vehicles in each category and discusses the methodology for inclusion in the index, particularly for electrified models.

title: Con Edison to combine battery storage and EV chargers at same site in New York
summary: Con Edison has partnered with Centrica Business Solutions to develop an energy hub in Brooklyn, New York, combining 18 350kW EV chargers and a battery energy storage system (ESS). This project is claimed to be the first of its kind in New York City, aiming to provide affordable and abundant energy, especially during peak urban hours. The hub is expected to be fully installed by summer 2022, with Con Edison planning to share its findings to guide future charging infrastructure development.

title: Tesla tops American-made list. Can EV rivals catch up?
summary: A new report by Cars.com's American-Made Index shows that Tesla's vehicles, particularly the Model 3, top the list for having the most American parts, manufacturing, and labor, surpassing traditional automakers. This highlights the potential for electric vehicles to boast high domestic content and fuels the debate on the relationship between EVs and U.S. manufacturing. The findings come amid a push by major automakers to build battery plants in North America, signaling a potential shift towards more domestically sourced American auto fleets.

title: Gov. Ivey: Westwater Resources Plans First U.S. Graphite Processing Plant in Alabama
summary: Governor Kay Ivey announced that Westwater Resources Inc. plans to build the first-of-its-kind advanced graphite processing plant in Coosa County, Alabama, with an initial investment of $80 million and subsequent $124 million to make Alabama a leader in graphite production. This facility will produce an essential material for batteries in electric vehicles and electronics, creating at least 100 full-time jobs and reducing U.S. dependence on foreign graphite sources, particularly from China. The project also includes significant state and local incentives, workforce development, and an environmentally sustainable processing method.

title: Chipotle Launches Rewards Exchange With New Video Game And Tesla Model 3 Giveaway
summary: Chipotle is celebrating the launch of its updated Rewards Exchange program, which now offers diverse redemption options beyond free entrees, by introducing a new video game called "Chipotle Race to Rewards Exchange." The game, live for 48 hours, challenges players to earn points for a chance to win a 2021 Tesla Model 3 and other prizes, while also allowing the first 500,000 daily players to earn points for free chips. This initiative aims to engage its nearly 23 million Rewards members and highlight the faster ways they can now earn rewards.

title: Chipotle Launches Rewards Exchange With New Video Game And Tesla Model 3 Giveaway
summary: Chipotle announced the launch of its updated Rewards Exchange program, offering members more reward options beyond just free entrees. To celebrate, Chipotle introduced a new video game called "Chipotle Race to Rewards Exchange" on June 23, where players can win a 2021 Tesla Model 3 and other prizes. The game aims to showcase how quickly loyalty members can earn rewards under the new system, which includes points redeemable for free food items and donations to non-profit partners.

title: Electric Vehicles Will Dominate China's Automotive Market in 10 Years
summary: Electric vehicles are predicted to dominate China's automotive market within the next decade, with Chinese car brands aiming for significant market share. Executives from major Chinese electric car companies forecast that new energy vehicles will account for over 70% of new car sales by 2030. The KraneShares Electric Vehicles and Future Mobility Index ETF (KARS) is positioned to benefit from this growth, tracking companies involved in EV production and related technologies.

title: Tesla signs deal with new home builder to outfit whole community with solar, Powerwall, and chargers
summary: Tesla has partnered with new home builder Alset EHome to install solar panels, Powerwalls, and EV chargers in a new community near Houston, Texas. This agreement initially covers 20 homes, with plans to expand to 100 Ehome deliveries in 2021 and 650 more in the pipeline, aiming to establish Tesla's energy division in the new home market. Alset EHome emphasizes sustainability, integrating solar and energy storage into their homes, which they believe will serve as a model for the future of housing.

title: Sustainable equity ETFs cut Tesla, Microsoft, and Netflix
summary: Two of Australia's largest sustainable international equity ETFs, BetaShares Global Sustainability Leaders (ETHI) and VanEck Vectors MSCI International Sustainable Equity (ESGI), have divested from Tesla, Microsoft, and Netflix due to failures in ESG screens. These divestments highlight the active decisions passive sustainable funds can make based on rigorous environmental, social, and governance criteria, contrasting with Vanguard's Ethically Conscious International Shares ETF (VESG) which continues to hold these companies. The article examines the different screening methodologies used by these funds and their impact on holdings, performance, and diversification.

title: 10 Most Popular Cars on YouTube
summary: New research by CarInsurance.ae reveals the 10 most popular car models on YouTube, with Tesla dominating the list despite not leading in sales volume. Tesla has four models included, securing the top spot with the Model 3, and demonstrating significant online conversation around the brand. Other manufacturers like Mazda, Lamborghini, Honda, Toyota, Audi, and BMW also feature in the rankings.

title: G.M. will increase investment in electric vehicles by 30 percent and build more battery plants. (Published 2021)
summary: General Motors announced a significant acceleration in its electric vehicle plans, increasing investment to $35 billion by 2025 and projecting the construction of two more battery plants in the U.S. This strategic shift is a response to increasing EV adoption and competitive moves from rivals like Ford and Volkswagen, with GM aiming to sell one million EVs annually by 2025 and transition to an all-electric lineup by 2035. The company also reported an improved operating profit forecast for the first half of the year due to better chip supplies and strong demand.

title: GM ups spending on EVs and autonomous vehicles by 30% to $35 billion by 2025 on higher profits
summary: General Motors announced a significant increase in spending on electric and autonomous vehicles, boosting its investment by 30% to $35 billion through 2025. This expanded commitment includes accelerating battery and fuel cell production with two new U.S. plants, driven by strong underlying business performance and higher profit expectations. GM also raised its first-half pretax earnings guidance to $8.5 billion to $9.5 billion amidst aggressive plans to compete in the EV market.

title: All EV Roads Lead to Lithium Miners & Battery Producers
summary: The electric vehicle (EV) market's growth hinges on upstream lithium miners and battery producers, despite current attention on downstream OEMs. Historically low lithium prices have deterred production capacity expansion, potentially leading to supply bottlenecks as EV demand accelerates. Increased investment in lithium mining and battery manufacturing is crucial to prevent shortages and ensure global EV availability, with governments and companies recognizing this critical supply chain challenge.

title: High speed acceleration - revisited
summary: This discussion thread investigates the perceived "slowness" of Tesla vehicles during high-speed acceleration compared to their off-the-line launch. Contributors debate the physics behind EV and ICE vehicle acceleration at higher speeds, discussing factors like fixed gear ratios, air resistance, power bands, and back EMF. The conversation also touches on the difference in acceleration characteristics between current Tesla models and the Plaid versions.

title: Electric vehicle stocks: the competition is heating up
summary: The electric vehicle (EV) industry is experiencing a boom with significant growth predicted for the coming years, driven by climate change concerns. While Tesla currently leads the market, competition is intensifying from traditional automakers like Volkswagen, General Motors, and Ford, as well as Chinese manufacturers and new EV start-ups. Investors are advised to take a diversified approach, potentially using thematic investment products, due to the high level of competition.

title: AI for stock picking, and beyond
summary: Qraft Technologies, a Seoul-based financial technology startup, is gaining recognition for its AI-enhanced ETFs, which have shown success in stock picking, particularly by offloading Tesla shares before sharp declines. The company's AI solution utilizes deep learning modules to identify profitable patterns and extract investment strategies, leading to outperformance against benchmarks and attracting interest from Korean financial institutions. Qraft aims to further expand its AI applications within the finance industry, including active fixed-income and thematic ETFs, and personalized financial product recommendations.

title: G.M. will increase production of cars and trucks as the chip shortage eases. (Published 2021)
summary: General Motors announced plans to increase vehicle production and expects significantly better financial results for the first half of the year as the global semiconductor shortage begins to ease. The company will boost production of heavy-duty pickups and ship previously incomplete midsize pickups, indicating a recovery from the chip-related plant idlings earlier in the year. Other automakers like Ford and Tesla have also been impacted by the chip shortage.

title: Luxury Goods Sales Projected to Recover to 2019 Levels This Year
summary: A new report from Bain & Company projects global luxury goods sales to fully recover to 2019 levels this year, with a 30% probability of exceeding $340 billion. This optimistic forecast is driven by strong economic rebounds in China and the United States, propelled by swift vaccine distribution and increased disposable income. The article highlights the U.S. Global Investors' Global Luxury Goods Fund (USLUX) as an attractive way to capitalize on this recovery, benefiting from the spending habits of affluent consumers, particularly in Asia.

title: Stock of the week - NVIDIA (27.05.2021)
summary: NVIDIA (NVDA.US) reported record first-quarter fiscal 2022 results, exceeding revenue and EPS expectations, driven by strong performance in Gaming, Data Center, and Professional Visualization platforms. The company also announced an upbeat Q2 forecast and a 4-for-1 stock split, which is seen as a bullish signal for investors. The growth is significantly boosted by the gaming sector during the pandemic and the increasing demand for its graphics cards by cryptocurrency miners.

title: Nvidia sets 4-for-1 stock split, shares rise
summary: Nvidia Corp announced a four-for-one stock split to make its shares more affordable for investors, causing its stock to rise by 3%. This move follows similar splits by Apple and Tesla last year, with Nvidia's split requiring stockholder approval in June and effective mid-July.

title: Tesla Service Center coming to Madison Wisconsin
summary: Discussion thread among Tesla Motors Club members about a new Tesla Service Center opening in Madison, Wisconsin. Initial speculation was confirmed by a sales advisor, with details on location and opening timeframe. Later posts confirm signage is up and service appointments are starting.

title: Baidu Awards Contract to Hesai for Customized Lidar Sensor That Will Power Its Self-Driving Cars
summary: Baidu has contracted Hesai Technology to develop a customized lidar sensor for its fifth-generation self-driving vehicles, aiming for mass production in Q3 this year. The new lidar will offer higher accuracy and a wider detection radius while costing nearly 50% less than current models. This initiative supports Baidu's plan to diversify revenue through robotaxi services and selling autonomous driving systems.

title: Greenidge Commits to Being 100% Carbon Neutral for Its Bitcoin Mining Facility Starting June 2021
summary: Greenidge Generation Holdings Inc. announced its commitment to offset all greenhouse gas emissions from its Bitcoin mining facility starting June 1, 2021, through accredited offset credits. The company also plans to invest a portion of its mining profits in renewable energy projects and will continue participating in the Regional Greenhouse Gas Initiative (RGGI). This move comes amidst growing environmental concerns regarding Bitcoin mining, as highlighted by recent actions from Tesla and legislative proposals in New York.

title: Biggest deal in Korea: Hanon Systems stake sale draws KKR, Carlyle, TPG
summary: The sale of a near-70% stake in South Korean auto parts supplier Hanon Systems Corp. has commenced, attracting major private equity firms like KKR, Carlyle, and TPG, with an expected valuation of around 7 trillion won ($6.2 billion), potentially making it Korea's largest M&A deal. The high price tag, coupled with potential consortiums involving LG Electronics and Carlyle, presents both significant opportunities and hurdles for interested bidders. Hanon's robust client portfolio and position in the growing EV thermal management market are attractive, but concerns exist regarding its valuation compared to industry peers and current market conditions.
source: The Korea Economic Daily Global Edition
source_domain: The Korea Economic Daily Global Edition

title: ElectraMeccanica breaks ground on Mesa manufacturing facility
summary: ElectraMeccanica Vehicles Corp. has broken ground on its first U.S. assembly facility and engineering technical center in Mesa, Arizona, marking the third EV manufacturing groundbreaking in Arizona since 2019. The facility, an investment of over $35 million, will provide local assembly for the brand's SOLO electric vehicle and is expected to be completed by Spring 2022. This expansion highlights Arizona's booming electric vehicle industry and will bring hundreds of jobs to the Mesa community.

title: Elon Musk Says Tesla Has Suspended Accepting Bitcoin for Vehicle Purchases - WSJ
summary: Tesla CEO Elon Musk announced the company has suspended accepting Bitcoin for vehicle purchases due to concerns about the rapidly increasing use of fossil fuels, particularly coal, for Bitcoin mining and transactions. Musk stated that Bitcoin would be used for transactions again once its mining transitions to more sustainable energy sources. The decision highlights ongoing debates about cryptocurrencies' environmental impact and their viability for widespread payments.

title: Die lubricant solutions for next generation large die casting machines
summary: This article discusses how innovative lubricant technology, specifically water-free electrostatic systems like Lubrolene from Quaker Houghton, is supporting the new generation of large die casting machines in the automotive industry. These solutions address the challenges of manufacturing larger, lighter, and more complex vehicle parts by improving quality, productivity, reducing costs, and extending tool life. The technology helps achieve better lubricant deposition, reduces environmental impact, and offers significant cost savings compared to traditional water-based lubricants.

title: CoStar To Employees: Come Back To The Office And Get A Tesla
summary: CoStar is incentivizing its vaccinated employees to return to the office with a variety of prizes, including a new Tesla, $10,000 cash, and an all-expenses-paid trip to Barbados. This initiative, launched alongside a company-wide vaccine rollout, aims to boost office occupancy, which has risen from 4 percent to 20 percent since the program began. CEO Andrew Florance stated that these creative incentives are part of an ongoing effort to adjust to new workplace realities post-pandemic, as other companies also explore various strategies to encourage office returns.

title: EBay says open to accepting to cryptocurrencies in future, exploring NFTs
authors: Akanksha Rana and Uday Sampath Kumar
summary: EBay Inc. announced its openness to accepting cryptocurrency as a form of payment and is exploring ways to integrate non-fungible tokens (NFTs) onto its platform. While there are no immediate plans, the company is actively monitoring the evolving cryptocurrency landscape and the growing popularity of NFTs, similar to other major companies like Tesla and PayPal that have embraced virtual currencies. EBay CEO Jamie Iannone confirmed these explorations, noting the company's long-standing connection to collectibles.

title: Ark Invest: How to choose & buy Ark ETFs in Singapore, Money News
summary: This article details Ark Invest ETFs, explaining their focus on disruptive innovation and providing an overview of all 8 available Ark ETFs. It specifically analyzes the Ark Innovation ETF (ARKK), outlining its pros and cons, and offers guidance on how Singaporean investors can buy Ark ETFs.

title: GM to invest $1 billion in Mexico for electric vehicle production, angering UAW members
summary: General Motors announced plans to invest over $1 billion in its Ramos Arizpe production complex in Mexico to produce electric vehicles starting in 2023. This decision has angered United Auto Workers Vice President Terry Dittes, who called it a "slap in the face" to union members and U.S. taxpayers. Dittes argues that government subsidies for EVs should not go to companies using labor outside the U.S.

title: Model 3 Charging Hubbell HBL2810 Receptacle
summary: A Tesla Model 3 owner sought advice on charging their vehicle using a Hubbell HBL2810 receptacle in an apartment parking stall. Forum members recommended using a two-adapter solution or a custom adapter from EVSE Adapters to convert the L21-30 outlet for Tesla's Mobile Connector. The owner later confirmed that a custom L21-30 to Gen 2 adapter from EVSE Adapters worked effectively, providing about 200V charging.

title: GM named one of Time's 'Most Influential Companies'
summary: General Motors Co. was recognized by Time Magazine as one of the 100 Most Influential Companies for its efforts in engineering a greener future with electric vehicles. GM was the only Detroit Three automaker on the list, cited alongside Volkswagen and Tesla for their commitment to electrifying the auto industry. Despite significant investment in EVs and a goal to sell 1 million globally by 2025, GM faces challenges in convincing investors it's as valuable an EV leader as Tesla.

title: Tesla Inc. Is One of the 2022 TIME100 Most Influential Companies
summary: Tesla Inc. has been recognized as one of the 2021 TIME100 Most Influential Companies for its significant impact on the automotive and renewable energy sectors. In 2020, Tesla became the world's most valuable car company and a leader in electric energy generation and storage with its Powerwall, Powerpack, and Solar Roof divisions. The company is highlighted for its glamorous cars and its cooler commitment to clean, renewable energy.

title: Procter & Gamble Is One of the 2021 TIME100 Most Influential Companies | TIME
summary: Procter & Gamble (P&G) was recognized as one of the 2021 TIME100 Most Influential Companies due to its significant performance during the pandemic. The company saw a banner year with $71 billion in sales, a 6% increase, driven by high demand for its household products like Charmin and Tide. Additionally, P&G repurposed its manufacturing capabilities to produce hundreds of thousands of face shields for healthcare workers.

title: Tesla Inc To Setup India Headquarters In Mumbai: Report
summary: Tesla Inc. is reportedly establishing its India headquarters in Mumbai, specifically in the Lower Parel-Worli area, with plans for a 40,000 sq ft office. The company will also set up its production base in Karnataka and is preparing to launch its first electric cars in India with three models. Tesla has already begun hiring key personnel for its Indian operations.

title: Cathie Wood's ARK Invest piles into UiPath, trims Tesla
summary: Cathie Wood's ARK Invest purchased shares of automation software provider UiPath (PATH.N) during its stock market debut, while simultaneously reducing its holdings in Tesla (TSLA.O). The firm's ETFs bought approximately 2.7 million UiPath shares and also invested in Coinbase Global Inc (COIN.O). ARK Invest's Innovation ETF sold 163,981 shares of Tesla.

title: NatWest will refuse to serve business customers who accept cryptocurrencies
summary: NatWest has announced it will not serve business customers who accept cryptocurrency payments, deeming them "high risk" due to the volatile and unregulated nature of crypto assets. This decision positions NatWest against other major banks and could impact companies looking to integrate digital currency payments. The bank emphasized its cautious approach, citing concerns about financial crime and the potential for consumers to lose all their invested cash.

title: Battle Motors Acquires Crane Carrier Company Launching Path to Class 7 and 8 Vocational Truck Electrification
summary: Battle Motors, a leader in EV technology, has acquired Crane Carrier Company (CCC), a significant move towards electrifying Class 7 and 8 vocational trucks. This acquisition combines CCC's 75 years of commercial vehicle manufacturing with Battle Motors' EV expertise to introduce full electric severe-duty trucks to the market, set to launch this summer. The combined entity plans to significantly expand production capabilities in New Philadelphia, Ohio, boosting the local economy and accelerating the transition to sustainable energy in the vocational truck sector.

title: AutoX Selects Arbe's 4D Imaging Radar Platform for Level 4 Autonomous Vehicles
summary: Arbe announced that AutoX has selected its 4D Imaging Radar Platform for integration into 400,000 Level 4 autonomous vehicles, including RoboTaxis, over the next five years. This partnership aims to enhance safety and performance by utilizing Arbe's ultra-high resolution radar systems, which offer 100 times more detail than other market radars. The collaboration emphasizes an effort to elevate safety standards for L4 autonomous vehicles, particularly in dense urban environments like those in China.

title: Oracle plans to bring 8,500 jobs, $1.2 billion campus to Nashville
summary: Oracle Corporation plans to invest $1.2 billion in Nashville, bringing 8,500 jobs with an average salary of $110,000 to the city. This development would be the largest in Tennessee's history, involving significant public infrastructure contributions from Oracle without burdening taxpayers. The new campus will transform Nashville's East Bank, creating a major technology hub.

title: If Copper is the New Oil, This ETF Is Looking Golden
summary: The article highlights copper's growing importance, with Goldman Sachs dubbing it the "new oil" due to increasing demand driven by infrastructure plans, electric vehicles, and renewable energy. The Global X Copper Miners ETF (COPX) is presented as an investment option to capitalize on this trend, offering targeted exposure to copper mining companies. Projections suggest significant price increases for copper in the coming years.

title: Coinbase listing marks latest step in crypto’s march to the mainstream
summary: Coinbase Global Inc.'s listing on Nasdaq is a significant step for cryptocurrencies moving into the financial mainstream, being the largest listing by a crypto firm yet and boosting awareness among investors. While many see it as positive for Bitcoin and the broader crypto sector, some investors caution about the volatility risks and regulatory uncertainties associated with the asset class. Coinbase's revenues are highly correlated to Bitcoin's performance, raising concerns about its long-term stability.

title: HSBC bans customers from buying bitcoin-backer MicroStrategy shares
summary: HSBC has Banned customers of its online share-trading platform from buying or transferring MicroStrategy Inc stock, classifying it as a "virtual currency product" due to the bank's policy against direct exposure to virtual currencies. While existing shares can be held or sold, new purchases are prohibited, distinguishing HSBC's stance from other major financial firms like Goldman Sachs and Morgan Stanley that are embracing cryptocurrency investments. MicroStrategy, led by bitcoin proponent Michael Saylor, holds significant bitcoin reserves, totaling around 91,579 bitcoins worth about $5.5 billion.

title: Chinese autonomous vehicle startup WeRide scores permit to test driverless cars in San Jose
summary: WeRide, a Chinese autonomous vehicle startup, has received a permit to test driverless cars on public roads in San Jose, California. This makes WeRide the seventh company to obtain such a permit in California, signifying a crucial step toward launching commercial robotaxi or delivery services. The company, which is well-funded and primarily operates in China, is expanding its presence and testing capabilities in the U.S. market.

title: REE Automotive Signs Strategic Collaboration Agreement with Magna
summary: REE Automotive has signed a strategic collaboration agreement with Magna International Inc. to develop Modular Electric Vehicles (MEVs) for technology companies and new electric mobility players. This partnership will leverage REE's REEcorner™ technology and Magna's integration expertise to create customizable EV platforms, aiming to accelerate time-to-market for next-generation electric vehicles. They will also explore Mobility-as-a-Service (MaaS) opportunities in the Light Commercial Vehicle sector.

title: Solar Roof, big price increase
summary: Several Tesla Solar Roof reservation holders report significant price increases on their previously agreed-upon contracts, with some increases reaching $20,000 to $36,000 without changes to the design. This unexpected change is leading many customers to consider canceling their orders and explore alternative solar solutions, while also highlighting concerns about Tesla's customer service and communication on these projects.

title: Betting on Small Companies Yielded Big Returns (Published 2021)
summary: This article highlights how three small-cap value funds achieved significant returns in the first quarter of 2021 by taking on higher risks. Fund managers from Kinetics Small-Cap Opportunities, Hartford Small-Cap Value, and American Century Small-Cap Value discuss their investment strategies, which include concentrated holdings, focus on free cash flow, and identifying undervalued companies in various sectors. The funds' performance significantly outpaced the S&P 500, demonstrating the potential rewards of small-cap value investing.

title: First Cobalt Appoints Michael Insulan As New VP, Commercial To Advance Offtake Strategy
summary: First Cobalt Corp. has appointed Michael Insulan as Vice-President, Commercial, to spearhead the marketing of its refined cobalt sulfate production to electric vehicle manufacturers and battery cell makers. Based in Europe, Mr. Insulan will also be responsible for marketing recycled battery materials under a proposed Phase 2 expansion. This strategic move aims to strengthen First Cobalt’s position in the rapidly growing EV markets in North America and Europe.

title: Meet the highest paid CEO in S&P 500, Paycom’s $211M man
summary: Chad Richison, the founder and CEO of Paycom Software Inc., was awarded compensation valued at $211 million in 2020, making him the highest-paid CEO in the S&P 500 based on disclosures so far. This compensation package, centered on restricted shares, could be worth over $2 billion if Paycom's stock price significantly increases, demonstrating a performance-based alignment with shareholder interests. Richison's equity award is contingent on the company's share price more than doubling and reaching specific targets within the next decade.

title: Inside Factory Zero, where GM is betting big on electric vehicles
summary: General Motors is making a significant shift towards electric vehicles, investing heavily in its Factory Zero plant in Michigan to produce a new lineup of EVs. The company plans to launch 30 new electric vehicles across various price points within the next five years, aiming to cease gas-powered car production by 2035. This move positions GM in a competitive EV market, currently dominated by Tesla, as automakers globally transition to electric to combat climate change.

title: ElectraMeccanica Picks Mesa for New EV Assembly Plant
summary: ElectraMeccanica Vehicles Corp. announced plans to build an assembly plant in Mesa, AZ, for its Solo electric car, capable of producing up to 20,000 EVs annually. The facility will also feature an engineering technical center and testing workshops. This move highlights Arizona's growing appeal as a hub for EV manufacturing, attracting other automotive companies like Atlis Motor Vehicles Inc., Lucid Motors Inc., and Nikola Corp., as well as suppliers like UACJ Automotive Whitehall Industries Inc.

title: Why Sea Limited Stock Is Still a Buy Right Now
summary: Despite a recent tech sell-off, Sea Limited (NYSE: SE) is presented as a strong buying opportunity due to its rapid revenue growth, particularly in its e-commerce and gaming divisions, and the strong performance of its digital payment business, Sea Money. The article argues that the company was unfairly impacted by the broader tech market correction and is poised for continued growth, expanding into new regions like Latin America.

title: PayPal launches US crypto currency checkout service
summary: PayPal Holdings Inc. announced on Tuesday that it has launched a service allowing U.S. consumers to use their cryptocurrency holdings to pay at millions of its online merchants globally. This move, which applies to Bitcoin, Ether, Bitcoin Cash, and Litecoin, aims to significantly boost the use of digital assets in everyday commerce. PayPal expects this service to transition cryptocurrencies from primarily an asset class to a legitimate funding source for real-world transactions.
