title: How to Buy Cathie Wood’s ARKX ETF and Whether You Should
summary: Cathie Wood's ARK Investment has launched its eighth ETF, the ARK Space Exploration ETF (ARKX), which began trading on March 30. The article discusses how to purchase ARKX and evaluates its potential given the recent performance of other ARK ETFs and the shift from growth to value stocks. It also highlights the risks associated with investing in ARKX, including sectoral shifts and exposure to various industry-specific risks.

title: Bitcoin selloff takes a bite out of cryptocurrency’s biggest fund
summary: The Grayscale Bitcoin Trust (GBTC) has been significantly impacted by Bitcoin's recent selloff, dropping nearly double the decline of the cryptocurrency and trading at a record discount to its underlying value. This free-fall highlights a cooling in the retail-driven crypto market, exacerbated by GBTC's fixed supply and the emergence of Bitcoin ETFs in Canada which draw institutional money.

title: Is liftoff of Cathie Wood’s new ARK Space ETF imminent?
summary: Cathie Wood's Ark Investment Management is poised to launch its new ARK Space ETF as early as next week, capitalizing on a stellar year for her funds despite recent tech stock routs. Regulatory filings indicate a potential debut around March 29, and strong investor demand is anticipated given the success of Ark's other actively managed ETFs. The new ETF will focus on US and global companies involved in space exploration and innovation, aligning with current market interest in high-growth, long-term ideas.

title: ‘You can now buy a Tesla with Bitcoin’: Company’s ‘Technoking’
summary: Tesla Inc. CEO Elon Musk announced that Tesla electric vehicles can now be purchased using Bitcoin in the United States, with plans to expand this option globally later in the year. Musk stated that Bitcoin payments to Tesla will not be converted to conventional currency, following the company's $1.5 billion investment in Bitcoin last month. This move has drawn attention from other major companies like Uber and Twitter regarding their stance on cryptocurrency transactions and investments.

title: What Happens When You Smash a Tesla Into a Vintage Range Rover?
summary: E.C.D. Automotive Design, a restomodding company based in Florida, is building electric Range Rover Classics using Tesla drivetrains. These modified vehicles aim to resolve the notorious unreliability of vintage Land Rovers while offering a modern electric power source and extended range. The custom-built electric Range Rovers start at around $195,000, with higher-end builds approaching $300,000.

title: New Meets Old in This Tesla-Powered Range Rover Classic
summary: East Coast Defenders (E.C.D.) Automotive Design has introduced an electric conversion for Range Rover Classics, featuring a Tesla Direct Drive EV powertrain and 100-kWh battery pack. This allows the classic SUV to achieve 0-60 mph in 5.2 seconds and offers a 220-mile range. The vehicle retains its vintage exterior while boasting a luxurious, modern interior, highlighting a growing trend of electrifying classic cars.

title: KULR Partners with Andretti for EV Thermal Tech
summary: KULR Technology Group announced a long-term partnership with Andretti Technologies to bring space-proven thermal management technology from Mars Rover missions to EV motorsports. The collaboration aims to develop high-performance battery solutions with top safety ratings for racing and eventually transfer this technology to mass-market EV applications. The partnership emphasizes sustainable battery management systems and preventing thermal runaway in lithium-ion batteries.

title: Classic Range Rover Electromod Is Powered By A Tesla Drivetrain And Can Hit 60MPH In 5.2 Sec
summary: E.C.D. Automotive Design has completed its first electric conversion, transforming a Classic Range Rover into an electromod powered by a Tesla drivetrain. This restomod can achieve 0-60 mph in 5.2 seconds and boasts a 220-mile range from its 100 kWh battery pack. The company plans to continue electrifying other Land Rovers following this successful project.

title: DMS disrupted? Not just 2 giants now
summary: The article discusses the disruption in the Dealer Management System (DMS) market, traditionally dominated by CDK and Reynolds and Reynolds. New challengers like Tekion are emerging, with clients expressing satisfaction with their offerings. The piece suggests a shift in the competitive landscape of the DMS sector.

title: Gaming platform Roblox’s stock gains after Cathie Wood buys in
summary: Shares of gaming platform Roblox Corp jumped on Thursday after its stock market debut, buoyed by Cathie Wood's ARK Next Generation Internet exchange traded fund buying more than 500,000 shares. The purchase weighted Roblox at 0.47 percent of the fund and added to the strongest opening ever for a direct stock market listing. The company's stock rose 5.3 percent in late morning trades, having been up more than 20 percent earlier in the day.

title: If You Invested $1,000 In Tesla 10 Years Ago, Here's How Much You'd Have Now
summary: This article evaluates the return on a hypothetical $1,000 investment in Tesla Motors (NASDAQ: TSLA) made 10 years ago. It highlights Tesla's growth from its IPO to becoming a major electric vehicle manufacturer, detailing its stock performance, market capitalization milestones, and recent fluctuations. The article illustrates the substantial profit an early investor would have accrued despite the stock's volatility.

title: Exclusive: LG hopes to make new battery cells for Tesla in 2023 in U.S. or Europe -sources
summary: LG Energy Solution aims to produce advanced 4680 battery cells for Tesla's electric vehicles by 2023, considering manufacturing sites in the United States and Europe. While LG has made samples, it faces technological hurdles and has not yet secured orders from Tesla for these new cells, which Tesla is also developing in-house. LG currently supplies smaller cells to Tesla in China and is a major battery supplier for other automotive giants like General Motors.

title: Cathie Wood's Ark Innovation ETF surges more than 10% for its best day ever
summary: Cathie Wood's Ark Innovation ETF (ARKK) surged over 10% for its best day ever, driven by a rebound in tech stocks like Tesla, Zoom Video, and Palantir. This rally helped recoup some recent sharp losses for the fund, which had been impacted by a market rotation out of high-growth tech into value stocks. Despite recent volatility, Wood remains confident in her disruptive strategy, viewing the sell-off as an opportunity to buy.

title: Tesla loses a third of its value for the third time in a year
summary: Tesla Inc.'s stock experienced its third significant drop in a year, losing a third of its value from its January record high, primarily due to investor concerns about rising interest rates affecting high-valuation stocks. The selloff wiped off nearly $300 billion from its market capitalization, moving it behind Facebook. This decline is more pronounced than other major tech companies, and its shares have steadily fallen since announcing a bitcoin purchase, even as bitcoin’s price climbed.

title: Steel Dynamics Inc. ranks No. 1 in Fortune metal industry list
summary: Steel Dynamics Inc. (SDI) was ranked No. 1 in the metals industry category on Fortune's World’s Most Admired Companies list. This recognition, based on a poll of corporate executives, directors, and analysts, highlights SDI's strong operational and financial performance, innovation, and leadership. The article also notes SDI's new plant in Sinton, Texas, is expected to be operational this year and may supply steel to Tesla's Gigafactory for the Cybertruck.

title: ARK ETFs Erase 2021 Gains, Assets Hold
summary: Three of ARK Invest's seven ETFs, including the flagship ARK Innovation ETF (ARKK), have erased their 2021 gains as of early March, experiencing significant drops in value due to a sell-off in high-growth stocks. Despite these performance setbacks, all seven ARK ETFs have continued to register net inflows year-to-date, indicating persistent investor interest and confidence in the firm's disruptive technology themes. Assets under management for the ARK ETFs collectively reached $52.8 billion, making ARK the ninth-largest ETF issuer.

title: BUZZ, the ETF of Social-Media Darlings, Drops in Trading Debut
summary: The VanEck Vectors Social Sentiment ETF (BUZZ) began trading, aiming to capitalize on the retail-investing trend and the influence of social media buzz on stock performance. This ETF includes stocks like Tesla and DraftKings, aiming to capture the "new era of investing" where information is sourced and shared online.

title: Why Cathie Wood's once hot Ark Innovation ETF has lost all its 2021 gains
summary: Cathie Wood's Ark Innovation ETF (ARKK), which skyrocketed in 2020, has lost all its 2021 gains, declining 5.5% on Thursday and bringing its year-to-date decline to a similar amount. This pullback reflects a broader trend in tech stocks, driven by rising 10-year Treasury yields and fears of inflation leading to higher interest rates, which disproportionately affect growth stocks. The ETF's top holdings, including Tesla, Square, Roku, Teladoc, and Spotify, have seen significant declines.

title: 'Buzz' ETF tracking social media sentiment launches Thursday amid Reddit manias in stocks
summary: The Van Eck Vectors Social Sentiment ETF (BUZZ) has launched, aiming to track social media sentiment around stocks rather than price momentum. This ETF selects 75 stocks with bullish social media sentiment, based on a minimum $5 billion market cap and consistent social media mentions. While leveraging social media data, the ETF's criteria are designed to exclude the highly speculative "Reddit meme stocks" like GameStop, focusing instead on broader discussions.

title: Was That the IPO Stocks Bubble that Just Popped?
summary: The Renaissance IPO ETF ($IPO) and ARK Innovation ETF ($ARKK) have both experienced significant drops from their recent highs, raising questions about whether the IPO stocks bubble has popped. The article highlights the extreme exuberance in these high-flying stocks, comparing it to the 1999 dot-com bubble, and suggests that changing sentiment in these areas could signal a broader wobble in the market.

title: How Battery Metals Have Helped Us Outperform During the Slump in Gold Price
summary: Despite a slump in gold prices, U.S. Global Investors' World Precious Minerals Fund (UNWPX) has outperformed peers by strategically investing in battery metals like lithium, copper, nickel, cobalt, and graphite. The article highlights the strong investment case for these materials due to record-setting money printing, rising inflation expectations, and the burgeoning electric vehicle market, showcasing Nano One Materials as a key holding. UNWPX's focus on these materials led to a 70.60% return in 2020, significantly outperforming benchmark indices.

title: Electric Vehicles on the Rise: Should You Invest in the EV Market?
summary: The article explores the rapidly growing electric vehicle (EV) market and discusses investment opportunities. It advises considering the entire supply chain, from manufacturers to charging infrastructure and rare earth elements, while also cautioning against stock bubbles and highlighting potential risks and benefits of various EV companies and ETFs.

title: Barstool's Portnoy backs new BUZZ ETF
summary: Barstool Sports founder Dave Portnoy announced his backing of the new BUZZ ETF, which is set to debut on the NYSE. This ETF leverages artificial intelligence to analyze social media chatter and track the top 75 large-cap stocks with market capitalizations over $5 billion. Portnoy, who holds an ownership stake in BUZZ, highlighted that the algorithm outperformed the S&P 500 by 40% in 2020.

title: BTCS Drives Near-Term Revenue Growth by Expanding its Ethereum 2.0 Staking Operation to 100 Nodes
summary: BTCS Inc. announced the expansion of its Ethereum 2.0 staking operation to 100 nodes, projecting strong near-term revenue growth. The company has staked 3,200 ETH, valued at nearly $5 Million, and expects 2Q21 revenues to benefit. BTCS also highlighted its history as an early blockchain pioneer and the first U.S. public company to run validator nodes on Ethereum 2.0.

title: Lomiko Moves Forward With La Loutre Graphite Development
summary: Lomiko Metals Inc. is pleased to report progress on its La Loutre Graphite Development Plans, spurred by President Biden's executive order to review U.S. supply chains for key sectors like electric vehicle batteries. The company highlights the recent mining permit approval for its neighbor, Nouveau Monde Graphite, as a positive indicator for its own development in Quebec. The article also discusses the increasing demand for natural flake graphite, particularly in the rapidly growing lithium-ion battery market for EVs, and anticipates a rise in graphite prices due to scarce supply.

title: Powerful House Dem bought cannabis stocks after pushing decriminalization
summary: Rep. John Yarmuth, chairman of the House Budget Committee, purchased up to $60,000 worth of stock in cannabis companies shortly after pushing for the decriminalization of marijuana. While such stock purchases by members of Congress are legal under the STOCK Act if not based on non-public information, Yarmuth's investment coincided with a House bill he co-sponsored to decriminalize cannabis. This event follows other instances of Congressional members or their spouses facing scrutiny for timely investment decisions, including Paul Pelosi's Tesla options and Senators' stock sales prior to the COVID-19 market crash.

title: Silver's Clean Energy Future
summary: This article discusses the crucial and often underestimated role of silver in the global clean energy transition, focusing on its industrial applications in electric vehicles, solar power, and 5G technology. It highlights how growing demand from these sectors, coupled with stagnating supply, points to a highly positive future for silver prices. The author details specific silver uses and projected demand increases in each area, linking them to global decarbonization efforts and government initiatives.

title: For Salesforce, Corporate Growth Means Contributing to Society
summary: Salesforce.com is highlighted for its long-standing commitment to sustainability and social contribution, particularly through its 1-1-1 model. The article discusses how this philosophy, typical of Silicon Valley firms, links corporate growth with addressing societal issues, influencing competitiveness and employee diversity. Salesforce's management also leads by example, integrating SDG goals and regularly evaluating social contributions.

title: What to Do When the Market Is Manic
summary: This article discusses the manic state of the current market, exemplified by events like the GameStop short squeeze, and advises investors on a contrarian approach. It highlights historically stretched valuations and low bond yields as reasons for caution, suggesting investors rebalance portfolios, de-risk fixed income, and practice "doing a whole lot of nothing" by tuning out market noise.

title: Myth-Busting Six Misconceptions about Thematic Investing
summary: This article addresses six common misconceptions about thematic investing, providing data and analysis to clarify the complexities, investor demographics, sector scope, market timing, valuations, and appropriate entry points for thematic investments. It explains Global X's rigorous approach to theme identification, methodology development, and ongoing analysis, highlighting that thematic investing is a long-term strategy that is often misunderstood.

title: Xos to Go Public and Expand Battery-Electric Vehicle Production
summary: Xos Inc., a battery-electric commercial vehicle manufacturer, announced its plan to go public through a business combination with NextGen Acquisition Corp., a SPAC, in a deal valuing the combined entity at $2 billion. The move is expected to raise $575 million in gross proceeds, allowing Xos to expand manufacturing, advance battery technology, and fulfill its 6,000-order backlog. Xos will also partner with Thompson Truck Centers for distribution, aiming to deliver up to 1,000 trucks over the next three years.

title: Battery Maker Enovix to IPO in $1.1 Billion SPAC Deal
summary: Battery maker Enovix has agreed to go public through a business combination with Rodgers Silicon Valley Acquisition Corp. (NASDAQ: RSVA) in a deal valuing Enovix at over $1.1 billion. The transaction, a reverse merger, provides Enovix with approximately $385 million in net cash and is expected to be completed in the second quarter, after which RSVA will be renamed Enovix Corporation and trade as ENVX on the Nasdaq. This move highlights the increasing popularity of SPAC reverse mergers for companies entering the public market.

title: The man charged with keeping SolarEdge’s current flowing
summary: SolarEdge CEO Zvi Lando discusses the company's valuation spike to $18 billion, its expansion into new renewable energy sectors, and the challenge of stepping into the role previously held by the late founder Guy Sella. He also addresses issues like the impact of Elon Musk's Tesla announcement on SolarEdge's stock and the company's commitment to remaining Israeli despite global operations.

title: Elon Musk explains Tesla's $1.5B bitcoin buy
summary: Elon Musk explained that Tesla's decision to buy $1.5 billion of Bitcoin was motivated by the inability to get a return on the company's cash when fiat currency yields negative real interest. He also noted that "Bitcoin is almost as bs as fiat money," agreeing with MicroStrategy CEO Michael Saylor. Tesla plans to accept Bitcoin for car payments and may invest further in digital assets.

Origin Materials, a startup creating sustainable plastic from sawdust, is going public through a SPAC merger with Artius Acquisition in a $1.8 billion deal. The company aims to replace petroleum-based plastics with carbon-negative materials, having already secured partnerships with major brands like Danone, Nestle, and PepsiCo. This transaction is expected to fully fund Origin Materials until it achieves EBITDA and free cash flow positive status by 2025, enabling the construction of its first full-scale commercial plant.

title: First Trust NASDAQ Clean Edge Smart Grid Infrastructure Index Fund (GRID) Stock Price, Quote, News & History
summary: This article provides a comprehensive overview of the First Trust NASDAQ Clean Edge Smart Grid Infrastructure Index Fund (GRID), including its stock price, key statistics, news, and history. It details the fund's holdings, dividend information, and investment policy, explaining its focus on companies involved in smart grid infrastructure. The article also includes FAQs about buying GRID stock, competitors, price targets, and earning schedules.

title: Biden SEC Nominee Gary Gensler Worth as Much as $119 Million
summary: Gary Gensler, President Joe Biden’s nominee for SEC chairman, has disclosed a net worth between $41 million and $119 million. This information came from a government ethics form filed as part of his confirmation process. Gensler's past holdings included Tesla and a pension payout from Goldman Sachs.

title: Bitcoin hits record highs as more companies embrace crypto boom
authors: Olivia Raimonde and Eric Lam and Bloomberg
summary: Bitcoin reached new record highs following announcements from Mastercard Inc. and Bank of New York Mellon Corp. about their increased embrace of cryptocurrencies. This surge is further fueled by Tesla CEO Elon Musk's significant investment in Bitcoin and his public support for cryptocurrencies, attracting more traditional financial institutions to the digital asset class. Despite the growing adoption, critics continue to warn of speculative bubbles and potential misuse.

title: General Motors made $6.4 billion in 2020, despite COVID-19
summary: General Motors reported a profit of $6.43 billion in 2020, despite a 4.5% fall from the previous year, driven by strong demand for trucks and SUVs in the latter half of the year. The company is facing new challenges, including an estimated $1.5 billion to $2 billion loss due to a global semiconductor chip shortage in 2021, but anticipates pretax income of $10 billion to $11 billion for the year. GM also unveiled plans to invest over $7 billion in electric and self-driving vehicles in 2021 as part of its broader push into EVs.

title: Why did Tesla buy bitcoin?
summary: The article discusses Tesla Inc.'s recent investment in bitcoin, highlighting it as a significant move that underscores the increasing acceptance of the digital asset. It raises the central question observers are asking: why did Elon Musk's company make this investment?

title: Tesla (TSLA) Discloses $1.5B Investment in Bitcoin
summary: Tesla, Inc. (TSLA) announced a $1.5 billion investment in Bitcoin and plans to accept Bitcoin payments for its cars, making it the first S&P 500 company to invest in the cryptocurrency. This move follows a change in its investment policy to diversify and maximize returns on cash. The announcement propelled Bitcoin's price to new record highs, reflecting CEO Elon Musk's bullish stance and broader corporate and retail interest in the asset.

title: A Look At 6 ETFs That Cover The Electric Vehicles Trend
summary: This article discusses the accelerating growth of the global electric vehicle (EV) market, highlighting record sales in late 2020 and forecasts for exponential growth from 2022 onwards. It recommends six electric vehicle-related ETFs, four of which cover EVs plus autonomous vehicles (AVs) and two that focus on EVs plus the EV supply chain, including battery makers and miners. The author emphasizes that the real EV boom has just begun and provides sales figures and market share percentages to support this trend.

title: Tesla Bets on Bitcoin in Blue-Chip Boost to Cryptocurrency
summary: Tesla Inc. announced a $1.5 billion investment in Bitcoin and stated its intention to accept the cryptocurrency as a form of payment. This move by the electric-car maker caused Bitcoin prices to surge to a record high. The investment signals a significant endorsement of cryptocurrency from a major blue-chip company.

title: Solar-Powered Charging Stations Are Vital to Promoting EVs
summary: Electrify America has installed 30 new free-to-use, off-grid solar-powered EV charging stations in rural California to promote EV adoption outside major cities. These stations, sourced from Beam Global (formerly Envision Solar), are designed to address the lack of accessible EV infrastructure in rural areas. They provide a reliable charging solution, especially important during grid outages, and aim to reduce range anxiety for potential EV buyers in underserved regions.

title: Tesla founders Martin Eberhard and Marc Tarpenning talk about the early days and bringing on Elon Musk
summary: Tesla founders Martin Eberhard and Marc Tarpenning recount the early days of Tesla, challenging the popular belief that Elon Musk started the company. They discuss building and delivering the first Tesla Roadster, convincing the market about electric cars, and how Elon Musk became involved. Despite later contention with Musk, Eberhard and Tarpenning remain supportive of Tesla's mission and reflect positively on their contributions.

title: Ford posts $1.3 billion loss, ups EV spending, warns of microchip shortage
summary: Ford Motor Co. reported a $1.3 billion loss for 2020 and a $2.8 billion net loss in Q4 due to coronavirus-dampened sales and production disruptions. In response, Ford is increasing its investments in electric and autonomous vehicles to over $22 billion and $7 billion respectively through 2025. The company also warned of further headwinds from a global microchip shortage impacting its most profitable vehicles.

title: The BOTZ Are Coming. But So Are Investing Gains
summary: The Global X Robotics & Artificial Intelligence Thematic ETF (BOTZ) has seen a 60% increase in the past year, driven by companies like Japanese robot maker Fanuc Corp, which boosted its profit forecast due to rising demand for electric cars. BOTZ invests in companies benefiting from robotics and AI adoption, offering high growth potential and exposure to an emerging theme. The growing electric vehicle industry, supported by President Biden's clean energy agenda, provides significant tailwinds for BOTZ and its holdings.

title: Allegro Microsystems sees record revenue in first post-IPO report
summary: Allegro MicroSystems reported record revenue of $164.4 million in its first quarter as a publicly traded company, exceeding expectations and driven largely by a strong rebound in the automotive industry. Automotive revenue accounted for 69% of the total, growing 27% from the prior quarter, with additional growth from industrial revenue and new design wins expected to contribute to future sales. The company's stock, which debuted at $14 a share, closed at $29.02, reflecting investor confidence.

title: Elon Musk admits Tesla has quality problems
summary: Elon Musk has acknowledged Tesla's quality issues, particularly during new model production ramp-ups, confirming criticisms from engineering consultant Sandy Munro. Munro, who initially criticized the Model 3's quality in 2018, noted significant improvements in later production runs. Musk advised customers to either buy a Tesla at the very beginning of a model's run or once production has stabilized to avoid early quality challenges.

title: Nestle, Nvidia, and the Changing Global Equity Markets
summary: The article analyzes the shifting dynamics of global equity markets over the past decade, characterized by the dominance of U.S. technology stocks like Nvidia, in contrast to traditional companies like Nestle. It highlights the increased concentration of U.S. market indexes in technology and consumer cyclical sectors, and discusses current valuation opportunities in non-U.S. markets and value sectors like energy.

title: Nio Stock Could Pull Back To $50 Before Surging To $70 Long-Term
summary: Nio stock experienced a significant surge in the past year due to the electric vehicle (EV) market boom, but a pullback to around $50 is anticipated before a potential long-term rally to $70. The company reported strong Q3 earnings with increased deliveries and positive cash flow, though much of the good news may already be priced into the stock. Investors are advised to consider investing after a dip or use strategies like covered calls to hedge positions given potential volatility and overbought technical indicators.

title: EV firm Microvast to go public through $3 billion merger with SPAC
summary: Electric-vehicle battery maker Microvast announced it would go public through a merger with blank-check company Tuscan Holdings Corp, valuing the combined entity at roughly $3 billion. Microvast will receive $822 million in gross cash proceeds, including a $540 million private investment. The company, founded in 2006, previously powered electric buses for the 2018 Winter Olympic Games.

title: GM looks to sell only emission-free vehicles by 2035
summary: General Motors announced its ambitious plan to become carbon neutral by 2040 and aims to offer only zero-emissions vehicles by 2035. This transition involves a significant investment of $27 billion and a commitment to source 100% renewable energy for its global plants by 2035, accelerating its previous timeline. While the 2035 goal for zero-emissions vehicles is stated as an "aspiration," GM is heavily investing in electric vehicle manufacturing and aligning with new Biden administration climate initiatives.

title: GM’s all-EV plan could shake the energy industry
summary: General Motors announced its plan to stop making gas-powered cars by 2035 and achieve carbon neutrality by 2040, a move expected to transform the electric vehicle market and energy industry. This significant commitment will necessitate dramatic changes to the electric grid and put GM in direct competition with Tesla. The shift also marks a major policy turnaround for GM, which previously sided with the Trump administration against stricter emissions standards.

title: General Motors plans to exclusively offer electric vehicles by 2035
summary: General Motors announced its aspiration to exclusively offer electric vehicles by 2035, ending the production of gasoline- and diesel-powered cars, trucks, and SUVs. This move is part of the company's broader plan to become carbon neutral by 2040 in its global products and operations, and comes a day after President Joe Biden signed executive orders prioritizing climate change. GM also plans to use 100% renewable energy for its U.S. facilities by 2030 and global facilities by 2035.

title: UVXY ETF Is a Good Buy as Earnings and WSB Drive Volatility
summary: The article discusses why the ProShares Ultra VIX Short-Term Futures ETF (UVXY) is a good buy amidst rising market volatility. It explains that the VIX Index, which UVXY tracks, is rising due to the earnings season, fears of a stock market bubble, and the impact of the WallStreetBets Reddit community on certain stocks. The article suggests UVXY as a way to bet on continued volatility given its asset size, liquidity, and expense ratio compared to competitors.

title: STMicroelectronics, Tesla and Apple: what happens when eMobility & 5G collide
summary: This article examines how STMicroelectronics' Q4 2020 results were bolstered by its key relationships with Tesla in e-mobility and Apple in 5G mobile and consumer markets. It highlights STMicroelectronics' dominance in Silicon Carbide (SiC) for electric vehicles, largely driven by Tesla's adoption, and its significant role in CMOS image sensors for Apple's 3D imaging and sensing applications. The article also discusses the company's strategies to address capacity constraints and maintain its market position against competitors.

title: AI fund that's beating S&P 500 has shifted into tech stocks
summary: A machine-guided fund, the AI Powered Equity ETF (AIEQ), has significantly shifted its holdings into technology stocks, now comprising over 37% of its portfolio. This move comes as the fund continues to outperform the S&P 500 Index, having risen 12% this year compared to the S&P 500's nearly 3% gain. The fund has also halved its industrial exposure and doubled its position in Tesla Inc., while significantly reducing its Apple Inc. holdings.

title: Baron Partners' Huge Tesla Stake Leads to Downgrade
summary: Baron Partners fund has been downgraded to a Morningstar Analyst Rating of Neutral from Bronze due to its highly concentrated stake in Tesla, which grew to 47% of net assets. Despite lead manager Ron Baron selling some shares and reducing overall fund leverage, the stock's meteoric rise disproportionately influenced the fund's risk profile, highlighting lax risk controls. This concentration, while leading to significant returns in 2020, introduces substantial volatility and risk.

title: Which Chinese EV Stocks Are Worth Betting On
summary: Despite a slow start to the year for oil prices due to COVID-19 concerns, the EV sector continues its strong performance, with Chinese EV companies showing significant gains. This article highlights three Chinese EV manufacturers—XPeng Motors, NIO Limited, and Li Auto—as promising investment opportunities, detailing their market performance, financial health, and innovative strategies.

title: ARK Investment Plans to Augment Offerings with a Space ETF
summary: ARK Investment, led by Cathie Wood, plans to launch a new actively managed space-focused ETF to invest in domestic and foreign companies engaged in space exploration and innovation. This follows the firm's significant success with its existing disruptive technology ETFs. The article discusses potential holdings like Virgin Galactic and defense contractors, and the broader impact on mainstream investments in the space sector, especially considering a potential indirect exposure to SpaceX IPO.

title: Tesla launches a standalone solar inverter, challenging Enphase and SolarEdge for market share
summary: Tesla has introduced its first standalone solar inverter, available in 3.8kW and 7.8kW capacities, featuring multiple maximum power point trackers. This move positions Tesla as a direct competitor to Enphase and SolarEdge in the inverter market, allowing the company more control over the cost of its solar systems and offering complete product verticality for solar installations.

title: Feeling Bullish? Amplify Your Investment with the SPXL ETF
summary: This article discusses the Direxion Daily S&P 500® Bull 3X Shares ETF (SPXL) as a tool for bullish traders to amplify investment in the S&P 500 amidst economic recovery and a lack of short interest in ETFs. It highlights SPXL's 25% jump over three months, reflecting growing investor confidence in a stock market recovery. The article also notes how falling short interest indicates increasing faith in a stock rally and diminishing concerns about market downside in the near future.

title: The bull chasing the bandit: Webull takes on Robinhood
summary: This article discusses how Webull, a Chinese-owned digital brokerage, is gaining traction in the US market as a competitor to Robinhood. Webull differentiates itself with a more professional platform, in-depth data, desktop support, and live customer service, appealing to seasoned investors while Robinhood faces regulatory challenges and criticism for its "gamification" of investing. Despite being Chinese-owned, Webull has largely flown under the regulatory radar due to its proactive government relations and low-key marketing strategy.

title: Digital Realty moves headquarters to low-tax Texas
summary: Digital Realty, a data center REIT, has moved its corporate headquarters from San Francisco, California, to Austin, Texas, following other tech companies like Oracle and HPE. This move is influenced by Texas's lower corporate tax rate of one percent compared to California's 8.84 percent, as well as the absence of individual income tax and a lower cost of living. CEO A. William Stein and several executives have already relocated, with the company maintaining a significant presence in the Bay Area while expanding its office space and data center footprint in Texas.

title: Tesla (TSLA) launches its own solar power inverter
summary: Tesla (TSLA) has launched its own solar power inverter, completing its home solar offering alongside the Powerwall and solar roof tiles. This move leverages Tesla's power electronics expertise to integrate its solar ecosystem further, offering models with 3.8 kW and 7.6 kW power outputs and 97.5% efficiency. The new inverter features Wi-Fi, Ethernet, cellular connectivity with over-the-air updates, and is designed to integrate with the Tesla Powerwall and app.

title: Chinese driverless car start-up WeRide raises $310 million in funding as competition heats up
summary: Chinese driverless car start-up WeRide has successfully raised $310 million in a new funding round, led by Yutong Group, as it intensifies its efforts to commercialize its autonomous driving technology. This funding round follows a similar cash injection into rival Pony.ai and highlights the fierce competition within China's driverless car market, which also includes major players like Baidu and Didi. WeRide plans to launch trial operations for "Mini Robobuses" soon and anticipates large-scale robotaxi applications and profitability within the next few years.

title: Weak lithium prices could slow EV revolution, Albemarle warns
summary: Albemarle, a leading lithium producer, has warned that low lithium prices could impede the expansion of supply needed for electric vehicle (EV) batteries, potentially slowing the EV revolution. The company stated that prices need to increase by at least 10% to make new expansions financially viable, despite a projected demand increase that could outstrip supply significantly by 2025. Albemarle is also exploring new production methods, such as extracting lithium from clay reserves, in anticipation of growing demand.

title: Carmaker Nio is 'well positioned' to capture a lot of China's electric vehicle market, analyst says
summary: An analyst believes that Chinese carmaker Nio is well-positioned to secure a significant share of China's electric vehicle market, despite competition from Tesla. Nio recently unveiled its first sedan, the et7, featuring self-driving technology it claims surpasses Tesla's, and is establishing itself as a premium EV brand. While homegrown EV makers saw delivery surges, their numbers still trail Tesla's, the current market leader.

title: TI Unveils Wireless Battery Management System
summary: Texas Instruments (TI) has introduced a wireless battery management system (BMS) for electric vehicles, aimed at simplifying electrical architectures, reducing weight by eliminating bulky cabling, and improving reliability. The system boasts high network availability and accuracy, with the potential to significantly reduce manufacturing costs and car weight. Industry experts like Asif Anwar from Strategy Analytics believe that wireless BMS will be a growing trend in the EV market due to its flexibility, lower complexity, and cost-effectiveness.

title: These Hot Stocks Made This American Century's Best 2020 U.S. Diversified Stock Fund
summary: The American Century Focused Dynamic Growth Fund (ACFSX) was the top-performing U.S. diversified stock fund in 2020, up 73.63% compared to the S&P 500's 18.40%. The fund achieved this success by investing in high-growth companies like Amazon, Facebook, Alphabet, Tesla, Square, DocuSign, Nike, Chipotle Mexican Grill, and Chegg, focusing on those with high sustainable growth rates and strong fundamentals, consistent with CAN SLIM principles. Its strong performance has earned it repeated IBD Best Mutual Funds Awards.

title: Tesla market value crosses $800 billion for the first time
summary: Tesla Inc.'s market capitalization surpassed $800 billion for the first time, driven by a significant jump in its stock price on Friday. This surge has also propelled CEO Elon Musk to become the world's richest man, surpassing Amazon's Jeff Bezos. The company's valuation now places it among Wall Street's most valuable firms, despite its production volume being a fraction of larger automotive rivals.

title: Albemarle to double capacity at Silver Peak lithium brine operation
summary: Albemarle Corp announced plans to invest $30-$50 million to double the production capacity at its Silver Peak, Nevada lithium facility by 2025, utilizing its brine water rights. The company will also explore clay resources and new technologies for lithium production in Nevada, aiming to meet the growing domestic demand for lithium from the electric vehicle market. This expansion reinforces Albemarle's commitment to optimizing its US lithium resources for greater security and sustainability of the North American supply chain.

title: Rock star chip designer Jim Keller joins Tenstorrent
summary: Legendary computer chip designer Jim Keller has joined Toronto startup Tenstorrent Inc. as its new president and chief technology officer. Keller, known for his work at AMD, Apple, and Tesla, will guide Tenstorrent in its mission to create a machine learning training chip that utilizes software to optimize computing power and increase efficiency, challenging established players like Intel, AMD, and Nvidia.

title: Up 120% in 2020, Can the LIT Lithium ETF Hold Its Charge in 2021?
summary: The Global X Lithium & Battery Tech ETF (LIT) surged over 120% in 2020, driven by the growth in electric vehicle demand. With Tesla as a top holding and its supplier CATL expanding production, the article explores whether LIT can maintain its momentum in 2021. Technical indicators show the fund is overbought, but a MACD filter suggests a potential buying opportunity.

title: Low Inflation? Asset Prices at Record Highs Suggests Otherwise
summary: Frank Holmes argues that official low inflation figures do not reflect the reality of soaring asset and commodity prices. He highlights significant increases in gold, Bitcoin, food, lumber, and copper prices, attributing these rises to massive government stimulus and easy monetary policy. Holmes suggests that investors should be critical of media biases and consider holding hard assets as stores of value given concerns about currency debasement.

title: Ford, Mahindra call off auto joint venture
summary: Ford Motor Co. and Mahindra and Mahindra Ltd. have called off their automotive joint venture due to challenges arising from the COVID-19 pandemic and changes in the global economy, causing both companies to re-evaluate their capital allocation priorities. The decision was made as the deadline to finalize the venture expired, though Ford stated its independent operations in India will continue, and Mahindra affirmed no impact on its product plan.

title: Fluence, the energy storage systems developer, is now worth over $1 billion after QIA investment
summary: Fluence, an energy storage systems developer, has achieved a valuation of over $1 billion following a $125 million investment from the Qatar Investment Authority (QIA). The company, a joint venture between AES Corp. and Siemens, plans to use the new capital to expand its software and services offerings and may explore public markets for additional liquidity in the future. AES and Siemens will remain majority shareholders, each holding a 44% stake.
banner_image: Jose A. Bernat Bacete/Moment / Getty Images

title: Like Tesla's Elon Musk, the BOSS ETF Knows Best
summary: The article highlights the Global X Founder-Run Companies ETF (BOSS) and its strong performance, generating over 50% year-to-date gains. It explains that BOSS invests in companies where the founder or co-founder serves as CEO, citing Tesla as one of its top holdings. The ETF aims to provide exposure to U.S. mid- and large-cap companies led by their founders, offering potential alpha through long-term value creation and entrepreneurialism, while providing ETF efficiency.

title: Like Elon Musk, the BOSS ETF Knows Best
summary: The Global X Founder-Run Companies ETF (BOSS) has achieved over 50% year-to-date gains, outperforming many investments, much like Elon Musk's companies. The ETF invests in U.S. companies led by their founders or co-founders, including Tesla among its top holdings, highlighting the success potential of founder-led businesses. This approach aims to capitalize on founders' long-term value creation and entrepreneurial drive for alpha potential.

title: Alibaba's Only Stock Split Was Out of the Ordinary
summary: Alibaba Group Holding Ltd. executed an eight-for-one stock split on July 15, 2019, to increase the number of available shares and raise capital for growth. This split coincided with a secondary listing on a Hong Kong exchange, which diluted shares but helped Alibaba secure the largest IPO listing of 2019. Despite its significance, the secondary listing caused the stock split to go largely unnoticed by American investors.

title: Elon Musk says had once reached out to Apple for acquiring Tesla
summary: Elon Musk revealed he tried to discuss a potential acquisition of Tesla by Apple during Tesla's "darkest days of the Model 3 program," but Apple CEO Tim Cook refused the meeting. This happened as Apple is reportedly looking to produce a passenger vehicle by 2024 with new battery technology, which Musk commented on. Tesla has since overcome its production issues and recently joined the S&P 500.

title: The Soaring Stock Index You’ve Never Heard Of - WSJ
summary: The article discusses the S&P Completion Index, a lesser-known stock index that significantly outperformed the S&P 500 largely due to Tesla's presence. Tesla, which was the biggest stock in the Completion Index, has now moved to the S&P 500, impacting the performance of both indices and related ETFs. This shift has already led to a decline in Tesla's stock and changes in the performance of funds tracking these indices.

title: Rare-Earth Elements: Will China Continue Its Market Dominance?
summary: China currently dominates the global market for rare-earth elements, essential for various high-tech and military applications, leveraging decades of strategic investment. The article explores whether recent US efforts and alliances with countries like Japan and Australia can challenge China's market dominance, particularly given China's "Made in China 2025" initiative and temporary pandemic-induced price fluctuations. Despite challenges, rare-earth prices are expected to recover, and investment opportunities exist through ETFs like VanEck Vectors Rare Earth/Strategic Metals ETF (NYSEArca: REMX).

title: A Backdoor Electric Vehicle Play with Tesla Entering the S&P 500
summary: This article highlights the ALPS Disruptive Technologies ETF (DTEC) as a "backdoor" investment opportunity in the electric vehicle (EV) space, particularly with Tesla joining the S&P 500. DTEC provides exposure to energy storage and smart grid technologies, which are crucial for the burgeoning EV landscape. The ETF offers leverage to the EV theme through its clean energy and smart grid components, presenting a long-term growth opportunity as these technologies are increasingly integrated.

title: Tesla stock slides on first day in S&P 500
summary: Tesla's shares fell over 6% on its first day in the S&P 500, influenced by concerns about a new Covid-19 variant, disappointment over a stimulus deal, and news of Apple's self-driving car plans. The drop followed a significant pre-inclusion surge, with analysts noting similar post-inclusion declines for other high-profile S&P 500 additions. Analysts also voiced concerns about the stock's valuation and increasing competition in the EV market.

title: The secret Tesla reveals about index investing
summary: Tesla's delayed inclusion in the S&P 500 Index, despite its early market capitalization, highlights a critical difference in index construction: objective, market-cap based selection versus subjective, committee-driven choices. Founder Chuck Schwab argues for transparent, rules-based indexes like the Schwab 1000 Index that prioritize market wisdom to better capture fast-growing companies earlier. The article emphasizes that how one chooses to "buy the market" via an index significantly impacts investment outcomes.

title: Tesla's Elon Musk asks about converting "large transactions" to bitcoin
summary: Elon Musk, CEO of Tesla, inquired on Twitter about the feasibility of converting significant portions of Tesla's balance sheet into Bitcoin. This query came in response to MicroStrategy CEO Michael Saylor's suggestion that such a move could greatly benefit Tesla shareholders, leading to an exchange where Saylor offered to share his experience with large Bitcoin purchases. The discussion coincided with Bitcoin's recent surge past $20,000 and Tesla's upcoming entry into the S&P 500 index.

title: Tesla shares jump to record high ahead of S&P 500 debut
summary: Shares of Tesla Inc. surged to a record high on Friday, driven by anticipation of its inclusion in the S&P 500 index. The electric carmaker, led by Elon Musk, will become the most valuable company ever admitted to the benchmark, accounting for over 1% of its value. This event prompted index-tracking funds to buy an estimated $85 billion worth of Tesla shares, influencing significant trading volume and price movements.

title: Bill Ford: ‘Our Family Name Is on the Line Every Day’ (Published 2020)
summary: Bill Ford, chairman of Ford Motor Company and great-grandson of Henry Ford, discusses the challenges facing the auto industry, including the COVID-19 pandemic and the rise of electric vehicles. He highlights Ford's response to these issues, such as temporarily halting production and developing electric models. Despite intense competition, particularly from Tesla, Ford expresses optimism about the future, emphasizing new electric vehicle introductions and a partnership with Volkswagen for self-driving cars.

title: Why Oracle Made the Big Move From California to the Lone Star State
summary: Oracle relocated its headquarters from Redwood City, California, to Austin, Texas, in December 2020. The company cited a desire to provide its employees with more flexibility and benefit from Texas's business-friendly climate, including no personal or corporate income tax. This move follows a trend of other companies leaving California for Texas due to the latter's lower cost of living and doing business, skilled workforce, and robust infrastructure.

title: Billionaire's Company Moves to Texas — But He'll Work from His Private $300M Hawaii Island Instead
summary: Oracle, co-founded by Larry Ellison, announced its corporate headquarters are moving from California to Austin, Texas. However, Ellison himself will not be relocating to Texas, revealing he has moved to his private $300 million Hawaiian island of Lanai and will work remotely from there. This move is part of a larger trend of tech companies relocating to Texas, drawn by its business climate and lower taxes.

title: Oracle to move HQ from Silicon Valley to Texas, but Ellison says aloha
summary: Oracle Corporation is relocating its corporate headquarters from Silicon Valley to Austin, Texas, to offer employees more flexibility regarding their work location and arrangements. Despite this move, founder Larry Ellison has personally moved to Hawaii and will work remotely from there. This decision aligns with a broader trend of tech companies rethinking traditional office setups and relocating operations, with other prominent figures like Elon Musk also moving to Texas.

title: Oracle moving its HQ from California to Texas, like HP Enterprise, Tesla CEO
authors: Dallas Morning News and Dom Difurio
summary: Oracle Corp. is moving its headquarters from Redwood City, California, to Austin, Texas, becoming the latest tech giant to leave Silicon Valley. The company cited a more flexible employee work location policy and positioning for growth as reasons for the move. This follows similar relocations by HP Enterprise and Tesla CEO Elon Musk to Texas, and Palantir Technologies to Denver, highlighting a trend of companies exiting California.

title: Even More Tech Firms Are Leaving Silicon Valley for Texas
summary: Hewlett Packard Enterprise (HPE) is relocating its headquarters from Silicon Valley to Houston, Texas, following a trend of tech firms moving to states with more favorable business climates and lower costs. The article highlights that Texas offers significant financial advantages, such as no state income tax, lower housing costs, and a better business tax climate compared to California, attracting both companies and individuals like Elon Musk. This shift is prompting speculation that other major tech companies, such as Tesla, might follow suit, further solidifying Texas as an emerging tech hub.

title: Oracle joins Tesla founder Elon Musk and Hewlett Packard in relocating to Texas
authors: - FRANCES MULRANEY FOR DAILYMAIL.COM and WIRES
summary: Tech giant Oracle announced its headquarters are moving from Silicon Valley to Austin, Texas, following similar moves by Tesla's Elon Musk and Hewlett Packard Enterprise. This relocation is part of a growing exodus of companies from high-cost California to Texas, driven by factors like lower cost of living, no state income tax, and clashes with California officials over COVID-19 restrictions. Texas Governor Greg Abbott welcomed the announcement, highlighting the state's attractiveness for business and opportunity.

title: Oracle says it will move HQ from Silicon Valley to Texas
summary: Oracle announced its decision to move its headquarters from Redwood City, California, to Austin, Texas. The tech giant will allow many employees to choose their office locations or work from home. This move is considered a significant win for Texas, which has been actively recruiting companies from California.

title: Oracle moves HQ to Austin from Calif., but don't count Nashville out
summary: Oracle Corp. is relocating its corporate headquarters from California to Austin, Texas, while also planning to expand its network of U.S. office hubs. This move comes as the tech giant had been considering Nashville since early 2019, suggesting a broader strategy beyond just one new location. The company cites a "more modern approach to work" as the reason for the relocation.

title: Oracle moving from California to Texas, joins Tesla, Hewlett Packard
summary: Oracle has announced it is moving its corporate headquarters from California to Austin, Texas, following similar moves by Tesla and Hewlett Packard Enterprise. The company cited a new flexible employee work location policy and the belief that the move best positions Oracle for growth and offers more flexibility for its personnel. This trend suggests a growing disillusionment among corporations with California's business environment.

title: Oracle is the latest Silicon Valley company to head for the hills — of Austin
summary: Oracle Corp. announced its decision to move its corporate headquarters from Redwood City, California, to Austin, Texas, following a trend of companies and executives relocating from Silicon Valley. This move aligns with a new flexible employee work location policy and positions Oracle for growth in a business-friendly state. Governor Greg Abbott lauded the relocation, emphasizing Texas's appeal for business, jobs, and opportunity, with other tech giants like Tesla and HP Enterprise also making similar moves or expanding in the state.

title: Lithium mining to grow in Nevada
summary: The Bureau of Land Management has released the final environmental impact statement for Lithium Nevada Corp.'s proposed lithium mine at Thacker Pass, marking a significant step towards its development. This project, along with another in Esmeralda County by Ioneer Ltd., aims to boost domestic lithium supply which is critical for rechargeable batteries in various growing technology sectors. The mine is expected to create 1,000 construction jobs and 300 operational jobs, aligning with a federal strategy to secure critical mineral supplies.

title: Four Companies Leading the Rise of Lithium & Battery Technology
summary: This article highlights four key companies driving the growth of the lithium and battery technology ecosystem: Ganfeng Lithium, Panasonic, Livent, and Contemporary Amperex Technology Limited (CATL). It details their roles in the supply chain, from lithium mining and processing to battery manufacturing, and their strategic importance in the electric vehicle revolution. The piece underscores the increasing demand for lithium-ion batteries and the companies' efforts to innovate and expand to meet future market needs.

title: Tesla announces second $5bn share sale in three months
summary: Tesla announced its second $5 billion capital raise in three months, capitalizing on a significant rally in its shares this year, which pushed its market value above $600 billion. The move comes as demand for Tesla shares is fueled by its upcoming inclusion in the S&P 500 index, despite some analysts warning about a potential stock bubble. This capital raise aims to support the company's expansion plans, including new factories and vehicle lines.

title: Adobe Stock Looks Like a Buy Before Its Earnings Release
summary: Adobe stock has gained over 47% YTD and is considered a potential buy before its Q4 earnings release on Dec. 9. Despite a recent cool-down from its 52-week highs, the company's consistent revenue growth and attractive PEG ratio suggest it could be a long-term investment, especially if positive earnings and guidance are provided. Analysts anticipate a median target price of $560, indicating a 15.2% premium over current prices.

title: Tesla says Black people hold just 4% of its U.S. leadership roles
summary: Tesla's first U.S. diversity report reveals that Black employees constitute only 4% of its American leadership roles and 10% of its total U.S. workforce. Women hold 17% of leadership roles and 21% of the overall workforce. The company acknowledged the lack of representation and committed to increasing diversity, including recruiting at Historically Black Colleges and Universities.

title: Chasing the hydrogen dream: Ballard on quest to transform long-haul transportation
summary: Ballard Power Systems, a Canadian pioneer in hydrogen fuel cell technology, is experiencing a resurgence in investor interest and market capitalization after a tumultuous history. The company, which specializes in fuel cells for heavy-duty transportation, is banking on global demand for clean energy and government initiatives to drive widespread adoption, despite past setbacks and competition from battery electric vehicles. With strategic partnerships and a focus on automation to reduce costs, Ballard aims for significant revenue growth from China, Europe, and North America in the coming years.

title: “Stocks only go up, $TSLA to the moon” — Elon Musk (probably)
summary: This article discusses the psychological biases that influence stock trading, using Tesla ($TSLA) as an example. It highlights how cognitive pitfalls like hindsight bias and self-attribution bias lead even professional traders to make irrational decisions and overestimate their abilities. The author questions the implications of easy access to financial markets for the general public, given these inherent human biases.

title: Former Tesla employee to pay $400,000 to end lawsuit over tips to reporters
summary: A former Tesla employee, Martin Tripp, has agreed to pay Tesla Inc. $400,000 to settle a lawsuit in which the company accused him of leaking trade secrets and making false claims to reporters. Tripp had previously characterized himself as a whistleblower exposing production inefficiencies, but the settlement states he did not contest Tesla's claims of trade secret theft. His counterclaims against Tesla were reportedly funded by a short seller of Tesla stock.

title: Exclusive: LG Chem to double China battery capacity to meet Tesla demand -sources
summary: South Korea's LG Chem plans to more than double the production capacity of battery cells at its China plant, primarily to meet the growing demand from Tesla Inc. This expansion signifies LG Chem's increased role in Tesla's global supply chain, with cells from China and Korea also destined for Tesla factories in Germany and the United States. The move comes as Tesla aggressively expands production and seeks to secure sufficient battery supplies from its partners.

title: Ex-Tesla employee agrees to pay $400K over claims he stole trade secrets
summary: A former Tesla Inc. employee, Martin Tripp, has agreed to pay Tesla $400,000 to settle a lawsuit claiming he stole trade secrets. Tripp also acknowledged that his counterclaims against Tesla were funded by short seller Cable Car Capital LLC. The settlement includes an additional $25,000 payment for violating a protective order and an agreement to destroy all acquired documents.

title: Nikola, General Motors ink hydrogen truck deal
summary: Nikola and General Motors have finalized a revamped non-binding Memorandum of Understanding (MOU) for GM to provide fuel cell technology for Nikola's commercial trucks. The new agreement focuses on the integration of GM’s Hydrotec fuel-cell technology into Nikola’s Class 7 and 8 trucks, specifically omitting the previous $2 billion equity stake and GM-led development of the Nikola Badger pickup. This development follows a period of scrutiny for Nikola after a short-seller report and subsequent investigations by the SEC and DOJ.

title: Tesla zooms past Buffett's Berkshire to become 6th-largest US company
summary: Tesla's market capitalization surged to $555.24 billion, surpassing Warren Buffett's Berkshire Hathaway to become the sixth-largest U.S. company. This rapid increase was driven by news of its inclusion in the S&P 500 and a 600% gain in share price this year. Analysts have raised price targets for Tesla, citing strong demand and the potential for increased vehicle deliveries.

title: Tesla issues two recalls covering 9,500 U.S. vehicles - NHTSA
summary: Tesla Inc. is issuing two recalls affecting approximately 9,500 vehicles. One recall concerns 9,136 Model X cars from 2016 for roof trim that may separate, while the other involves 401 2020 Model Y vehicles due to improperly tightened bolts connecting the front upper control arm. The company states it is unaware of any accidents or injuries related to these issues.

title: Tesla's upcoming S&P 500 debut fuels 'crazy' trading volume
summary: Tesla's upcoming inclusion in the S&P 500 in December has led to a significant surge in its stock price and "crazy" trading volume. Investors, including institutional managers and retail traders, are buying shares ahead of index funds that will be forced to acquire over $50 billion worth of Tesla stock. This has made Tesla one of the most heavily traded companies on U.S. exchanges, surpassing Amazon and Apple combined in recent sessions.

title: The Top Reasons Li Auto Stock Could Accelerate to Higher Highs
summary: This article discusses the reasons why Li Auto stock is poised for significant growth, potentially reaching $60 per share. It highlights the booming electric vehicle market, strong earnings performance by Li Auto, and positive analyst ratings, all contributing to its upward momentum. The author suggests that global government support and increasing demand will continue to drive EV-related stocks higher.

title: Tesla market value crosses $500 billion in meteoric rally
summary: Tesla Inc. has surpassed a market value of $500 billion, driven by investor enthusiasm ahead of its S&P 500 debut and a more than 500% surge this year. The electric carmaker's stock rose nearly 5%, making it Wall Street's seventh most valuable company, with index funds and actively managed funds expected to buy billions more in shares. This rally highlights the growing investor confidence in EV manufacturers, also boosted by President-elect Joe Biden's focus on clean energy.

title: Tesla’s Mission: Accelerating World’s Transition to Sustainable Energy
summary: This article delves into Tesla's mission of accelerating the world's transition to sustainable energy, examining Elon Musk's vision and the company's disruptive impact across various sectors. It analyzes Tesla's strategy, including its focus on R&D for EVs, energy, batteries, AI, and software, highlighting how these elements create a competitive ecosystem. The piece also discusses Musk's controversial public persona and its role in Tesla's marketing and stock market performance.

title: GM vs. Ford: What their EV split reveals
summary: General Motors and Ford are pursuing differing strategies for electrification, with GM aggressively investing in EVs and battery production, aiming to be a top seller, while Ford takes a more cautious approach, focusing on a few key models and buying batteries from suppliers. GM plans to invest $27 billion in EVs by 2025 and roll out 30 models, including significant battery advancements, whereas Ford will focus on making its EV endeavor profitable through services and targeted vehicle electrification. Experts believe GM's ambitious plans could significantly impact the U.S. auto industry and the global EV market.

title: G.M. Accelerates Its Ambitions for Electric Vehicles (Published 2020)
summary: General Motors announced an accelerated push into electric vehicles, significantly increasing its investment to $27 billion by 2025 and planning to introduce 30 electric models globally by that year. This strategic shift aims to challenge Tesla's dominance in the EV market and attract investors. Mary T. Barra, G.M.'s chief executive, emphasized that EVs are central to the company's growth and shareholder value.

title: General Motors launches into auto insurance
summary: General Motors (GM) has launched its own insurance unit, OnStar Insurance, which uses telematics data from OnStar-equipped vehicles to offer personalized premiums based on driving habits. The new service, along with OnStar Insurance Services, aims to provide comprehensive automobile security and will initially pilot in Arizona with GM employees before expanding to the public in early 2021. This move positions GM as a disruptor in the auto insurance industry, similar to Tesla.

title: GM is increasing spending to $27 billion to make 40% of its cars electric by 2025
summary: General Motors announced a significant increase in its electric vehicle (EV) spending to $27 billion through 2025, aiming to have 40% of its US models be electric by that year. The company is accelerating development and production of EVs, including the Cadillac Lyriq, and expects second-generation Ultium batteries to be cheaper and more efficient. This push is driven by regulatory pressure, competition from EV startups like Tesla, Lucid, and Fisker, and internal engineering progress.

title: Why climate change is getting the attention of world's wealthy investors
summary: Wealthy investors are increasingly focusing on climate change as a fundamental investment theme, driven by significant economic opportunities rather than political beliefs. Billionaires like Jeff Bezos and Elon Musk are leading the way, but this trend is also widespread among ultra-wealthy investors who see renewables becoming cheaper and creating vast capital investment opportunities. Despite concerns about short-term political uncertainties or the intermittency of renewable energy, experts believe the investment case for green technologies and addressing climate risk in portfolios remains strong, with potential for comparable performance to traditional investments.

title: GM went public 10 years ago, and it’s been a mediocre investment — here’s how it can improve for the next 10
summary: General Motors' stock performance over the past decade has been "mediocre" with a 5.2% annualized total return, significantly underperforming the S&P 500. Despite a sound balance sheet and consistently beating earnings expectations, GM's market value trails competitors like Tesla due to investor perception. The company is now hoping investments in electric vehicles (EVs) and autonomous technology will re-rate its stock and lead to stronger performance in the next 10 years.

title: Who’s a Very Good Pandemic Business? Chewy Is. Oh, Yes It Is
summary: Chewy (CHWY) has experienced phenomenal growth in 2020, becoming a top pandemic business as pet care surged. CEO Sumit Singh's 2019 compensation of $108.2 million placed him among the highest-paid executives, despite the company not yet achieving profitability in its nine years of existence. This success highlights the booming online pet supply market.

title: General Motors aims to commercialize battery, fuel cell technologies, be automaker of the future
summary: General Motors is aiming to commercialize its Ultium battery and Hydrotec fuel-cell technologies to become a leading tech-savvy automaker. This strategy is driven by the need for profitability in a rapidly changing automotive landscape, with a focus on green powertrains and an expanding electric vehicle market. GM plans to leverage its industrial scale, build new revenue streams, and position itself as a key technology player in the future of transportation, including significant investments and partnerships.

title: Tesla to join S&P 500, spark epic index fund trade
summary: Tesla Inc (TSLA.O) is set to join the S&P 500 in December, a decision that caused its shares to jump 14% and will trigger an estimated $51 billion trade by index funds. With a stock market value over $400 billion, Tesla will be one of the largest additions to the index in the last decade, requiring index funds to adjust their portfolios significantly. The inclusion comes despite concerns from some investors about Tesla's high valuation and corporate governance.

title: Tesla shares up 12 percent as automaker zooms to join S&P 500
summary: Tesla Inc. is set to join the S&P 500 in December, triggering a massive $51 billion trade as index funds are forced to buy the electric car maker’s shares. The company's shares surged 12 percent after the announcement, marking a significant win for CEO Elon Musk and its shareholders. Tesla's inclusion will make it one of the largest weight additions to the S&P 500 in the last decade, with a market capitalization over $380 billion.

title: |Tesla to Join S&P 500 Next Month as Largest-Ever New Member
summary: |Tesla Inc. (TSLA) is set to join the S&P 500 index on December 21, becoming the largest company ever added to the gauge. This announcement follows months of speculation and a significant rally in the stock this year, elevating the electric vehicle pioneer's market value to nearly $390 billion. Tesla's inclusion is expected to greatly broaden its investor base and make it one of the index's most influential constituents.

title: My Top 2 Battery Metal Miners For Lithium, Cobalt, Nickel; 1 For Graphite And Manganese
summary: This article discusses the impending super-cycle for battery metal miners, driven by rapidly increasing EV sales and Tesla's aggressive battery production forecasts. The author identifies their top two preferred miners for lithium, cobalt, and nickel, and one each for graphite and manganese, based on quality and growth potential. The piece highlights predictions of an 86x increase in global battery production by 2030, necessitating a significant surge in demand for these key metals.

title: Arent Fox Helps Tesla Bring Tesla Tequila to Market
summary: Arent Fox advised Tesla on the legal aspects of launching its own brand of liquor, "Tesla Tequila," which sold out almost instantly. The product is described as a premium 100% agave añejo tequila aged in French oak barrels, packaged in a distinctive lightning bolt-shaped bottle. The Arent Fox team, led by Anthony V. Lupo, included Steven A. Cohen, Luna M. Samman, Michael T. Kelly, and Dan Jasnow.

title: General Motors to add 3,000 jobs focused on electric vehicles
summary: General Motors plans to hire 3,000 new employees, primarily focused on software development for electric vehicles, by the first quarter of 2021. Many of these positions will be remote as GM accelerates its EV strategy, aiming to offer at least 20 new electric vehicles globally by 2023. The hiring initiative supports GM's commitment to leading in EVs and enhancing customer experience through advanced software.

title: Nio Stock Deserves a Spot In Long-Term Portfolios
summary: The article argues that Nio (NYSE: NIO) stock is a strong long-term investment, driven by the expanding Chinese EV market and Nio's impressive growth. Despite its significant year-to-date appreciation of over 900%, the author suggests that any dips in the stock, particularly towards the $30-level, should be seen as buying opportunities for long-term investors. Nio's strong delivery numbers and its innovative approach to the user experience in the automotive industry position it well for continued growth.

title: Tesla launches $250 tequila online, quickly 'out of stock'
summary: Tesla Inc launched its own brand of tequila, "Tesla Tequila," priced at $250 a bottle, which quickly sold out online. The product, initially conceived as a joke by CEO Elon Musk, faced regulatory hurdles in Mexico but is now certified and produced by Destiladora del Valle de Tequila. This move continues Musk's trend of selling quirky, limited-edition products.

title: Toyota-backed startup Pony.ai raises $267 mln in latest fundraising
summary: Pony.ai, a self-driving startup backed by Toyota, announced it raised $267 million in the initial phase of its latest fundraising round, valuing the company at $5.3 billion. This investment, led by Ontario Teachers' Pension Plan Board, aims to boost its presence in the United States and China and explore mobility services with Toyota. The company plans to use the funds for technology development and fleet expansion, including autonomous trucks.

title: Ink-Stained Wretches: The Battle for the Soul of Digital Freedom Taking Place Inside Your Printer
summary: This article criticizes HP's aggressive business practices in the printer industry, detailing how the company has shifted from innovation to exploiting customers through printer ink policies. It highlights HP's conversion of a "Free ink for life" plan to a paid subscription and its use of "security updates" to block third-party ink cartridges. The piece argues that HP's tactics reflect a broader trend among "smart" gadget manufacturers to redefine ownership and restrict user choice.

title: ARK Invest's Cathie Wood Reveals Her Successful Playbook
summary: Cathie Wood, founder and CEO of ARK Invest, shares her "playbook" for success, emphasizing thinking big, focusing on innovation, and embracing disruption. Her firm's impressive growth and the performance of its ARK Innovation ETF (ARKK) demonstrate the effectiveness of her approach, which includes conviction in ideas, continuous brainstorming, curiosity, and collaboration with innovators. Wood also highlights the importance of making your own opportunities and the value of mentorship.

title: Tesla microgrids spread as U.S. grid ‘gets worse and worse’
summary: Tesla is rapidly expanding its microgrid operations, with over 120 already in operation and plans for 1,000 in the near future, as the U.S. power grid experiences increasing instability from climate-related events. The company, known for its modular and cloud-managed systems, is part of a larger trend of companies entering the microgrid space to meet growing demand for resilient, clean energy solutions. Experts highlight the shift towards simpler, modular microgrids, especially combining solar and battery storage, as a key development driven by grid vulnerabilities and new regulatory support.

title: Tesla Insurance could potentially be America's biggest auto insurer
summary: Tesla Insurance, the automotive manufacturer's insurance division, could become one of the largest auto insurers in the US, according to CEO Elon Musk. He suggested that the insurance unit might comprise 30% to 40% of the entire car business's value. This valuation would potentially make Tesla Insurance larger than current top insurer State Farm, attributing its competitive edge to a superior feedback loop and telematics integration.

title: Lordstown Motors pushes forward with Endurance truck
summary: Lordstown Motors Corp. secured financial backing through a merger with DiamondPeak Holdings Corp., making it a publicly traded company. This deal provides $675 million to fund the production of its electric Endurance truck, which CEO Steve Burns aims to deliver by next September. The company is targeting fleet customers with its $52,500 Endurance truck, emphasizing cost-effectiveness and unique features like a four-wheel drive hub-motor system and onboard power export.

title: Exclusive: GM, Ford knew about climate change 50 years ago
summary: A monthslong investigation by E&E News reveals that scientists at General Motors and Ford Motor Co. knew as early as the 1960s that car emissions caused climate change. Despite this internal knowledge, both companies engaged in decades of political lobbying to undermine efforts to reduce emissions and invested heavily in gas-guzzling vehicles while financially supporting groups that cast doubt on climate science. The transportation sector, largely driven by cars and trucks, remains the leading source of planet-warming pollution in the United States today.

title: Tesla sets revenue record, makes profit thanks to pollution credit sales to rivals
summary: Tesla Inc. reported its fifth consecutive quarterly profit and record revenue of $8.8 billion, largely due to vehicle deliveries and the sale of environmental regulatory credits to other automakers. The company affirmed its goal to deliver half a million vehicles by the end of 2020, a target that will require significant ramp-up in the fourth quarter. Despite lagging rivals in sales and revenue, Tesla's market capitalization is the largest among global automakers, reflecting investor confidence in the future of electric vehicles.

title: High speed: Tesla breaks revenue record, shares take off
summary: Tesla Inc. reported its fifth consecutive quarterly profit and record revenue of $8.8 billion, leading to a 4.3 percent increase in its shares in extended trade. The company affirmed its goal to deliver half a million vehicles by the end of 2020, despite challenges, and its market capitalization reached $394.5 billion. A significant portion of its revenue came from the sale of environmental regulatory credits.

title: China-made Tesla electric cars to start selling in Europe
summary: Tesla will begin exporting Model 3 sedans manufactured at its Shanghai gigafactory to more than 10 European countries, including Germany, France, and Switzerland, later this month. This move aims to boost sales in Europe, a rapidly growing electric-car market, and leverages Tesla's Shanghai factory as a global production hub. The company also plans to expand its investment in China, doubling production capability and its sales and service network in the country.

title: GM to invest more than $2 billion in U.S. manufacturing to increase electric vehicle production
summary: General Motors announced an investment of over $2.2 billion in its U.S. manufacturing operations, primarily aimed at boosting electric vehicle production. This move is part of CEO Mary Barra's "triple zero" vision and includes significant funding for a plant in Spring Hill, Tennessee, to produce future EVs like the Cadillac Lyriq. GM has committed over $4.5 billion since March 2019 to prepare U.S. sites for EV production with plans for at least 20 new electric vehicles globally by 2023.

title: Electric Vehicle Rebates Are Changing
summary: Southern California Edison (SCE) customers have until December 31 to apply for a $1,000 Clean Fuel Reward rebate for purchasing or leasing new or used all-electric or plug-in hybrid vehicles. This program is ending as California transitions to new statewide EV incentives, with SCE also planning to launch a new program for pre-owned EVs early next year. The article highlights the environmental benefits and cost savings of EVs, along with SCE's contribution to California's clean energy goals.

title: Can American Funds Maintain Its Edge?
summary: This article examines whether American Funds, particularly its parent company Capital Group, can maintain its position as a leading active manager. It highlights improvements in their fixed-income operations and target-date series but also points out challenges such as diminished downside protection in equity funds and concerns about capacity limits. The author suggests that Capital Group has an opportunity to enhance transparency regarding capacity management to further strengthen its position.

title: Lucid reveals the price of its base Air sedan — $77,400 minus $7,500 US tax credit
summary: Lucid Motors has announced the starting price for its base Air sedan at $77,400, which can be effectively reduced to $69,900 for U.S. buyers due to a $7,500 tax credit. This model offers a 480 HP powertrain good for 408 miles and is crucial for Lucid to expand its market reach beyond its more expensive offerings. The company aims to compete with the Tesla Model S, despite it being outclassed in some aspects for a similar price.

title: Blue Lasers for Welding Copper
